r45YAxTNsbPqz2BQDWVcWA.review_text: Love this place!!! Love the food there!!!! If they have more tastes of bibimbap. FIVE STARS!!!!!!!

qNSO-IXfsO_e-ogddClJ-Q.review_text: Kalbi tang. Priceless super home cook meal taste. Feels like I'm at my aunties house. Cucumber kimchi soooo good! Simple good home made taste

Nz1feDY0zsO0pzCzvgrNxA.review_text: This is the only Korean restaurant I eat in the city and it's so good!  Prices are decent and won't make me go broke. I like how this restaurant opens pretty late so I come here often after a session of karaoke a block away. Food is great here! Bi bim bap is one of my favorite dishes here. The red bean paste that comes along with it is sooo good too. I also like the bbq pork box and the seafood pancake. Mmm... AND I love their tea! It has like popcorn or rice grains in it...  I'm only deducting one star because the service is not that great. They don't check up on you often so you might have to ask for more tea and for your bill. And sometimes they forget if you asked for more water or whatever.

FLwY5zLEIgmBr0H-n4eyoA.review_text: Great selection of food and although not so authentic, really bloody good and cheap. Great for take away or eat in and always end up meeting friends in there randomly (they supposedly dont control this but i am not sure about that) gold

6EN6s9RpPrLGyTb1YuPLrg.review_text: My friends and I went during J-Pop Summit and everything in Japantown was packed and had over an hour long wait at a minimum with the Ramen Street, food trucks, and actual restaurants. One of our friends used to live in Filmore, they knew what restaurants were actually good. Considering how packed everything was, having a server say that the wait was only 30 minutes was great.  In the end, the three of us waited for about 45 minutes and there's the place is super small so I'm okay with the wait. However, things from there went downhill. First of all, the service there was horrible. We barely has our server come by wnough to get her attention that we were ready to order. Plus, the table wasn't properly cleaned so sauce dripped onto my friend's jeans. Then we had to move tables because apparently the servers cannot figure out how six people can be seated at a table of four.  Now onto the food itself. How come there was no banchan? I've never gone to one Korean restuarant and had no banchan. I've lways at least had 2 banchan served before my meal and this place is not one of those fusion places where you could look over it. Plus, there was no red chili paste to put with my food. Considering how they didn't really season my food, they should have offered that. The wait for our food was short, but that probably had to do with the quality of the food. I got dol sot bibimbap. The stone could have been hotter since my rice didn't get crispy towards the end. The egg was at the right consistency and they put all the usual vegetables. It was an okay dol sot bibimbap, but nothing that would draw be back to going there.  For the price I paid, I was expected a little more for my buck since I've paid the same amount for the same thing in San Jose. Considering this is SF, I expected better Korean food especially since it is super close to Japantown and there is some good Korean food in the area.

8Q0xnxT-KrvCl2pQF1qsFQ.review_text: Everything about this place is sub-par except 4 two aspects that make this a must if you have over a party of 6-- the korean techno pop (not sure if this is a genre, but sure does sound like it) and the vibe of everyone there being future AA members.  I don't know if i was just really pounded everytime i went there but everyone seemed to have liquid dripping from their tables like us.  The mirrors are a fun way to check out cute k-girls with their bfs while keeping the peace.  Great starting point b4 heading to Do Re Mi Music Box (Karaoke on Post).

0Zudl4h-ba3ZyRffjBzQjA.review_text: People probably think i'm crazy for rating arang five stars but I literally spend 4 out of 7 days of the week in this restaurant getting piss drunk. I get the best customer service here and that's what keeps me coming back.  food is cheaply priced compared to other korean restaurants.  Oh yeah and they always hook it up there with either an omelette or gyoza!

iOIag5QtNIqbqIgHLtiFoA.review_text: I've been going to this place for years ever since college.  I have to say, food has not been the best when I first started coming here.  What brings me back is that it brings back old memories.  Over the years, the quality is actually getting better.    I recently ate here again a month ago with a few friends after spa and I have to say, food was delicious.  We had the dumpling soup, kimchi fried rice, tofu soup, kalbi, and bi bim bap.    The soup tasted clean.  The kimichi fried rice had the hot and spicy kick to it.  The tofu soup was so so but that is because I can't eat really too spicy food.  I loved the bi bim bap.    And the hours are superb with it being open so late.  4 thumbs up!

IfKwuAdOcGur-aW1covIMg.review_text: small but yummmy! short ribs and bi bam bap(?) awesome. cant wait to go back for some more! its right across from safeway so right after u can walk over for some dessert.

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text:
i literally grew up here. should be automatic five stars for having to deal with me through the years, but this isnt a babysitting review. 
  throughout the years, the quality has been fluctuating alot. ask me two years ago, id say go for the soj and some chigae. as of late, i would actualyl go there to eat. i must admit the food is getting better. id rate it a three but for trying to improve their game, plus one star.

oq8cTg3pqBMNYK0I65WK5g.review_text: Ended up here after checkin' out the closing night flick at the SFIAFF at the Sundance Kabuki. We was hongry after the festivities so we beelined it to Arang. It's open late, the food is good. Why not?  The place isn't that big so if you're coming through with 8-10 of your partners, expect to wait. If it's just about 2-4, you're good. We got seated in about 5-7 minutes. I ordered a "hamburger" type plate which looked like a loko moko coz it had an egg too. I was curious so I tried it. Not too bad. It tasted like a Korean loko-moko. Bingo!  Cool late night joint if you're in that area of the Fillmore for some grub after-hours.  I'm gonna back and try the bi bim bap.

mA3Os9shPwJj5CIsGFmpjg.review_text: Can't tell you what actual Korean food is since I've never been to Korea and I'm not Korean. But I keep coming back here!! Maybe it's just so close to work and I'm always in the mood for something warm for lunch and about $10 you get a delicious meal that is quick and fast.   Tip: if you go Monday through Friday, there's lunch specials from 11-4 p.m. Weekends are dinner prices only.   It does get a little packed on the weekends, and they do not take reservations. But it's a short wait.   What I love:   COMBO Lunch for $8.95 and  Seafood Be Bim Bop $7.95,  Regular BI Bim Bop is $6.95 and it's on a hot stone bowl, so your rice is crispy on the bottom and keeps everything HOT.  Spicy Rice Noodles  Short Ribs, you can't go wrong.  Kim Chi Pancake    I'm definitely a FAN!

iotO9nKci6ZEe1nH_LvwfA.review_text: The food here is so good that you'll eat like a pig. So comforting and yummy... I will come here regularly now.   The only complaint was that the beef short ribs weren't as sizzling hot as we'd hoped, and the dol sot bimbimbap was REALLY good but again, would have liked it to be super mega hot. Just sayin'.

cb8meoIGcYU4Wr48KV3rRQ.review_text: My bf and I often use the word "bi bim bap" as a playful way to insult each other, like "Stop being such a bi bim bap."  We say that only because it's fun to say, because we LOVE bi bim bap, especially from Arang!  The week we discovered it, we ate there 5 times in 2 weeks, and the waitresses even gave us free soda the last time we were there.  Arang is great when you want a quick Korean fix, especially when it's late at night and you don't feel like greasy diner food or horrific fast food.  Really reasonable prices!!!  Order the bi bim bap & the spicy pork plate - great combo to share for 2 people.  Even though I like to attack my food when it comes, make sure to let the rice of the bi bim bap sizzle, get crispy and delicious in the hot stone pot.  Just like the method to get great grill marks on a piece of meat, leave the rice alone!  Once you think the bottom has gotten crispy enough, mix in that spicy/sweet/bbq-esque sauce they give you.  I could probably funnel that sauce directly into my mouth because it's THAT good.  The crispy rice, the soft rice in the middle, the beef, and veggies (bean sprouts, spinach and mushrooms) and the sauce from heaven are a delicious combo.  The panchan are okay: tofu, bean cakes, kim chee, and my favorite pickled veggies (usually carrots and radishes).  If you finish a side, they are really nice and will give you more for free, which always happens to me because I only eat the kim chee and the pickled veggies.  One time, they randomly put potato salad in the panchan dish, and I thought I was at Hawaiian Drive-In and not Arang.  However, the service is always quick, and their servers are kind and attentive.  The music will make you go bonkers at times while simultaneously making you laugh or roll your eyes.  Their bathroom is one I would normally try to avoid.  The last time I was there it wasn't particularly clean, and there was a dirty mop in the corner.  Let's hope that the bi bim bap doesn't cause big messes!

BdMDq5SXlDU07wxErRohTw.review_text: Had my usual "let's play catchup" with my friend (picked her up from work) and I told her I was craving for Korean food with TV so I could watch the NBA Finals. She denied the TV request but did take me here for the other request of "no I don't feel like cooking my food and a cheap spot."  Bingo.  We parked at the Safeway lot (probably the unsafest Safeway I've been too since my Hayward days!)  We got seated right away since there wasn't much folks inside and it was early.   Friend ordered the grilled beef box (it came with noodles + gyoza + salad and I forget the rest) and I ordered the grilled short ribs plate (since I was really hungry and needed protein...)  We also shared soju (yellow kind) and off we went with our gossip time.  Food came out pretty quickly. Friend finished her food (just the right amount for her) and my grilled short ribs was good and it satisfied the craving. Meat quality wasn't the best and it wasn't really grilled up to my taste...   Service was friendly and fast. Will probably go back if I have another "must have Korean food" moments but perhaps I should ask myself to reevaluate how much do I really want Korean food over my life!

M9FHUPMUcnH82P-qUYCZLg.review_text: Decent Prices and always open late!   I love their Barley Tea,.  Will definitely come back!

f0ZQPdQ6NQ90bwxd3zMLEw.review_text: This place is good =)   It took awhile for us to get seated because the place is kinda small and we had a big group! Once we were seated they brought out a soup (that was cooked on the table), which was really good and of course they brought out those mini plates of goodies (that you would usually get at a Korean restaurant).   Everything we ordered was delicious!!!! We ordered spicy pork, Korean BBQ, Korean fried rice, and their spicy fried chicken! WOW ... the spicy fried chicken was really good! Should have ordered some to go but it takes awhile to make.   We also had the peach soju =) That was okay for a drink with the family but I would just prefer just the soju!

nPsmZczCPq_VJ6IK2zXatQ.review_text: So, I'm a little bit strange when it comes to Korean food. I never like all the little appetizers they give you and the only things I really like are the omelette thing and Korean-style ramen.  It's hella hard finding Ramyun (Ramen) at the Korean places around Japantown-we did some hard searching and this was the only place that has it. The Ramyun was good for all the reasons I go to a restaurant for Korean ramen-it was hot and spicy, prepared with eggs and they even threw in some shrimp in there.   My friend ordered Seafood Bibimbap and while I'm kinda iffy about beef bibimbap, my friend's seafood Bibimbap was really good! Maybe I'll break out of my rut and try that next time.   The ambiance was cozy and laid-back. It took a WHILE for them to notice that we were ready to order-this is why I wouldn't recommend sitting at any table outside of the vicinity of the counter. The prices are very reasonable (the ones closer to Japantown tend to be pricier), so maybe what you lack in service, they make up for in prices?

6XCZoufB_S-sY6vsxMGd8Q.review_text: Solid 4 star restaurant  Kim chee bi bim bap sondopu (the Korean spicy tofu soup) short rib soup Chicken tonkatsu Kal bi  No.............I didn't have this all by myself.  We kinda did a makeshift family style luncheon for the 3 of us.  I was told by one of my workers that this place sucks.  Truth be told..............It's probably one of the better fast food Korean spots in the area although it is not.    The service was fast, the food was above average, the portion was adequate, and the price was 40 dollars for 5 dishes.  We thought they made a mistake but the food is very reasonable for Korean restaurant standards.  The only thing that caught me off guard was the potato salad that came with the side dishes.

sRoebzEUhHlHwmfzK_vV-Q.review_text: The people are friendly and welcoming. The Korean food is not the gourmet, but still tasteful especially late night with a drink. Definitely do try  boo dae jji gae - a mish mash stew of ramen, spam, kimchi, and all sorts of other goods.

zkWHdDMmfkm0wPl7abCSBA.review_text: I come here at least once a month when I have time. I really like their egg covered shrimp fried rice drizzled with a tangy red sauce. It is MmMm good! My boyfriend usually gets BBQ pork in those boxes or Bibimbap. Arang gives a lesser amount of sides than other Korean restaurants I have been to, but their tea is good. It has bits of crunchy rice pieces in it. They also don't have that liquidy rice dessert (not sure what it's called) in the end, to my big disappointment.   But Arang serves up some satisfactory Korean food and is conveniently located near Japantown if you want to walk around the area a little.

BnEjkNIqA1SocRx9AgKbWA.review_text: Great food and great service.  I've been coming here for years on end and have never been disappointed.

H2Im5jNLw5cvBww91Wg-yA.review_text: I'm giving this place 5 stars based on pure history...10 years of drunken nights here history. The food is OK for the prices they charge, although it looks like they have changed things up a bit.  I'm still nostalgic for the olden days when it was like a scene outta "Cheers" where all the unnies know your name. LOL.   Service quality has gone down but it's always good when the owner is there, she's the best!

4uUspdcp3TZhIGcD5xHQgg.review_text: I only ever get the kimchi fried rice here - not because I don't like anything else, it's because I CAN'T GET ENOUGH!  I'm not even sure that kimchi fried rice is authentic Korean, but it's so addictive.    I like to order for pick-up and take my food to go, because the tables are a little too cramped for my liking.  There ARE a few booths, but not a high probability of you getting one.

kqlN-k5PtDm4MEdwbrPVuA.review_text: Their bento lunch specials are worth checking out.  For $7, it's a good deal.  You get meat, rice, kimchi, japchae, and salad. Their soondoobu jigae also is decent for their lunch special price.  It's not amazing food, but for the LUNCH price it's worth it.

0oYT4_OuVmN_4XWNBt8ypw.review_text: I came here with three other friends and we ordered a bunch of stuff. It's kind of odd to have a korean place not use korean names for their food, but I guess it's to help others out? But japchae is not vermicelli... just saying.   Ordered a pitcher of yogurt soju. $25 bucks for NOT a pitcher. It was good, tasted like juice, very light on the soju though. Definitely not enough to get everyone nice and buzzed even. The "sidedishes" weren't really sidedishes. Also, I agree with others, the potato salad is a really oddball side to have.   We ordered maybe too much:   - Seafood bibimbap * It was a little "wet" for me. There was too much sauce but it was still good. Easy on the sauce next time please.  - Kalbi * How can you ever go wrong? It was a little oilier than usual but still good.  - Pork bulgogi * Good stuff. Always a favorite of mine.  - Some soup dish * Clearly not memorable enough for me to remember it. I just remember it being ok. The others seemed to really like it though.  - Duk Bokki   * Didn't try it but I know everyone loved it, because it was gone by the time I remembered we ordered it * Japchae - Flavorful and delicious as always.   Overall, it was ok to me. Good food generally but nothing very memorable.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: Bi Bim Bap is my new favorite hangover food.  Think about it, a steaming, heaping bowl of rice, meat and vegetables just waiting to please your empty, booze-soaked stomach.  Throw in a tall OB or Hite beer and I'm good to go.  I'll admit my knowledge of Korean dining and restaurants is fairly minimal but I had a great meal here.  The lunch special is pretty good, with that heaping bowl of goodness coming it at $6.50.  Consider it an option when you're "working from home" (i.e. spending all day watching TV and checking your email maybe once every hour because you were too lazy to come in).  Yeah, the crazy techno mash-ups of 80's songs can start to make you feel like you're at a rave but it's not necessarily a bad thing given I walked away from this place with one of those damn songs stuck in my head.  If I had drank like 6 more beers I probably would've started dancing.  The staff were all very friendly when I came.  Being able to park free of cost is a great selling point for me as well.  I think I'll get tanked tonight just so I can come by here tomorrow....

weTYwpnot5dQB2KwI4SKkA.review_text: Let me start off by saying that Arang is what it is, a version of fast food that is Korean. Its kinda like my go to bar, I come in and get what I usually get and don't expect the place to knock me out of my seat. The food is consistant and lately the alcohol prices have dropped, which is always a good thing.   The box lunch/dinner is my go to meal, but their specialties are pretty good when I'm with other people.  Parking is pretty easy with the Safeway parking lot, but the area can get shady after midnight. Plus this place stays open until 2 AM everyday.   A great place to come and drink and snack on some food. The decor is poor and the seating arangment is kinda weird. Like im sitting in a large walk in closet. Service is ok, but something I wouldn't really expect from a place like this. I eat here to not be bothered by staff, not that I don't like that.

QW3LIXu3xwKZ9LiDqf7a_g.review_text: Arang is halfway decent. I think the cool Korean kids all eat here. The servers sure are cool (yeah, they are!) Food comes out quickly.   Some of their dishes are just.. I mean.. not good at all. Some of their dishes are tasty and good for a late night snack. I usually come by after watching a show at Yoshi's. I've had their budaejjigae and kimchi bokeumbab, both were tasty. Their dumplings are a different story. Not a fan :/  They aren't stingy with their banchan and they really do serve a wide variety of Korean food. Is it the best? No. Is it convenient? Yes.

GHu7O0qWxTR9UnRfSeLKPw.review_text: Nice little late night hangout for a quick bite to eat and soju.  They don't close until 2am. All alcoholic beverages are 50% off until the end of February!  So it's only $12 for a large pitcher of flavored soju right now!  You seriously can't get that deal anywhere else. Even at the original price, it's a steal.  Unfortunately, they only offer two kinds of flavored soju which is either lemon or peach.  Actually both flavors taste pretty much the same so it really doesn't matter which one you order.  The soju tastes great and it will get you buzzed before you realize it!  The food isn't anything to rant and rave about but it really isn't bad.  I've only tried the bibimbap and the tofu soup so I really can't say much but the food definitely has a homemade feel to it.  And the two ladies that work there are super nice.  A bit slow and forgetful sometimes on the service end but their friendliness definitely makes up for that.

8Yn37J_Joc8yQdyPWwiYjw.review_text: Arang is one of the most authentic Korean restaurants I have been to. Service is hit and miss: sometimes you have good service and sometimes you have bad service. Food here, however, is delicious! The best time to come is during their lunch hours. Their prices for their lunch menu are unbeatable for the large amount of food you get. You basically get full dinner portions for the lunch items. Their dinner menu basically has the same items as the lunch menu with more entrees but dinner is more pricey than the lunch items.They have the best tofu soup, and seafood bibambap (rice with mixed veggies and seafood in a hot stoneware bowl) in SF. Their seafood pancake is also something you should try! And see if you can get it cooked with Kimchi (only certain servers know you can add kimchi to the pancake to make it a seafood kimchi pancake). They have a variety of non-spicy dishes too for those who cannot handle the heat. They serve lots of banchan (korean side condiment dishes), and these are refillable. You just have to ask the servers to do it. Their entrees are big enough for two people to share. They also serve you green tea with toasted glutinous rice on top. They also have regular sodas, and soju (alcoholic korean mixed cocktails)! You can buy the soju in pitchers.  They play korean pop music at night, and an american light rock music station during the day time.   There is parking on the street, and some people even park in the Safeway parking lot since the restaurant is located in the same plaza area. However do this with caution! I been told that some cars actually do get towed away for parking in the Safeway parking lot!  Other than hit and miss service, and the parking, I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to try authentic Korean dishes.

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: If you are craving korean food, this is the best place to go for some decent korean food.  Some of their items are very authentic and everything is decently priced especially their bento boxes.  This is also a great place to go for drinks before or after a night of fun.

CIyICwrEeEVCuuBUmaSdOQ.review_text: Definitely appreciate the no fuss Korean food.  It is not Chinese - American - fusion anything.  It is just straight up Korean food.    Everything I've ordered has been good.  They have an expansive menu, everything from Kal Bi, Fried Chicken, Soups, Vegetarian dishes, etc...  I LOVE my spicy dishes and Arang definitely spices it up:)

yOwjX9AzCO5Nu9Rw7i3vdA.review_text: This place has a Korean dessert you won't find in most Korean restaurants. It's called "Patbingsu" and it's typically made with shaved ice, fruit cocktail, azuki beans, and some form of milk and/or ice cream. Arang uses all of the above, and also throws in some Cinnamon Toast Crunch-type cereal to the icy mush. $5 for a bowl big enough for two people.  As for the food, I've only had the soon dae (Korean sausage) and ddukboggi (rice cakes and vegetables in a sweet, spicy sauce), which were both decent. This place is more of a casual meal/street food/drinking spot than a regular restaurant. That's why you won't get the full array of panchan with your food.

3TXNWQ-x98YphuVy2HegJA.review_text: I really think this place truly deserves 5 stars. I know before, I rated it 4 stars, but that was 2 years ago, and I've been here a considerable amount of times now to really speak about it. And to top it off, I have a coworker who comes here RELIGIOUSLY - like, I'd say at LEAST once a week, and this is one of her favorite Korean places to eat at in the city.  I came here recently on a lunch break because I was craving something simple. I didn't feel like sitting and eating at a table, so I ordered food to go. I asked for the kimchi fried rice, but EXTRA spicy. And you know what? They did just that!  I'm a simple person (sometimes, HA), and there are days when I have simple requests. I'm just glad that I was able to satisfy my craving for the day. :)

K6oync8h73FZdiwAKtKLmw.review_text: My friend took me to this place -- he said it was really good, not that spicy because I'm not too big on spicy food.  They should have a warning that the stew was filled with peppers - even when I asked the waitress if it was spicy, she said no it's not that spicy.  She offered water to put in, but it wasn't even heated.  She took too long refilling the tea, as well and it wasn't like the restaurant was packed.  Then I ordered something else, and I guess they were in a hurry, half of the beef wasn't even cooked.  The gyoza wasn't even fully boiled/cooked either, but when they pan fried it the other half side was burnt.  I don't recommend this place at all.  The waitress was slow and the food was bad...  I would never ever go there again if they paid me a million dollars.

AUYdwmJ5FTSMmDf6mB5_OA.review_text: Very good beef bento box. Love the vermicelli it comes with. Service very nice and fast. Brown rice tea yummy too.

5F4h38XhqL3qQzB_hJ1x1A.review_text: K-pop music and good korean food.  I was a happy person even though it was raining crazy hard outside and I didn't have an umbrella.  Anyway, I was specifically in awe by the exceptional service from the waitress.  I was so impressed that I left them a huge tip.  They were super busy, but yet so attentive.  Service can't get any better than that.

YkJEYwXijGG7N6KPD_7t2A.review_text: I usually come here either for take out when too lazy to cook something at home, or at 1 AM when the drunk munchies kick in. There is nothing better then a Kimchi Bibimbap on a vodka filled stomach. It's been the best hang over preventer yet!  All in all, the food has been great, and service is good enough for me.

BObvXurm4XQBVBKAWLCeMQ.review_text: I love the tea with rice.  I love their bulgogee.  I love their pancakes.  The first time I ever had Korean food was here, and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  I did return a second time, but the beef wasn't as good as the first.  However you never forget your first, and I'll probably return in the future.  I have no complaints with the service, although the place is a little small.  Parking is easy, as they have their own lot for the small shopping center thing that it's in.

XDQCUG6dB_NntrZNsn5Frw.review_text: One of the few cheap Korean eats in the area. It's a tiny hole in the wall place, but serves up pretty good and authentic Korean food. It reminds me of a hole in the wall drinking places like "indoor pojang macha" or "sojubang" in Korea.   If you like spicy food and spam, you MUST try their Boo Dae Jjee Gae (translation: "Army Stew"). Spicy stew full of spam, hot dogs, ramen noodles, rice cakes, and veggies! It's big enough for 2 - 3 people, maybe even 4 if you order other things.  The menu is full of delicious "anju" -- the dishes that you typically eat when you drink. Think of it as Korean Tapas or Izakaya fare? And of course, they have beer and Soju (Korean version of vodka like alcohol) and mixed Soju (Soju cocktail that tastes like lemonade, among others)  It's a fun place to get in and out for a quick lunch or get totally drunk (just don't drink and drive)  As with all other Korean places, banchan (side dishes) are free and free flowing. :D

KbaLzIBhLJZQ1HJbQXtKSw.review_text: korean food seems expensive these days...  $23 for a large pot of boiling stew:  veggies, spam, ramen.   i think the novelty is its cooking right in front of u on a portable stove, and that's wat im paying for, since the food was just ok. $9 for fried mackerel.  $40 total after tip.

IUnM1pNWewR9Ypnoy8BatQ.review_text: Neighborhood favorite for a non-soondubu-specific Korean spot.  This place has a toooooon of menu options (unfortunately only one soondubu option - my fave) and they do a very good job flavoring each dish.  Didn't blow me away (go to My Tofu House for that) but good, solid place for an easy weekday dinner.  (This should really be a 3.5 star rather than a 4.  ;) )

BHcBUPeCNf0AjJEx1ybS6A.review_text: This place is pretty much a hole in the wall. I never knew about this place until my boyfriend took me there. We've been there quite a few times ever since then. The restaurant itself is small but cozy. If you're looking for something authentically Korean, this place isn't really it. There's more of a Japanese feel to the place rather than Korean (other than the hip Korean music that other Korean restaurants don't play). The waiters and waitresses here are really friendly. The food here is decent and reasonably priced. There's typical stuff like chicken teriyaki bento boxes or beef short ribs bento boxes. Give the bi bim bap a try. It actually comes fresh and hot in a stone pot. Other Korean places just put it in a bowl nowadays. The Beef udon was just okay. Have a taste for yourself. :]

kZzwW0hGHZo00PS2gWFmYA.review_text: Been coming here for over two decades now and always a pleasure...  Kalbi, marinated chicken gizzard, tofu soup, bi bim bap and (of course) soju is always good for dinner.  For lunch, I always loved their arang combo box which consists of tempura, bbq beef, noodles, rice, salad, and a miso soup.

IzTWx3Ik2aUa9QMsFZlrLA.review_text: Where else at 3am in the morning can you you get spicy Korean food, listen to Korean techno pop and delicious miso soup all served by friendly waitstaff? I love the bi bim bap dish here as well as the teriyaki beef box. If you have late night cravings for Korean food Arang might be able to assist your hunger pangs.

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: Good portions and great taste, especially by NorCal Korean food standards.  My friend seems to think they've changed owners or chefs.  I'm inclined to agree since recent visits seem to have tasted better, a jump from four to five stars.  Get:  Man doo gook Kalbi Hae mul pa jeon Bi bim bap Ox tail noodle soup  Can't go wrong with any of the above. I can't handle spicy dishes, which would explain my choices. Their soju concoctions are good too, but I'd stick with the yogurt soju combo.   Small restaurant though, so reserve or come early.

xNUsJR8b1YeKRqIIhaUH5w.review_text: Great little Korean restaurant.  I primarily go here only for lunch and get the bi bim bap. Good stuff =)  Its in a convenient location with plenty of parking since it shares its lot with a Safeway.   Korean restaurant tend to be very expensive so this place is a very nice alternative.

0recrslN1ZXt5dD24bBVjg.review_text: I came here with friends. Going inside man night time is going to be a pain since it going to be crowded inside, but I'm very lucky it was around 2-4pm, so it dead inside LUNCH FTW!!!. :)  Going inside you'll notice you won't be listening to some ehhh American Music instead you get K-POP! SCORE!!!! Thank you! (At least they update their music BIG BANG SINGING MY BLUE!)  TEA IS GOOD!!!!   Anyway The menu is very simple and obviously I order Spicy Pig Pork aka daeji bulgogi (lunch boxes) very good deal, and tteokbokki is recoomended too Food overall wise for me personally I wish it was better, but it still delicious! Dessert who doesn't love dessert because it pretty good and I forgot what my friend order, oh well since I forgot the name of it.  Service is terrible for lunch time becuase they forgot about my table, but I won't complain because it lunch time and it empty anyway and I understand that, but night time BUSY!  Because it a small and crowded place, it so perfect to hang out with your friend, talk, chill, and it warm inside since obviously it cold outside in SF.  FYI BRING YOUR CHARGER because they got plug yeah FTW!

LjkcN27GuWjVeZQQrhwToA.review_text: WAY WAY WAY WAY overrate. i've been saying that for years.  The food isn't that good, the atmosphere is terrible.  I would understand if your drunk at karoke and you stumble in here and you think it's good.  Try to eat here sober. do not bring kids here.

MyRkSyp5BwHqfu58FZ6Iyw.review_text: My fiance turned me onto this place years and years ago.  Another hole in the wall type of place that is really good for some korean food.  I love their Jap Chae, potstickers, beef udon, and kim chee cucumbers here.  This place is good for late night eating or just a night out on the town with some of your girls to have some soju.    I always ask for extra cucumbers when I go because I alone can eat those like no tomorrow.    This place is open really late, so if you are looking for good eats...try this place out.  Their bathroom is a little sketchy is so is their parking lot because it looks kinda ghetto, but other than that...the food is delish.

ir6XtoAr_dYiWYqdID3exw.review_text: I've been here twice and I've enjoyed both times pretty well. I haven't had anything but their jigae and tenjang, so I'm not sure about their other items. But their jigae is pretty delicious. Their side dishes are also pretty good. The service wasn't amazing or anything, but it's better than most Korean restaurants I've been to. It's not ridiculously expensive either. I say it's a pretty decent place to go to. One bad thing is that both times, I had to wait a bit for a seat cuz the restaurant is pretty small. However, I recommend this restaurant and I would definitely come to eat here again!

Gcw3j2jk1MBRdHpOy34DUA.review_text: I'm not that picky when it comes to food but this place uses too much msg on their food. and the prices tend to be high compared to similar restaurants.

2a2oNBUWM8PXDdJihIRNsg.review_text: love their soju here!  food is pretty good as well and is open late.  potstickers, bibimbap, seafood soup, jap chae, sizzling spicy chicken and korean short ribs are delish!

Hj9gGdI2Iz5gmsorFVYyow.review_text: I came here to escape the crazy lines at the Ramen festival at J-town...Only to find a 45 min wait at Arang. But we waited and finally got a table. The service was not that good, but they only had about 2 waitresses and a ton of customers. I felt bad for the waitresses because they were clearly understaffed at the moment.  Anyways, onto the food...overall, not very tasty. The bento box with bulgogi wasn't that good. The meat was dry and not flavorful. The bibimbap looked good, but when you taste it, it is pretty bland. The kim chi fried rice didn't taste that great either. It tasted cheaply made with a bunch of ketchup. The only thing I liked was the seafood pancake and the side dishes. The seafood pancake was crispy and flavorful, especially with the dipping sauce. This is probably the only dish I would order again. There are plenty of better Korean restaurants in the city.

uCaJyY1bGNAQVswrzIEdRA.review_text: i usually get one of their bento boxes....either the bbq beef or the bbq ribs...they are really good.  have also tried their tofu soup and their bim bim bap, which are also very good.  have drank there a few times too...good soju...lots of parking and they are open on the late night.  they've been around since back in the day and i will keep on coming back!

rvWK6CpDWMPjkLlGaKD16Q.review_text: Going to Toyose spurned me to write this review about Arang.  I love this place.  I didn't realize HOW much I loved this place until I went to Toyose with their mediocre food and horrible service.  THIS is the spot to go to for some GOOD korean food/late night food at decent prices. My faves are the combo/bento boxes, rice cake/ramen dish (SO MUCH SPICIER than toyose) and  bi bam bap.  I guess I could try more stuff, but I'm so hooked on the rice cake/ramen stuff.  YUM.  Don't waste your time at Toyose.  Minus one star because when Arang gets busy, the wait can be long...and the waitresses may forget about you in their hustle and bustle (but not purposefully ignoring you like Toyose!)

O5UWPHIktSfDlEkME18vYQ.review_text: Bento boxes are a great deal; less than 10bucks for dinner. Their BBQ Beef is always flavorful and filling. They give out melon gum after every meal for fresh breath.

cc63x9MRwIwQn9QUZVXwKg.review_text: Good quality Korean food in combination with quick service is a good strategic way to drive for my returning business. Although it is located in a sketchy part of the fillmore, the good food and easy parking will get me to come back. Their open late, so if you have that urge for some korean food at 12am, Arang's got you covered !

AUF3-APCh1q_QD8AaMHRhw.review_text: We decided to eat here because it was 10ish and this place was still open. We decided to split everything: short ribs, the spam casserole dish, and a tofu soup.   The ribs were a little touch and the spam in the casserole didn't taste like spam at all. The food was okay but I don't think the quality is worth the price.   PS - They had a really interesting playlist going on in the background. (Korean to Feist to some oldies).  hehe.

x4dMlJWPH-iaNqdDoRwmqQ.review_text: Bone soup with potato! Nice and spicy!

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: closest thing to a soju bang in sf......about $11 for one boo-deh-jji-geh (spicy soup with beans, spam, hotdog, noodles, kimchi, etc.), a small platter of banchan and rice feeds two grown men...use the rest of the money on soju or beers...and it's pretty cheap eats with a good cheap buzz.......the jji-geh and ttangs (soups) are good here....the grilled meats and stir-fried spicy dishes aren't bad either....now stop complaining....

h25yBoD_ttgTOWCjhqMS3A.review_text: I used to live in the area, and found Arang to be pretty reliable.  It's open late, prices are reasonable, and the food quality is better than most of the other Korean places on Fillmore.  It's not awesome, but pretty good.  We've ordered the bibimbap and spicy tofu soup plenty of times.  Last week when we went, we tried the pork bone and beef and potato soup for 2 to share, and it was yummy and hit the spot.  Only problem was we got really thirsty afterwards (makes me wonder too much msg?).  And the place is really small.  Once, we encountered a late noisy drunk group next to us that was annoying since we weren't in the mood for it and in that space we can hear everything.  It's probably unavoidable though, so we go if we think we won't be too bothered by it.  And it doesn't happen all the time.

qVKfU2bsumZxzNCHS6-dDg.review_text: Came here with a few friends because one of them suggested this place for Korean food. Man is this place a tough spot to find when driving down the street! It is not visable to people who drive. They need bigger signs! Parking is a b**** around here as well!   We ordered a pitcher of cocktail soju (which was a rip! The "pitcher" was more like a small at other places and it was very light on the alcohol), seafood bibimbap (which was weird that did had already put the sauce in there for you. How are you gonna tell me how salty/spicy I want it?), Pork bulgogi and Kalbi (which they were generous about and they were both pretty good), Japchae (which was oddly watery and was like it was SOAKED in soysauce or something), and Duk Bok Ki (my favorite korean bar dish so I can't complain).   They were cheap about the side dishes. Who does that? This place! When I tried to ask for more, they tell me they had ran out. W.T.F? Seriously? How are you going to lie to my face when I see other people getting seated and being served that? LAME!

w3HfQxcj_XkubBpmml71xA.review_text: I had the #3 lunch special of BBQ beef ribs for $8 - 9, with beef, salad, vermicelli, potato, and rice. IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS~! I was super stuffed yet still craving for more beef. The only disappointment I had was with the free side dishes, maybe I've been spoiled by the other Korean restaurants I've dined at, but they were very tiny portions.  I usually cannot handle spicy food, but the kimchi here was just perfect.  Can't wait to come back!! :)

gT53mQcqdy9u7fcN2XJfaA.review_text: This place has definitely changed.  The quality and portion of their dishes have gone way down hill. I know they have changed management a few years back but c'mon, don't you see people complaining about your food an earshot away? I came here with my family before they changed hands and their food kept me coming back. I 've always ordered their combo box with beef and tempura and let me tell you, their beef was perfectly marinated and very edible. Now, their beef is chewy, full of fat, no flavor and I can't even swallow it because I can't get passed how chewy and fat the beef was.  Yuck! Service was also slow, too.

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: Decent Korean food that's open late night.  ... One time , they ran out of jap chae. How did they run out of jap chae!? *sobs*

Jpq1pHiNSYg0zC1XW4Pcvg.review_text: the side dishes are awful, but the kimchee fried rice is good and cheap. that's basically the one thing i keep coming back for.

58VeQ6Lfyl7MEQTYE8CkkQ.review_text: This is actually my favorite local go-to restaurant for late night eating. Open until 2am, plenty of parking in the Safeway lot, small homey feel, and most important good, relatively cheap food.  Been here on several occasions now but tonight solidified the 4 stars. It's been CONSISTENTLY good. They serve no frills Korean food, tofu soups, bi bim bap, chap chae, fried rice omelet, yu ge jang, etc. They also have the grilled meats but they cook it in the kitchen and not at your table.  Tonight I had the Soon Du Bul ($8.95) and it was hot, spicy, full of flavor, and contained fresh hunks of tofu. VERY satisfying on a cold SF evening. My cousin had the Yu Ge Jang ($9.95) and that was super yummy too. Spicy beef soup, more pure beef taste, more broth, no tofu. Really good.  I've had the casserole for 2, dok bok gi, and a variety of other dishes. I have always been happily satisfied. The only downsides are the unexciting pan chan or small side dishes. It's usually a cabbage, a cucumber, potato salad, bean curd, and egg served in one of those multi-divisional plates (like the ones used for little kids). Service can be splotchy too.  But I can overlook all that in favor of the good food, under $10 entrees, and barley tea. Oh and of course, the crowning melon gum at the end of the meal. Who can resist that?

0nZE-lIbYwPFcIHuBUkFWA.review_text: let me start off by saying this - one of the best  korean restaurants ever! If you are looking for really authentic korean food then i probably wouldn't come here... i'd go a block down on fillmore where there are other korean restaurants that are more authentic. anyways, the prices aren't bad ... me and my friends come here when we're craving korean late at night or after we've finished going clubbing.. i love it because they usually open up until 2am! It's also good to come here during lunch because their prices are even cheaper! Whenever I come here i always order the bento box - the beef short rib, rice, chop che, 2 potstickers, vermacelli, pieces of potato... and i can't remember the rest.. the flavor of the beef was quite delicious and plus they give you a good amount of food. As i recall, the tempura wasn't up to my standards - maybe because it  isn't a japanese restaurant. it was kind of soggy. The bi bim bop was also good too! Let's see what else, the only downside about this place is that on weekends there can be a long wait because the place is small and service can be slow at times. I've never had a bad experience here... all i know is that this place is good for drinking alcohol with friends and eating your heart out to some good korean food! =)

x1paA3aUHJTurbtFkBSOGg.review_text: Good value for what you get.. I like to get the kal bi dinner which comes with a lot of stuff... (vermicelli, rice, gyoza, salad.. etc)... and they give you a good amount of meat.. their other items like the ramen the pot thing is really good... and seafood pancake is yummy. Oh! and their soju is good too! The place is pretty small.. so expect a wait sometimes...

n_fPgOb65OH5TV7pmj9TrA.review_text: Quick, easy and friendly service for lunch.  No real stand outs but consistent quality.

m9qwN28RHm7PLmcDsj7Qpw.review_text: They have the best Dol-sot Bibimbap and the best peach soju. The Kimchi soup was also tasty (very very spicy) and the tiny appetizer dishes as well. Been coming here for 6 years. There was a waitress who was always there the first few years that I've been eating there and she was very nice and helpful; but the last few times that I was there, I didn't see that nice waitress anymore and the service became lacking. Although the food pretty much makes up for it, ergo the 4 stars.

aFO_yCma7PImpdPkA8ZC-A.review_text: I used to hate cutting my meat when I was a kid, especially whenever I was eating kalbi because I would first have to cut the meat away from the ribs then cut it into manageable portions. That's probably one major reason why I like this place, they already cut the meat off of the bone for you and into good-sized portions. That's two less steps between me and putting yummy short ribs into my tummy.   I've been here countless times now and this is one of my top spots to grab some inexpensive and satisfying Korean food. I always order the kalbi bento box whenever I come here now. I've tried a few of the other items on the menu the first few times that I ate here, but I've found my favorite so I'm sticking to it.

V5v0gkeIJ5SCr3bUDfxSkQ.review_text: Arang has basic Korean food at fairly inexpensive prices. I especially love their peach soju and bibimbap (rice and veggies in stone bowl).  Everything else doesn't stand out too much though. It's a great hang out for drinks and snacks; I think that the main reason why most people go there. Plus, they open fairly late.   It's a rather small restaurant with approx 8 tables. There's not much privacy and the background music is fairly loud. So, definitely not a date restaurant but it's a good place to hang with friends over a bottle (or ten) of soju. Most of the waitress do not speak English well so don't expect to customize your food. But they're very amiable and nice. So if you want more kimchi, just ask!   BONUS: It's right next to a Chinese karaoke place. So, if you want some entertainment after the drinking... =)

CP7ECIG5MXbZ18LKN2mzrA.review_text: SF doesn't have great Korean food so instead of going to a half ass over priced place, I'd rather come to Arang for some cheap fast Korean delights.  Food is consistently good and service for a Korean restaurant is pretty decent.

2KQ1DV0w2GmitBesDy4nEA.review_text: Mmm.... korean food. Need I say more? Of course!  Let's see... when I came here I believe we got kimchee fried rice, seafood pancake, and the spicy rice stick-- dukbokki.   Food was good, tea was good. The above items are usually my "go to" items because they're my all time favorite.

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: I haven't been here in a while but my intentions for going to this place very rarely involved food and I always went late at night.  Back in the day (see, I'm old school), I used to go for peach soju.  Before I learned to really drink alcohol, I needed sweet, candy like drinks.  I also got my little sister plastered on accident on one occasion.  I am a bad unni.  However, I think this taught her not to drink too much when she started college and she's now almost a doctor so maybe it worked out for the best.  For the memories,  I give it a 4.

3EAHMMsNnN4rrQVPPuzdnw.review_text: The food here is very average, but it seems to have a nostalgic feel for a lot of locals. Otherwise, for the average person, I don't think this place holds any value.  BBQ short rib bento box ($12) was ok Seafood udon ($12) was not very good Free barley tea Good service Take out available   Tip: don't park your car in the lot over the time limit. There is a person who walks around checking.

nnQ29jum6Nh8MVuNne4F_A.review_text: Came in here for some take out. Got the chicken teriyaki. The chicken was OK, but the real stickler was the amount of food for the money (10.50) for what should be a $6-7 lunch entree. I've had better Korean food.. I'd probably go back if they lowered their prices by 2-3 across the board, but there are other Korean restaurants to try in the area!

dQOr5lcgscc9tYxYKyoUwg.review_text: Second review...  I took korean fried chicken and galbi soup!   Not sure why people told me that SF doesn't have any good korean food. Worth the drive from anywhere around the city.  Best Korean food  I've been to so far, and I've been to a few (Brothers, Wooden Charcoal, Korea House, To Hyang, etc).   The overall quality of the food was really good. Not quite LA K-town good, but pretty darn close. I don't want to hype this place up, but it's by far the best Korean food you're going to find in the city.   Parking was no problem either although we went for lunch.  (safeway mall) All in all you if you are craving Korean food this is place to go hands down.

BWhizsebWRBo1D-JjmXlHQ.review_text: Took a little time to find this restaurant. You can't see it from the street. It's around the corner from a Subway Hut a little ways along some open space. Very small storefront where the door is.  I'm a fan of everything Korean (I'm Chinese). Discovered a Korean dessert called Patbingsu which is really good. I think Arang is the only restaurant in SF that has it (at least mentioned on Yelp). Found 2 places in Santa Clara and 1 in San Mateo. I started off with dinner. I had the Soft Tofu Soup. It was only $9.95 and was decent size. Not the smallest or biggest I've ever had. This place has Japanese and Korean food and lunch specials. Have to try the Fried Chicken tossed with Spicy Korean BBQ sauce (I've made it myself before. It's less messy to have someone else make it). I'm going to have to try other dishes. Prices are reasonable. Saw another table that had this relatively large metal bowl over a portable stove that had noodles, spam, sausage, vegetables in a spicy broth. Have to try that next time. Ordered my Patbingsu. Took only about 5 minutes for them to bring it out. It was sized for one. Had ice shavings, red beans, corn chex flakes, fruit cocktail, a little ice cream and thinly sliced banana. I finished the whole thing. Only $5.95. I forgot to take a pic of my food. Next time. Service was decent. No issues. I'll write another review after I've tried a few more dishes.  Atmosphere in the place was nice. Only had about 8 tables in the place. So probably not good for groups. Not sure if there is a back room or upstairs. Music system played a mixture of English and Korean music. Not too loud.

3c705xYacUdsFuHx1rxzwA.review_text: I love love love Arang.   I give it 4 stars because K-pop sucks and they play loud K-pop. Other than the music, food is great! Decor is just like the restaurants that i used to go to when I was in high school/college in Korea, where students like to go.   Straight up Korean food that reminds me of home.   Their sea food stone bibimbap is their forte, i think. Everything is good....  i haven't tried their soft tofu stew since there are other korean restaurants specializing in soft tofu.

UVs_7nPjqK_W_ap96IClpA.review_text: After a quick look around the area we found this small Korean restaurant in the corner and decided to give it a try.   Arang is a quite small place with quick service. We were seated immediately and ordered a tofu soup for me and a bibimbap for my boyfriend. Usually at Korean places you are served banchan, the side dishes of kimchi, soybeans, cucumbers etc before the actual meal comes but at this restaurant we didn't receive our banchan tray until the main meal arrived which was kind of strange.   The tofu soup was just okay, not anything stellar but it had A LOT of tofu in it. It was difficult to find anything else in the soup (aka meat) since everything was tofu lol The broth was a bit spicy but tasted good and they give you a side of rice. I still think it was overpriced for what it was though. The bf thought the bibimbap was pretty good but not anything overwhelmingly awesome. In the end our stomachs were satisfied but I'm not going to make this my go-to Korean spot anytime soon.

alEd1mZ_l-DVtS3Ar5bMLA.review_text: Pro for a restaurant in J-Town: A free parking lot.  Arang is on the corner and is a relatively small restaurant.  Arriving at 12:00 pm sharp, we got in just in time to beat the lunch rush at 12:30 pm.  It is very affordable for Korean food lunch, and the servers are very friendly.  The bulgogi box is under $10.  The food tastes more like Chinese-Korean fusion though.  The jap chae noodles tastes chow-mein-like.  The bulgogi is a bit bland.  You also get two pot stickers that are more reminiscent of Chinese style cooking than Korean food.  If you are looking for a relatively affordable lunch box, then Arang is a good spot.

MHkTSljlyKaKAdu286n0XQ.review_text: Ordered the Kalbi which was plentiful but chewy. Yukejang was pretty spicy, not bad. Nan (our usual place) which is next door is way better but we just had to try this place our given the reviews it had. Nice people but food quality just doesn't even come close to Nan.

b1dScDr7N9XuUSZ_LA2C3w.review_text: One of the best Bi Bim Bap I have eaten in the bay area! Their other food is really good too but I usually always get bi bim bap just because it is the item to get!  Their tea is really good but I always have a hard time getting refills :( They really need to work on their service.

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: I love this place.  They are generous with the portions and the service is pretty good.  It's a small place, so you might have to wait to be seated.  The bathroom is really nasty and you have to park at the ghetto Safeway parking lot, but other than that, it's worth it for the food!  The dohl-soht-bi-bim bap is really good and the bento boxes are good too.  The pork cutlet dish is generous and really good!  I can always count on this place for a great dinner b/c they are consistent!

ubmbxYDfthzthk3RpjkvlA.review_text: Yay! Quick service. Good tempura, udon, and teriyaki! A lot of food for not much money.

uZg1FZbO99YnX61Hw3fd3Q.review_text: Ahh yes, went here last night for nibbles but mostly booze.  Havent been back here in years. Their prices are decent.  Usually other places would charge a bit more for their booze.  We arrived at 11pm and it was dead.  5 min later the crowds began pouring in and we didnt leave until 2am.  Edamame 3 Large OB Lagers 2 bottles of Chamisul  Service: Attentive and the tea was pretty good as a chaser..yeah...I said it.  Parking is plentiful.  The waitress was cute but appeared to be overworked.  I hope she gets the tip I left her.

6DsSoxqIKMSfR36xeILqKQ.review_text: mmmmmmmmmm..hungry just thinking about Arang!  i can't forget the good ol' days of late night runs to this joint back in the college days.  back when QUANTITY + low price meant absolutely everything.  if you're into authentic korean dishes and a ton of banchans (small side dishes), this really isn't the place for you..however, if you're like me and enjoy boonshik (appitizers), you really can't complain!  recently my cousin and i paid a visit to this place while contemplating on a place to eat late night after shopping and a movie in the city.  my cousin was from out of town so i suggested this place..and she loved it!  between the two of us, we had a dolsot bibimbap, ramen tukboki, soon dooboo chigae, and a peach soju..(we were really REALLY hungry =D)  all that food and we ended up paying under $40 after tips and all.  i think most of the dishes ran around $6~10.    we were there past midnight on a friday night and the place was jam packed.  food was good and service wasn't too bad either..and this place has been around forever!  these things make it obvious why i love this joint and have me keep on coming back whenever i'm in the area..

bZ-Okc714XHtIkadbKogmA.review_text: The first time I came here was after waiting about 3 hours to get into Toyose and finally giving up. We were told the wait would be 2 hours and after coming back in 2 hours we were told it would be 2 more. Some regulars outside told us chances are we wouldn't get a seat no matter how long we waited. So I was so thankful we ended up coming to Arang because we were seated promptly and people working there were very nice and friendly. The food isn't as good as what you'll get at a place like Meogeoboka or Ohganae but it's quite a lot cheaper and still tasty. Here's what I recommend here:  Sea food bi bim bap - actually very good even compared to other more expensive and nicer Korean restaurants  Beef bone and potato casserole - tasty and spicy, it has chunks of beef on the bone, potato, sprouts, jalapeno, other green thing, in a spicy broth. If you order the large one it can be enough for 3-4 people no problem.  Sea food pancake   Mussel soup - I try to always end the night with this. It's so soothing and tasty, just mussels, white onions, green onions, jalapeno, salt and pepper.   Soju cocktail - lemon one tastes the best for me   I also really have a crush on the waitress working here on Saturdays. She's really cute and nice. My friends think she's a little old for me but I think it's ok because she's so friendly. So that's a plus!   So, I give it 4 stars because I don't think the food is really AMAZING like places in LA or Oakland or Korea House in Hayward, and the panchan is not really very good, but I always have a great time here and the food is good.

1dlMJzMeJHI8oLgPAU3yOA.review_text: I loooove the soups here. I have been coming here for about 5 years now. Great place to cure a hang over, or just fill your belly with something tasty. Open real late so that is a MAJOR plus. :D

sjXDLpvcrMldagWJJDlBTQ.review_text: i came in with relatively not-high expectations, and i was definitely not disappointed. we had the yukejang and pork bulgogi, and i thought both were pretty tasty. yukejang was semi-spicy, but i would have preferred a bit more heat. the bulgogi came in a nice sweet-but-not-overly-sweet sauce that seemed to have a bit more red pepper than normal; always a plus in my book. the panchan was nothing to write home about.  i know other reviewers have commented on the rude staff, but they were great in my opinion. even though it was pretty busy, they definitely responded quickly to requests for more water and rice.  price-wise, this is one of the more affordable korean restaurants i've been to in sf. especially considering the atmosphere is still pretty cute. we went on a saturday, but i hear it can be pretty empty other nights.

JKjAkzG79bJRfTxpxgkLiA.review_text: Very yummy. Best Korean food in town. Descent price. Kimchi soup is the best.  Bi Bim Bap is a must try!

wpTZdFaOITAco8evnTtBUA.review_text: Korean is my favorite food!  I love how there are so many side dishes that complement the main dishes so well and induce an orchestrated medley of flavors and spices in your mouth!   Arang is pretty decent for Korean food! Get the spicy pork and try to stay away from the bul-go-gi if possible, as it is sub-par.  But the spicy pork is hella good, with just enough spicyness and sauce to cover the rice.  I love the bento boxes that also come with dumplings, salad, and potato crisps.    I would definitely recommend this place a chill meal, without the steep prices of many Korean restaurants in SF.  Oh how I miss the cheap and better tasting Korean food of LA K-Town...

iDjoaO9_JlSdPpqvFB4o-A.review_text: This little place is pretty hard to find. The only way to see this place is its front door. There isn't really a window or view of a sign to see. And the entrance points towards the safeway.   The people are pretty nice. I have been here twice. They accidentally gave us the wrong food. They felt bad and didn't charge us for it. I liked their food. It was good. The rice thingy was great! The bbq ribs were alright. They had a different twist to it. it was like 3 long ribs.   Generally pretty good, the best korean food that I have in the bay area. Of course, is nothing compared to LA though.

Ptg_Zx6epNnBVuzIAW0IPQ.review_text: Decent korean place. dont expect good service, dont expect extra bachan ? ( pardon my spelling ), dont expect the waitress remember to refill you tea/water. bottom line, dont expect me to come back here !

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: FOOD & DRINK: 1.) House tea = Holy cow their tea is good! ;) yummy love the rice or whatever it is in it. 2.) Dol Sot BiBimBap = mm! but with Shitake mushrooms. (Shitake mushrooms personally leave a weird aftertaste for me) But this was completely satisfying my bibimbap craving 3.) Kim Chee Tofu Soup = More sour  SERVICE: Not bad.  ATMOSPHERE: Such a hidden little korean spot! Like a secret door in the corner of the plaza on Fillmore/Safeway. It's chill though, very casual.  10.9

3nie2a6SfbWWv_GW0mlIdg.review_text: 1/2 OFF ALLL (YES ALL!) LIQUOR FOR THE MONTH OF FEBRUARY!!!!!!  me and my hot date (aka female gal pal) got to drown our single sorrows in alcohol by getting drunk off 2 pitchers of soju on valentine's day...for $24 total!   this alone garners 4 stars.  now if that ain't a damn good deal, i don't know what is. not to mention the awesome bibimbap and bento combos. yum!  p.s. dont get the tofu soup thing. NO GOOD!  mmm. peach soju..

Tz1FRUGfq7xBf4-ZGlvLZg.review_text: mmm cheap korean food and cheap soju! woohoo!!   go for the lunch boxes, they're cheap and pretty decent. not too sure about the chicken katsu though, didn't have much flavor. well tasted more like chicken nuggets, but in a bad way.

ag0k5lpmHYra9ikPqhzotw.review_text: what?! half off drinks?! i'm so there... hahaha... their dinner combo's are pretty good... apparently so is the bibimbap... the soup is yummie... cheap... filling... more than half way decent... half off beers? woohoo! sure the music playing is like freakshow on acid but your brain will ignore it soon enough...

_fysG2M3W_6UZNkAuqiZ9g.review_text: I JUST HAD THE BEST BIBIMBAP here. It was so good that I almost burned my mouth because I was eating too fast. Definitely order Dolsot Kimchee Bibimbap, if you like spicy food!  I came here on multiple occasions, All the Korean dishes are usually pretty good! Only complaint was that Hamburger steak portion is kind of small, so you would still be hungry.   I just wish they had a tad better service, especially during late night.   Can't wait to try more dishes here. I will be back for my Korean food cravings!

sTW0gS1reTlPhrZYCDKH7A.review_text: Came here for a quick takeout order to order Duk Gook for my boyfriend since he wasn't feeling anything too spicy. The order was pretty large, and tasty. I ordered the kimchee fried rice to-go and it was a bit spicy, but not bad. I was only disappointed in the portion of the rice though.

bthMSDLzNdHuSskOfaeZhw.review_text: Since my apt is right by this restaurant, i go there at least once a week. Food is great, i love their kimchi fred rice and pork feet! Theri service is ok but not great.

CDwi_CYF3c_E80bdysF-cA.review_text: Came here for dinner.  And, it was just okay. Nothing too memorable, but nothing was awful.      Fried chicken -crispy fried goodness. Super bland.  But, they give you a salt rub with a mayo sauce that you can dip into making it extra flavorful.   Kimchi stew (for 2) -HUGE pot of food that can easily be shared for 3!   Seafood Pancake -pretty good, but I've had better.  I wish the pancake was more crispy.   Peach Soju -so delicious!    Word of advice!  Don't park in the lot next to the restaurant if you're planning on staying longer than 2 hours!  It's run by safeway and golden gate towing company comes and tow you!  It was pretty big damper on the night.

cEWz1r4RJDJ_E0r53sCh0w.review_text: Went here a bit back and I really enjoyed my dinner! I got the soft tofu soup and my friend order the seafood bibimbap, and we topped that off with an order of kimchi pancake.   Ok, so my tofu soup was spectacular, it hit every good point you want a dish to hit. Taste, presentation, quantity...  I was satisfied. My friend's order was pretty decent, according to her own review, but to be honest, bibimbap is bibimbap, you know what I mean?  However, the kimchi pancake wasn't too good... It was just really thick and doughy, even after we specially ordered it to be thinner and extra crispy. I wouldn't recommend anyone to get that.   Sidenote: alcohol sale going on there. We didn't order any, but Arang has signs posted around the shop about it. Enjoy!

4I7aa289QLmeKm-YabKbYg.review_text: Came here on a full stomach....but how do u refuse SPAM and hotdogs over ramen cooked at the table in spicy Korean broth??? You can't...not even when ur on a crash diet two weeks before your birthday...F the dress I need to fit into, right?  Then there was the omelette thingy with the sweet mayo sauce...that was good too.  They could have a better variety on their sides and shoju flavors though :(

rkNompzu7K-rrsx-60PAGw.review_text: I have been eatiing here for 5 years I never write a review for this resturant , I the early year which is last 5 years I wold say this resturant is excellence,  good service and good food but in the pass 2 years the servers have changed and the service are bad make me just want to take it only togo.

bXjywxQEN-TPs99IG2s6EA.review_text: This is our new "go to" spot (our being me and my bf).  go to because we're too lazy to cook  go to because it's easy  go to because there is no food in the fridge  go to because it's cheap to eat, drink and dessert for less than 15 bucks a person  go to because it's right by where I live  go to because they do to go orders and it's good alternative to the fast food in the neighborhood and can feel more fufilling compared to Panda Express, Taco Bell/KFC, Subway & Popeyes  go to because they give you that damn good melon gum with your check -- as opposed to your typical mint  go to because they have good hours and are open late  but i guess if it weren't local, we probably wouldn't go to it as much.

N7BVcUvWh4lZW4UuNiG5wA.review_text: i have  never been in here truth be told, but i checked in because i like it! they have KFC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! KOREAN FRIED CHICKEN. thats my fave. it should be every chicken lovers fave. they have bento boxes of that sort but not a lot of sides. they have BOMB ASS GUM ! at the end! :] MELON KOREAN GUM, i went to kukje to look but they dont have it. their bul go gee isn't bul go gee... its some soup thing. so AT moved on, but i gotta try their bi bim bap! I liked it when AT got it for me from mama's in south city so i'll be back.

VRNF7v9PRqnfU3XpNmRxpQ.review_text: decent korean fast food place... they have a variety of dishes on their menu which are tasty, but nothing beats the food at restaurants in korea...

SBU7a92hAAbOJGNo32jwyQ.review_text: I have been here about 3 times since I moved to the area. They have good short ribs and the spicy soft tofu soup is decent. My only complaint is the service. They seem to only have 1 waiter, and he's pretty careless. I finished my lukewarm tea by the time he brought our side dishes,  so I asked him for more tea. He said, OK, and seemed like he was going to go get it, but then he didn't. I saw him on the other side of the counter just standing around looking unsure of himself, and then eventually he brought us our dinner orders, but still no tea. So, I had to ask again. He finally brought me another cup of tea, and it still wasn't even hot. Then we had to chase him down once we finished eating to get the check. And I mean we literally had to get up and find him because he was nowhere to be seen.  90% of what I eat is asian food so I'm used to bad service but it is tiring sometimes to have to run after a waiter when there are only 3 other tables for him to wait on lol.  Overall, food is good, service sucks. Good place to go when it's late at night and you're craving korean food.

X6FILzWJ83X39hiydbVV5Q.review_text: Arang is the typical Korean restaurant. The price is pretty cheap for its big portion lunch menu but the taste is just meh... I've experienced better. That's why I give it a 2** The tofu soup was notably bad. The tofu was burnt and it tasted just plain bad. The tea is the only thing that I think deserve better than 2**. Maybe 4**** because I like tea? But will you go to eat Korean when you just want to order their tea?

3f7MIZCMma9qHrYiaQZzOA.review_text: I liked this place because it isn't one of the many places in SF where you have to wait in line.  -Seated immediately -Decent food -Large variety  -I would go again

59QzQ3-dmOD1USV2hQpwkw.review_text: If you're looking for good Korean food here, you'll probably be disappointed. This place will serve after-hours if you beg in the native tongue though (even in badly broken and heavily-accented varieties), so 3 stars.

6ATfXxQLQuRAQ30-nLI6Yg.review_text: Shmeh.   My GF and I ordered to go, and I therefore am keeping this at 3 stars.  I want to be careful here, since as we all know the star system is very complex.  I like to review on a relative basis.  I'm going with 3 stars, because relative to OTHER korean BBQ places, that's what it deserves.  Compared to the typical "asian take-out food" whether that be chinese vietnemese thai etc, I woudl have given them a 4.  Korean BBQ places (in my humble opinion) should be judged on 3 things.  1) tea 2)Kimchee 3) Spare Ribs (this is the important one.  Bi bim bab is important too, (and the spicy tofu soup don't get me started) but since I went tog0 I didn't want to end up dissapointed.    1)  tea was bomb.  I liked it.  They had the cracked rice or whatever in there that pleased me immensley.  2) Kimchee was acceptable.  i won't say out of this world, but it was nice and the spice level was good, not great.  3) You know you'll be dissapointed with spare ribs when they aren't attached to bones.  I'm sorry, but maybe I'm just an old soul... but they just taste better when they're cooked on teh bone!!  They were still tasty and sweet.... just missing that boneful -oompha you'd hope from a BBQ Korean tasty beef meal!  The assortment of sides we had were good too.  Gyoza was tasty, and teh virmacelli (no  I can't spell..) was really really good.  Maybe it was cause we went to go, but the tempura was sub-par and chewy rather than crispy.  Good enough for me to reccomend as a togo meal anytime; particularly near that filmore area.  I'll be back to sit down and see if quality gets better or not.

nXsMrhO9c9dO--Jbi5CHYg.review_text: This place gets a 3 overall. I've had better korean food elsewhere.  However, the one thing that they do very excellent here is the Seafood Pancake.   I give the pancake 4.5 stars. I would come here, get a seafood pancake (or 2) some soju and continue your meal somewhere else.   I often dream about this seafood pancake... its so good.

7PiAgQRsPatB2Bt3Bg5Eag.review_text: I live in this neighborhood for almost 4 years, I have been here often. However, today I took a dog walked in and would like to order a lunch to go, after they accepted my order, a woman came to me said "we don't allow dogs inside." At the same time, I heard the other two dogs barked under the table at dining area, those two dogs we had just met 10 mins ago. They even don't allow me wait in the waiting area... I walked out and looked at the entrance, they do not have any signboard about not welcome dogs...I felt upset in a beautiful afternoon. Especially, I have been wait over 20 mins outside, they didn't give me the lunch until I walked in and saw my lunch was on the table. I seems like a idiot waiting for long time, and when I came home, the lunch box was cold already. At this point, I decided I would never go this restaurant, 'cause I am a dog friendly person, and I want to defend all dogs rights.

NRYbf_1MgHkbZW5gnQ2CAw.review_text: I was tempted to give Arang 5 Stars because of the memories I have here, but definitely 4 Stars because of the food.  The staff here are always friendly, quick and attentive.  I'm a sucker for Korean food and have visited numerous Korean restaurants around the city.  Each booth here sets an intimate ambiance where you and your friends can catch up, have caual conversation and enjoy good food.  The side dishes are always good.  Sometimes I have no idea what I'm eatting, but it's awesome!  Pickles radishes, Kim Chi, Sardines, veggies, egg pancakes, kumandu, you name it, it's on the menu.  From the bulgogi to the clay pots, you'll always have the home cooked meal that's filling and satisfying.  I'm not picky when I go here, my friends and I order family style and everything is good, I mean it, literally everything.  Arang you ARE the Business!

IAEK9immhpvBWPNxHZlmwg.review_text: Cannot get enough of this place...I can eat this everyday & everynight!! I always get the Arang Combo w/ beef or chicken. comes with... * Potstickers (Gyoza) * Vermicelli Noodles * Shredded Potatoes * Tempura * Rice & Salad Cost: $10 Arang Restaurant [click below - pictures] xanga.com/icantsee?nextd…

w3musZiQq_HGkv-QEReuiw.review_text: pretty darn good korean food for a good price

_E8fCCrB9T4wZnX8CsS75A.review_text: bi bim bap isn't hard to mess up...but I have to say I have tasted better. It just wasn't very good. The rice was too mushy and the veggie weren't good.  I gave it a 1 star because of the service. My friends and me wanted change for our bill, but our waiter assumed ALL the change was for tip. uh...yeah right? you barely talked to us and we had to wave you down to get our bill.

IHsvZOsJ4XNdRrEakt65uw.review_text: Open very late night! It's not a bad place to go! Open until 2am everyday~

kap-a51yfAh4HeJFlHMS7A.review_text: Good decent Korean food when you're feeling the urge.  Everything is ok, and I've had better Korean short ribs.  For the price that you're paying, it's decent food and decent portion.  Too bad the location is not in the best area and the service is really just medicore.  If they stick you in a corner table, forget about re-fills of tea, water, extra fork or anything b/c they will rarely check in on you.

UKZWWUUntrHZD4btnGcx1g.review_text: I have been visiting this restaurant for years and always had a great experience. Food is great, price is reasonable and service is fantastic. I also had many catering from Arang, and I couldn't possibly happier than that. I recommend highly for catering also. Thumb up!

68WJVsJDy_6kCk2-mAAKSQ.review_text: Okay, i'm not writing this review for people who haven't been here.  I know...kinda defeating the purpose of this whole Yelp thing but i don't care.  The food isn't the greatest Korean food that SF has to offer and its not the cheapest either.  I go strictly to get wasted on soju with my friends and eat random stuff from the menu.  I likey me some soju. (i'm asian, i could talk like this)  I also likey me the little area with the mirrors.  This allows me and my friends to check out the chicks that walk in and sit down.  If the soju is hitting exceptionally  good that night, maybe I'll bring up the nerve throw a wink and a smile.  This, in turn, compels said chicks to eat their food faster and leave asap so the next group of eye candy could sit down.  score.  the k-pop music in the background? well, lets just say it gets the labido going.  just kidding. its sounds like Korean Britney Spears or NSync half the time.  If only i spoke Korean...  i'd tell the waitresses to change the CD.  anyways...3 things that keep me going back.  Peach Soju, Lemon Soju, and Hite Beer.  I could easily buy these at a Korean supermarket, but it's more fun when you're looking at chicks. Through mirrors of course.

gWHmcF3WT6_8yi7lTRJ08A.review_text: I came here with two of my friends and was hoping for some good Korean food. I was not super satisfy after leaving the restaurant.  The food was blend and the only thing i thought i order was good was the gyoza in my Korean bento box.  Typically, you would expect mini side dishes before your meal. This one serve 6 variety of different appetizer but all in the same plate. I mean i was ok with it but even then the appetizer was not even that good.   Overall, I would'nt come back to eat here again.

aUkAPL1X0Ng-5GilullzLg.review_text: Getting better! A lot better!  Came in here this week and decided to check out how the place is doing and surprisingly THE FOOD WAS GREAT! Looks like they change up the staff a little bit and we can taste the DIFFERENCE. The usual late night korean joint is BACK! The korean pancakes were cooked perfectly, the fish egg tofu soup was delicious and the korean sausage was PERFECTO! .... Oh, how i miss this place so much, now its back. Ill be coming in way more often now. Maybe next time i update arang, itll be a five star! *crossing fingers*

ys8DYdGLsx6dWxApsEoMUA.review_text: My usual here is the military soup and kimchi fried rice with no corn. The kimchi fried rice is really good, but their portion is pretty small :/ The sea bass soup is pretty decent as well, a lot of flavor and not too fishy. The great part about this restaurant is that they're open til 2am everyday!  One of the guy waiters who wears glasses sucks and always acts confused like he doesn't know what you're saying when you ask him for something. He has terrible service. Me and my bf were in the middle of ordering our soju to start off and he walked off as we were taking to him. He also kept dropping bowls and spoons as he was cleaning up after other people. I wanted a glass of ice water and he brought me a glass full of just ice. I told my bf to give him no tip when we ate there.   Other than that one waiter, this is definitely a regular food place for me since I live up the street. Great place to sit and eat Korean food and have some soju :)

QLC7N7bfA5WJnZaqnitjyg.review_text: Back in the day, when I was young and not a kid anymore...I used to come here a lot. In college, we would come here to eat late night, pretend to be gangsters, and underage drink. Its interesting that NOW I get carded for ordering a beer with my food, now that I am 30 and have two doctorate degrees. WTF?      Anyways, the food is still good...even when you are sober. The Soon tofu soup was flavorful with the perfect amount of spice. It hit the spot and soothed my soul on this cold night.      Bi bim bop was delicious but nothing out of the ordinary. Everything was seasoned well and I did get a little crunch (not much) from the stone bowl cooking the rice.       For old times sake I also got the shrimp fried rice omelet. This is one of those dishes that is the best thing in the world...when you are drunk. But sober...it was ok.      Overall, the food was good, the service was pretty much non-existent (had to ask for the check), and the OB (beer) was luke warm. Eh...this place is better after tons of soju pitchers.

NK-zIxHMuTnLRU0RhoZWqw.review_text:
Not the best Korean restaurant but definitely one of my favorites. This place opens til 1:30am, and it's even open during holidays like Thanksgiving. The food usually comes out very quick. The waitresses are very nice, but sometimes its hard to get their attention.
  Tip: When you come here, make sure at least one person doesn't order the bento box. That way, they'll give you the dish of random preserved vegetables and etc.
  JONASAPPROVED!

EN5yYZCsrRwTJaqqIwZpFQ.review_text: I would vote like 10 stars if I could. I have been going to this place for like two years now AND I FELL IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE THE FIRST TIME.   Here's a secret, if you go between 2-4, you get a quiet setting and maybe if you go between 3-4, or around dinner, you get K-POP playing. It's awesome.   It's really affordable.
