I'm a college student , that means, almost broke and wishes to only get good but cheap food. If you are looking for a fancy high end food, well go somewhere else.   This place is the best place for like: -bibimbap -bentous -beef!!!!!! -naengmyun -udon -FISHCAKE!!!!!!!!   What I love the most are the lunch boxes. I'm going to tell you right now, the best deals are before 3. I'm giving you an hour buffer zone because iono if they actually stop serving lunch at 4 or 3. I always get the same thing, BULGOGI LUNCH BOX. Two weeks ago, I went to this place like three times in a row. KEKEKEKE.   About the service, they never fail me. I drink tea like it's water so I'm always asking them to refill my tea so much. :p THE TEA IS REALLY GOOD. Unless you are allergic to rice, you will love it.   If you are looking for a recommendation, I suggest: -hamburger steak -bulgogi lunch box -bibimbap  I love the dessert: PATBINGOSOO. It's huge, YOU HAVE TO SHARE. It's really good patbingsoo. I haven't had a whole lot of experience eating this delicious creation but I have tried YakiniQ Cafe's and I like Arang's better.   If you don't have time to sit down and relax in this small restaurant, then take it to go. They are the friendliest people I have ever seen. They are really nice too. I am a waitress and I learn half of my skill from them.   I love this place so much that I recommend this place to everyone, even my own customers.

oyRKhwTODN_H21jTxIgEIg.review_text: I'm not a korean food critic by any means ... so since my bar was set super low, I have nothing but good stuff to say?  Had the bi bam bap ... was great. Came here for lunch and the prices blew me away! Reminded me of Vancouver. Yay for good, cheap korean food!

R5_QYmOZxTnyFU92PUccVA.review_text: I've been coming here for years. Not for the service, b/c its just ok, not for the ambiance b/c there isn't any. But simply for convenience, and good-food for the price.  The servers, though not rude, have about as much personality as a fast-food employee.  In an area where parking is a luxury, you can't beat being able to park in the Safeway parking lot.  The 1-2 homeless that you may encounter are harmless if not entertaining.  After dinner, head over to Raselas for live music almost nightly...

X5d_W-dxCUMRJAYwQs9kvw.review_text: Came here the other night with a group of friends, not a place recommended for those of you that have a large group. Prices are decent for the food, the soju is a different story. But starting off with the food, my friend and I split the Kimchi Fried rice, and the Spicy Tofu Soup. The tofu soup was delicious, so was the kimchi fried rice but I wasn't a fan of the corn bits in the rice. You get of course as with any other korean mean, ban chan. I usually love the ban chan korean restaurants have to offer but this place was alright. The jap chae I tried from my friends dinner box was disappointing. It was mushy and didn't taste like how jap chae should taste. But I would say for the price, they offer pretty big portions.   As for their soju, I think it was $9-$10 for a bottle of plain soju which is I guess normal with most places. HOWEVER! I would not order the flavored soju again. They sell it by the "pitcher," which in my mind, I was thinking of your average water pitcher. No, it's not, it's about half. Which I wouldn't have minded so much if it didn't cost $25? It was either $25, or $25+ And also, they don't have the price written up for how much it costs, maybe the menu did, I don't quite remember. But $25?!?!?! Really!?!? I can get 2 bottles of it somewhere else.   All in all, if you're coming for food, this place is pretty good. If you came to drink, I'd say go somewhere else. So 3.5 stars for me. =]

_gdRNGpMHOmHpLeDsJqCSw.review_text: My first time in a Korean restaurant. They had some fun music playing and the food was pretty good. The service was quick and efficient too. I'd go back for sure. Thanks!

pM-QNanTzWzX9RX-rNskBg.review_text: This place is great for that random late night Korean food craving everyone gets (esp. if you're Korean) since it's open until 2 am.   Soju and other random liquor was on sale, so that was pretty exciting.  And their meh oon tang is unexpectedly really tasty. They give you that extra "service" if you order lots of food/liquor--or if you have someone in your party who demands "quietly" that we should get some service since we ordered 2 jjigaes, 3 sojus, 1 large hite, and some binddae dduk.   Definitely the place to go if you're looking for some 2-cha or 3-cha.

aikP02DBxGBjr0i883eQYw.review_text: bulgogi bim bim bap  these are the only things i have ordered because marilyn moved to new york and my whiteness is afraid to venture out and accidentally order something that looks like cold kimchee fishcake soup...  5 stars  service?  - 2  korean beer?  a plus  GREAT korean bbq...  free parking nearby and hardly ever crowded?  thank you!

anKBKy6r-fkTuy6DbZbGzA.review_text: I love this place!  The menu is huge...but I can't really get myself to try something new since I pretty much only ever stick to their dol sot bim bim bap or soft tofu soup.  Their bulgogi bento box is delicious too. Come early though as this place tends to get crowded.

KUvKPzhaRoHtPwi-hJEF9Q.review_text: My friend and I both had sore throats and needed some hot, spicy Korean soup.  And pronto!!  Rather than risk having to wait in line at My Tofu House, we decided to try a new place - plus it was closer to his place.  I ordered the Soondubu Chigae/soft tofu soup.  He ordered the Kimchee Chigae/kimchee soup.  And we split an order of Mandoo/Korean pot stickers.  Soondubu Chigae was mild to medium spicy, but at Arang they add sesame oil to the broth.  What it lacked in spicy kick, the sesame oil made up for in taste  My friend's Kimchee Chigae was ok.  Nothing to call Mom about.  The Mandoo were nicely pan fried, but definitely could've had more filling.  The panchan was - meh.  Slice of steamed egg custard, fried tofu, potato salad (sweet - yuck!), radish and cabbage kimchee, little anchovies.  Service was ok.  Decor - very lacking.  But we parked in the strip mall parking lot, got seated right away, and they were ready to take our orders within 5 minutes of us sitting down.  So all-in-all not a bad experience.  Oh yeah, and if you so happen to take advantage of their booze specials (I guess all booze prices were reduced?) and can manage to muster up the courage, you can also go next door to the Norebang/karaoke bar.   :D

aX1rmyl9xGY5iDyeV2ohQw.review_text: Usually when my homegirl and I are craving korean food, we'll come here. We know what to expect. Crowded cause the place is so small but the food is worth the wait. We always order the same thing, assorted meat variety kimchi chigae. Spicy kimchi broth with spam, hotdogs, kimchi, green onions, and ramen. Sounds weird? Don't knock it till you try it! If you want cheap korean food come here. They have OB beer here, yipee!!

zSwb7qNpSgU3ekHMpiHsOA.review_text: yummy korean food at nice low costs, late at night... i wish there was a korean joint like this in phoenix...  i love their little all-in-one banchan plate. their kimchi is so good, too! and best of all, they serve you bori-cha! sighhhhh. yes. i like this place. plus, the waitress didn't give us dirty looks when we asked for more water/banchan, or when the 4 of us whipped out or DS's to continue our Tetris battle while we waited for our food... good times!

yA5642BAXMaaLb6TsWTJNg.review_text: I barely go on yelp, and I rarely give out 5 stars.   I believe this and Wooden Charcoal are my top two favorite korean eateries. They have fabulous... food. I feel like I'm at home for some reason, even though I'm not korean. Service is fast, quick and friendly. There should be no problem with this unless you're some inconsiderate d-bag. Great bbq meat, kimchi, fried rice, noodles, soups.... The last time I came here, I had a migraine.  Migraines make you not want to eat. The food was good, I was starving, I overate. WHY? Because the food was good, then of course my lovely mother ran to Safeway which is next to it for some ibuprofen :).  SIMPLY - If you are a fan of korean food, want to try korean food, new to korean cuisine,  try Arang Restaurant, and the rest is history. Scratch that. If you didn't enjoy it or less than expected, at least it was not dirt horrible. This place is definitely sanitary, tidy and clean. Chill, mellow place. Has a bar, tables, and with bench like seatings that have high barrier - gives privacy (5 MILLION YELP STARS FOR THAT).  Why do I come here a lot? My family and relatives would look for a place to eat after work sometimes and usually... the only good place that opens up late is..this!  Closes at 2am.  Groups? 4 max is best, due to seating and the fact that it's a mellow social place. Inexpensive.

lvTDfYZPIFXFDvT6ndhplQ.review_text: I say go here if your taste bud, as well as brain power, has numbed from alcohol...or if you wana listen to a playlist which includes...kpop music and avril lavigne.  Got the soft tofu soup and budaecchigae (stew/soup with ramen noodles, spam, sausages)  I'm pretty sure I drank twice my body weight in water to wash out the extra salt/seasoning/MSG.  If you're craving korean food - GO TO BROTHER'S on Geary and 6th. you won't regret it.

u9zqrRSnf6BByCIQ0MIyiA.review_text: So glad there was a restaurant open past 10:00 pm near the place my friends and I were staying. We were all so frikken hungry that it didn't really matter where or what we ate. Luckily, we saw a korean restaurant, so that was pretty awesome (I love korean food).   It was nice and homey inside the restaurant and the workers were really accommodating to all 10 of us. We were served some sesame tea which wasn't too bad--- tastes like Rice Krispies tea.   Good thing they weren't that busy so our orders came out pretty fast even though there were so many of us, but since we were all coupled up, most of our party kind of shared, but not I! Hahha. I ordered the (cold) bibimbap which was good. In my opinion, all (cold) bibimbaps taste the same no matter what restaurant I go to (could be different in Korea, who knows). I just added some hot sauce and I was good to go. I enjoyed my meal very much.  It wasn't the best korean restaurant I've been to and it wasn't the worst, so I would come back if I was in the area and if I was hungry late at night.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: After hearing how much I loved Toyose, my coworker suggested Arang as a Korean food alternative on those super popular dining out nights.  We hit up Arang with high hopes.  + Parking lot, so we don't have to circle to leave our car in a safe area.  Had a bit of a wait since it was one of those nights.  Finally sat down, and was immediately disappointed by their drink selection (as compared to Toyose's seemingly endless flavors of soju).  Ordered some pineapple flavored soju, and it was S.T.R.O.N.G.  Definitely unlike Toyose, where the soju creeps up on you.  The food was good, but not super memorable.  The service, though, was kind of sucky.  I know we are at a corner table and we are short, but please, notice us already!  We were ready for the bill for at least 15 minutes before someone walked by.  Bleh!

1QwIXJNstqVS39v274z8GA.review_text: I've been here many times and always get a bento box. They are delicious and are inexpensive.

BZQ59N02nxDPr0X785R-CA.review_text: foods is a little spicy.  got bim bi bop friend chicken short ribs peach soju  everything was pretty good however the timing of the food was off the bim bi bop came like 10 mins before anything.  not bad and there is a parking lot next to it. which is usually a must in sf

eRV6uavzjtvLj7Aej59QVg.review_text: Had my first satisfying meal here a few nights ago with one of my closest girlfriends.  We shared the Meat variety soup which was YUM with lots of veggies, sliced spam & sausage and ramen noodles.  There was so much in a serving for two that I had enough leftovers to count as one full meal the next day.  And upon seeing how red the pot came, I thought it was going to be ultra spicy, but it wasn't....it was just right.

eXD_rMgwm0IaSfCSJbsqYQ.review_text: I'll admit it.  When it comes to dining out, I'm lazy.  So when going out for Korean, I'm not a huge fan of those "grill it yourself" KBBQ joints.  Fortunately, Arang does all the grillin' in back so that you can sit back and enjoy your meal and company.  I've been to Arang several times.  The menu features your typical Korean dishes...Bi Bim Bop (stone pot rice), Bulgogi (marinated beef), Galbi (marinated beef short ribs), and even other non-Korean items like Tempura.  And of course, your meal is complemented with Banchan (Korean side dishes)  But what you NEED to order is the meat casserole!  Everytime I'm feeling a little down, this pot of goodness provides me with a quick pick-me-up.  They bring out a propane burner and a pot full of deliciousness.  Think kim-chee tofu soup.  But instead of kim-chee and tofu, the caserole contains slices of spam and hot dogs (sounds random...but I promise it's delicious), ramen noodles, and rice cakes.  Scoop over a side of rice and you're good to go!  This is seriously Korean comfort food!

_Dd2uxnhcEKzrv0VPVnxFA.review_text: It's not a GREAT Korean food restaurant, but Arang has some good strong points:  1) Tons of variety - this means that my group of friends (who aren't Koreans) can pick something they like 2) Price - Overall good value. 3) Parking - Plenty in the shared lot (with Safeway and others)  Bunch of us usually come here after our happy hour, and we always leave satisfied.  Oh by the way, if you call speaking Korean and ask nicely, they do reserve tables for you.

C7OKvBYjMzEr81l1u2drYg.review_text: I really liked the music here.  They weren't playing K-Pop when I got in, which I thought was weird, since the place had a younger feel.  Instead they were playing a good mix of stuff from the 90's, early 2000's and a few non-mainstream new songs.  Very enjoyable to listen to as you wait for the food.  The wait staff was also very friendly, they got our food out quickly and were attentive with drinks and cleaning up any uncleaned tables.  The food was just ok for me, but I think that was mainly because I ordered the wrong item.  My friends ordered the galbi and they demolished it.  While I got the spicy pork bulgogi.  The meat seemed to have too much fat for my taste.  I don't know if that's supposed to be common, but most Korean restaurants where I've had it, that wasn't the case.    Overall it was a good experience and I'll be coming back, partially because it's only a few blocks away, but also because I want to give it another shot.

li9jTjFbgGoANo6EOc3Djw.review_text: me and my husband been coming here forever!!! I love love love the food here, i always order the same food tho LOL  soft tofu soup extra spicy, stir fried squid and bbq beef!!! its bomb! gotta go again sometimes soon! love it   the reason why i give 4 stars it beacuse its alittle expensive than some other places

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: We found ourselves cruising down Fillmore st. a little after midnight Wednesday and decided to forgo our usual Korean resto, to try out Arang, which is open til 2am.   Walking in, you'll notice that the crowd is wrinkle-free and I was hit with a realization that I'm no longer a youngin, especially with the cheery K-pop music in the background.  Tea was served immediately upon request.  The menu offers more choices than Won Mi. You can get ramen here if you want or a box dinner (aka Bento Box) for $8.95.  I imagine this place is super popular for lunch as the lunch specials start around $6.  We imbibed on a yougurt soju, a small carafe is $12. It's pleasantly sweet, definitely a girly drink. Soon after, our huge Korean seafood pancake ($9.95) came.  It's bland if you don't dip it in the soy-vinegar chili sauce. Also, it was a tad bit oily and wish it was more crunchier.  I ordered my usual Man du Gook ($8.95) which is a dumpling soup with green onions and egg. What a disappointment. The dumplings were already falling apart after moving it around in my bowl.   The box dinner was a wise choice since heaping mounds of everything were devoured in minutes:  tender teriyaki beef, steamed white rice and simple iceberg lettuce salad.   Arang definitely scores points because it has more choices and noticeably lower prices than the other 2 Korean restos in the area.  However, it loses points with me because there are no banchans served for late night eats!

__tr37QhFc-nKxpKUzP63w.review_text: I wouldn't have ventured into this restaurant if it weren't for a friend who lives in the 'hood.  It's completely unassuming especially next to the "fashion" boutique next door with spandex tube dresses hanging in the window.  I digress...  This restaurant is good place to venture if you're looking for a quick fix for a Korean craving.  When we walked in around 7 pm, it was relatively empty but within minutes, plenty of other people streamed in and filled up the tables around us.    I wasn't starved, so I ordered the spicy tofu soup. It was boiling hot and filled to the brim with tons of silken tofu.  I was a little surprised by the cooked egg smack dab in the middle.  A few pieces of clam floated around and I think there were some straggling strips of beef as well. I enjoyed the flavor...could have been a tad bit spicier. I asked for medium, next time, I'll ask them to step it up a bit.   My friend ordered up the BBQ beef combo plate, which was a great value for the moola.  The BBQ was well seasoned, a little sweet and salty all at the same time.  It came with shreds of potatoes, mung bean noodles, a side salad, and rice.   All in all, we skated away with a bill that was just over a 20 spot.  Not shabby...and we had leftovers to boot!

quBsSLsr7J5XiA7mydCvcg.review_text: Cheap simple way to satisfy a kimchee craving.  Staff is polite though forgetful (as in, forget that you are there).  I wasn't expecting much going in, I'm not a Korean food connoisseur and dinner only cost me $10, so overall this place isn't bad

AHz3sGxkZjAzv8uu0Q9hqg.review_text: After several failed attempts in the past 2 years, I FINALLY made it out to Arang.  Was it worth the wait?  Well, I think so and here are some reasons why:  1) Plenty of menu choices  2) Service is efficient and friendly 3) The food is good.    What I ordered: Dol sot bi bim bap (recommend) Beef Kalbi (recommend) Pot Stickers (eh)  What to expect: 1) Small dining space 2) Can get hot and stuffy  3) Quick service 4) Moderately priced  - 2 people, 4 dishes, 2 sodas=$50 (sans tip)  I'm just glad that I have a Korean resto closer my apt (my fave one is on Geary and 10th Ave, which is sorta far).

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: This place has either changed owners or found a better cook.  The food here has been freakin awesome recently.  I use to live near here but I moved over a year ago.  The food was always just ok.  But its freakin good now.  The seafood pancake, cheese omelet, and dol sot bi bim bap is really good.  Its arguably one of the best I have eaten in the city.  This is some pretty bold words for a fatty.  If you haven't been in a while it is time to try it again.  This place is still smaller than my penis BTW.  Its pretty small.

Y6Ax3JHhwPasZLSjTaQLqg.review_text: We love coming to this restaurant. We discovered it from a Korean friend. The place is small though! We've taken our two small kids there and some of their seating is "cozy" Thankfully no one has minded having them around even when they're drinking. They usually play with them. (I guess I've just got cute kids lol)   Anyway moving on, the service has always been good except for one time. They put a hot pot right in front of my youngest; and of course she touched it and burnt her finger!! I didn't realize how bad it was b/c I didn't see it happen, just her crying. Otherwise I would have been sure to say something.   The food is really good. I'm sorry I don't remember the exact names. But we always get the bulgogi, kimchi with tofu, and the seafood soup. (Its has a bright red color, it almost looks like sauce with mussels, clams, some meat and tofu) We always get a new dish we haven't tried with each visit. Last week we got squid on skewers. But for $5 we got like 4 small pieces of squid with vegetables. What a waste of money!

cvmJIsh-mHrt400x-F8NvQ.review_text: Open late. I'm still a novice with good Korean eats, but they had good bibimbap and dukbokki. Have some Hite and their lemon soju to wash it all down...  Got there at 1130pm and parking was super easy - there's a practically empty Safeway lot right next door...

udw3E58LbNrHOqwpKB2nSQ.review_text: I give this place all 5 stars... sure, it's a dive.  But this place has been around since Cain was cleaning sheep skins.  I mean,  this place is a freakin institution!   And surprisingly, the food is really good.  Boo dae jjee geh, kimchi jjee geh, kalbi.  you name it.  whatever they have is at least as good as all the other korean places.  also, the pat bingsoo is really good too.  finally, they serve soju... cocktail and straight.  now, who doesn't love that?

wP52cimy4c5yPm_SXD2xDg.review_text: Pretty good Korean food and decently priced.

RQY-h8eNxkvSwqWYs1remA.review_text: Mul naeng myun- Was okay. Didn't contain any brisket. Very odd.  Dduk bok go - made a little too quickly. Sauce was a bit watery.  Mehhh.... Will I come here again? Yes , because the prices are lower than other Korean restaurants.

A-H5kc5BE3XZZm-1EZHizQ.review_text: The waitresses are really friendly and the food is good.  The Arang combination is a really good deal, but I usually just drink.  For the month of February all alcohol is 1/2 off!!!!  If you didn't go during February its ok, March all alcohol is 25% off.  Go while you can!!!

3rBR1WbqpYm4c4FrnDlOKA.review_text: Aaahhhh, this place reminds me of all the good o times after Avaron days but it's always been a special place b/c of  the great memories w/friends. The food is still pretty good after just recently going back  after many years and the food is very affordable compared to other Korean places. They have bomb lunch specials!  My Favs: Chicken Teriyaki Box which includes: rice, miso soup, chapchae, pot stickers and salad. Lunch: $6.50 and Dinner is $8.95 Chol Myhon (Spicy chewy noodles) - ask them to make it a little less spicy b/c it is very SPICY.  Mandoo Guk (Dumpling soup)

6barujjst79kB-Jsg9092g.review_text: i've only eaten here late nites and really the first time i ever tried korean food was here.  don't know if the soju helped with the flavors, but it was great.  i'm a huge fan of dok pokey...haha!  i know i butchered that one, but that's straight phonics! the ABC at the end was pretty good as well (dessert icecream over noodles and shaved ice).  i think that's what its called.  oh yeah, it's open late and pretty cheap.

CcUV3ex2gREGYPuqHj_SSw.review_text: If I lived nearby, I'd be eating out here regularly. The restaurant is comfortable and the food is well prepared, but nothing fancy though. If you're too lazy to cook and looking for a quality meal, this is a good place to go. Their hot tea is great, with a whole bunch of those popped rice things in it.

WFOrDeTGii1wl6NtE3JlfA.review_text: A hole-in-a-wall type of Korean resturant. It's pretty small in here, which sucks.  I love their dinner box combo here. The teriyaki chicken is so tasty. And also the items on the side. The bibimbap here is decent though.   I really like their starter dish they give in the beginning. Mmmm.

ORYu-cLe0SxineXThaNuYA.review_text: Good for bento boxes and cheap Korean food eats! They even have their own version of pat bing soo (korean shaved ice).

DDYzPldx4_s8h0SYfA6enw.review_text: I think this is the best Korean restaurant in Japantown/Western Addition area.  I only go here now!!  Best ra-bbok-ki (dduk bbok kki with ramen noodles), though it can open up your wallet a little bit (it's about $11), but well worth it.  one of the guy server here has great music taste-- he'll bring in his mix cd's, with lots of good songs on there.  None of your "america's top 40" crap.

ZuCP8O71LHKl6tlXkS7Ziw.review_text: Compared to all the other places I've been for Korean food and soju, Arang is probably the cheapest, and best tasting place. It's a lot smaller than like the spot and playground, and more of a chill, sit down dinner place, but I really liked it here.  We ordered the kimchi fried rice, kimchi tofu stew, BBQ beef bento box, and the redbean and mixed fruit icee dessert. Everything was good and came in pretty big portions. Our waitress was very nice and quick with giving us more fish cakes and kimchi. The pitcher of yogurt soju was big and even though you can taste how strong it is, it was still very good. It's very easy to find parking around the restaurant and its open late. I would definitely come back if I'm craving Korean food again

S0ylQxYXlgCrD2dXKLXfbg.review_text: Just had lunch here less than an hour ago, and if only i had a stomach -- I'd go back for more! It is Oh-So-GOOOD!  I had the lunch Seafood Bi-Bim-Bap in hot stoneware, for $7.50!!! There were about 5 HUGe and fresh shrimps in the pot, with abundance squid and some calamari. Not too much rice. And, the flavoring is perfect! I'm a big eater, and I was barely able to finish the whole thing, so I guess we can call that a BIG portion.  The service wasn't at your beck-n-call like a high-class place, but they're definitely attentive. The servers came to check on us twice to make sure that everything was OK, that's a lot to say for lunch hours.  We were lucky that there were no wait because this place is very small. And, for the price and quality they offer, I'm sure Korean food fans will be here very often once they discover this little hole-in-the-wall.  I'll definitely be back!

zV4SB8GGlU_eXcBniXl6BQ.review_text: They stopped serving dried squid w/ peanuts, WTF?!... that should be negative 2 stars but I won't do it.

m-_pnRtoqOxw-zOtDADckQ.review_text: In sum, I don't want to patronize a place where the managers are patronizing to their employees.  Worse part of my experience at this place was hearing the Korean server/owner/manager(?) yell at her Latino employee.  Her "critique" was bordering on abuse.  I hope he has legal status and can can quit and move to a restaurant where the managers/owners appreciate the hard work he does for them.  As for the food, it was just OK.  I haven't eating a lot of Korean food, so I'm not going to delve into how amazing it is or isn't or compare to other Korean spots.  It was spicy with all that red stuff which they put on a lot of the dishes.  I had the seafood stoneware dish.  It was more fun for the experience than the flavor. The best part about the meal was the side dishes, including the potato salad like one and fried veggie cakes.

POgsjOhoFQVOCER3NBPsAA.review_text: We went here based on the Chronicle's Cheap Eats recommendation, and were not impressed based on the other restaurants that have made their list (Ala Turca, . . .)  Maybe they were having an off day, but their food did not have any flavor.  I had the kimchi bi bim bap, which was not at all spicy, and my bf had the bul-go-gi combo.  Their hot sauce was kind of ketchup-esque, and coudn't save the bi bim bap.  Pros: open late and is very reasonable Cons: not particularly satisfying, especially if you have other options

Ez8ifxrtOUT5TM4817scOQ.review_text: Talk about being pleasantly surprised. I had no idea what to expect when I walked into this dicey looking restaurant with 50s style dinner booths. What Arang lacks in decor, they more than make up for with the food. Perfectly seasoned beef and pork with hot rice wine and even a few surprise dishes. I'm not sure what some of the items were but my date ordered since she speaks Korean and I just trusted her that none of it was dog or cat! Now despite the language barrier with a few of the servers,  it is a frequent stop of mine when I'm craving Asian food during a San Fransisco visit.

IZFFuUSa1LaumN7XQJkG4w.review_text: I was craving Korean food and decided to give this place a try. There's quite a few Korean restaurant options around this area but this one seemed authentic and the prices were definitely more reasonable than the others in the area. The servers are friendly but the food took a little long to come out (10-15 mins after we ordered). The meats are delicious and of good quality. I've been to many Korean restaurants and this one definitely compares well with others I've been to in the past. A good indication that this restaurant is authentic is that there were a good amount of Korean people eating here too. This restaurant is in a good location (right by Japantown) and there's a parking lot in the back.  -Beef Short Ribs Box (Dinner) - $10.95 (Meat was very juicy. The marinade was delicious! The box came with salad, soup, gyozas, noodles, and rice. For this much food, the price is definitely good for this dish. Highly recommend trying this item.)  -Soft Tofu Stew (Dinner) - $8.95 (The mild is still somewhat spicy but the broth was delicious. There were a good amount of clam meat and beef in the broth too.)  We wanted to order the Seafood Scallion Pancake too because it looked so good, but we decided not to since it would be way too much food. The pancake looked huge though (almost the size of a large plate) so it seems like it would be worth it. Can't wait to come back!

aVAAzlIdfXT9LZ4ICIgSBw.review_text: I've been here twice, both times for a late dinner. Once before a concert at the fillmore and once just cause it's close to my house.   I like that it feels like a time warp in there, in the sense that you go in there and can spend a few hours and not even realize how much time has passed. I guess part of why I gave 4 stars is that I like the atmosphere there.  I loved that we were setting there for a while without the waitress bothering us.  Don't get me wrong, she was plenty attentive, but it was nice to have time to sit and chat and not feel rushed.   Food was good both times but not super outstandingly delicious. We got the combo boxes both times with the following mains: chicken katsu, tempura, bbq pork short ribs and bbq beef. All pretty good and flavorful.   I like that the combo comes with edamame and miso soup, in addition they have the meat, noodles and potstickers. I usually avoid the rice and "salad" because it's not that delicious and just filler. I find the rest of the food gets me plenty full.   Yum.

2eQQfLahNSEuHyWHyqKnog.review_text: I just keep coming back here. Perhaps because it's reliably low priced and because my friends can't seem to make up there minds when we're trying to find something open late in J/K-town. Food selection is great, though I never order the noodles (they're always instant). Stick with the lunch/dinner specials (which are the same just priced differently at diff times). =)

_AhIb2DIhOZhnxA9123oFQ.review_text: This is the only korean place that I know of in the city so this review may be a bit biased (btw, I'm not korean so don't read this for "authenticity":  I really dig the seafood udon. What I like about it is that they actually put REAL seafood in it (blue crab, shrimp, scallops), unlike other restaurants where they put a few slices of imitation crab meat in it and deem it "seafood". Ugh.   I also like the fact that they open late, perfect for a night owl such as myself.

nRHreRvxWdg_m99JVElu0g.review_text: I've passed the Safeway plaza in jtown countless times but I never even knew Arang existed until recently. We ordered the duk bukki w ramen, galbi i think and another soupy ramen dish w rice cakes. Everything was a-okay but there was nothing especially memorable about the dishes we ordered. Service was on par. Music was some kind of funky throwback music which was different from the pop-y music they place in other korean places I've been to. Other than that, everything was solid.

s9xehOI61Kl1xbttjSNu0Q.review_text: Food is ok. Service is terrible. Very  slow and rude. Don't go there when you are hungry. It takes forever to have someone take your order. It takes another forever for them to cook. Bad experience! Two stars - one for the ok food, one for the music that they play in the restaurant.

2ggWcesKrh1beMKK8pbp5Q.review_text: The food has gotten better.  I've lived in the neighborhood for over 7 years now and this is a place I go to when I'm just too tired to cook (which is almost always) and I don't want to go far.  The trick to this place is knowing what to order.  Skip the ordinary dinner boxes and order some of their specialties like galbi tang (short beef rib soup), their crazy meat combination spicy ramen, or their hamburg steak.  EDIT:  Also try the kimchi fried rice!!!

DHKtRpSH83x60Z2FJY6oLQ.review_text: Had a wonderful time there, its a small but attractive little place. They had a good ambiance going.  The food was good, the people were nice, no complaints :)

GmLpBIfp2_lug_UPkCAFNA.review_text: I came here a few times. I usually come here for basic Korean food.  There's nothing that really stood out. I usually just order the Galbi (which they cook for you before serving it to you) and the Sondopu (Spicy tofu soup) which I really enjoy on a cold rainy day. It's a super small restaurant.  Probably only 10 tables. I think people come here to eat then karaoke next door.  Overall my experience here was just ok.

cFBkW7o2GnXtS1vpfWtK_w.review_text: This restaurant has become quite a favored spot for my  friends and I. Reason why is that its serve good food! lol like my buddy mark said on his review "two of my friends usually get the OB beer along with their dish so they really enjoy this place" which is true haha..   well lemme break it down on pricing, service, and food quality.  The pricing is kinda on the high end side. the plate that my friend and I away gets runs about 15 bucks each for a small plate of beef and pork.  They change per bowl of rice now... which they didn't do before.  Most plates cost about 10 bucks or more.  The service is OK i guess well on a slow night its excellent!! but when its busy they don't really have a waiting list. They tend to find a table for the amount of people and whatever goes. Also they expect a heavy tip, the 15% rule or some crap. which I believe is BS tip should be the way the customer feels on how good is the food/service.  Food quality! good,tasty, filling should i say anything more?  over all good food ok service = happy me lol

7ecvBHMwf8xoJPL2AA3MoA.review_text: Can't believe I haven't written a review for Arang yet. It's been one of my favorite Korean restaurants for years. The place can get pretty crowded during peak times but they are open pretty late which is nice because thats when I always crave it. They do take reservations though so take advantage of that because the restaurant itself is on the smaller side. The bento boxes are a great deal but you won't get banchan if you order one. So just make sure someone else in your group orders something else. They don't have a problem refilling the banchan if you ask nicely. The a la carte bbq are always tasty (the spicy pork is my favorite). The casseroles are super filling and can feed 3 easily and the still give you a bowl of rice on the side! I like the spam and sausage one. It comes with kimchi, rice cakes, ramen, and an assortnent of veggies on top. You let it cook down over the little stove they bring to the table and then help yourself. Service is attentive, the food is delicious and prices are fair. Plus you can park in the Safeway parking lot!

QET-Q52SjV4JwLvuDz1h0A.review_text: Hidden treasure on Fillmore. Good food and helpful service.  BUT, they seemed understaffed when we were there.

ixo96VAqfMCSDJQ_qKnrcg.review_text: the only thing that is decent here is the bi bim bap.. but as i have mentioned before.. you can't really screw that up.. even if you tried..  i've eaten here many times.. and the food is always unremarkable..  sometimes.. it's almost bad..  stay away from the omelette rice.. there was something else that i got that i REALLY disliked.. but i can't really remember it.. SEE??! unremarkable food.. i can't even remember what was in the dish i ordered..

Ppk0C_BkEq1g1xJvmlem1w.review_text: It's open late for when you finish with a concert or clubbing. Their tofu soup "mild" is still spicy as hell. I love spicy but my party did not enjoy that. We got bulgogi, bi bim bap and short ribs. The prices are a little steep for the food quality you get but it's a decent option for some late night dinning if you are in the area. Bathroom is a mess as well. They are generous with the water because they serve it to you in a big container with water and they keep bringing you a new one when you finish. The bulgogi was a little on the greasy side but the flavor was nice. The tofu soup was good with meat and clams and I personally did not mind the spicy flavor. I don't like kimchi but my gf who is a big fan since she went to Korea said it wasn't good. Overall decent food that is open late.

GXAMsYUo24Dllfvbn0zT9g.review_text: This place is awesome. Good is great and affordable. Place is a little small but wait is usually not too bad. taste much better than won mi but it does close at two. Wish they open much later!!!!

3lMv7jkZTdziX-utSK_Ngw.review_text: Great value - food is good and relatively cheap. the ramen dduk boki is legit.  Good for casual meals & drinking with a few buddies. we get together once every couple months for "arang night"...and it means eating a smackload of kfood and playing titanic with soju til we all blackout.

Rjso2W9fVXsQeA6W3In4og.review_text: Ever since we moved to San Francisco 3 years ago, we have been searching for a good Korean restaurant.  We find this restaurant to be the best so far.  I enjoy the short rib soup and found the one served in this restaurant very good.  The soup was rich and the beef was tender.  The gul bugi here is flavorful and tender.  We enjoyed our lunch tremendously and will be returning.

Z-NjDpNw_SDPEap81FN9OQ.review_text: the clay pot's to die for!! so yummy!! whenever I come here, that's what I order!

qA5nTphhaOSxLgKr1VFaiQ.review_text: The food and prices are good, however the experience is completely ruined due to the fact that the waiters/waitresses are so mind numbingly incompetent.

G-KKZ_DT1jAF_gNUlGFFQg.review_text: You've heard me say it before, I'm not a huge fan of Korean restaurants in San Francisco.  Typically, they are way overpriced and under-flavored, leaving me with an empty wallet and a dissatisfied belly.  I recently went to Korea and found the bar raised even higher after sampling the classics, mastered to perfection, and imaginative new creations that left me wanting more.  This said, I was really not at all looking forward to trying out another San Francisco Korean restaurant recently with some friends, but I went anyway because I still hadn't eaten my fill of Korean after my recent trip and was willing to lower my standards just to get my fix.    Arang was surprisingly satisfying.  The prices are less than other San Francisco restaurants, and the taste was actually decent.  They didn't skimp on ingredients because of their lower price (in fact, their hae mul pa jun (seafood pancake) was packed with seafood), and they were generous with the side dishes.  One downside was the wait to get a seat.  Apparently, there are plenty of people who figured out that Arang is a decent joint.  Too bad it's super tiny.  Plan to wait for a table.  Check it out, though.

eO737nnNksB7FDbCd-s8xw.review_text: Great cheap eats!  My favorite is the spicy pork (dwae ji bul go gi) outside of my auntie's back home - this one is pretty good. The sauce is not bottled and you can taste the difference.  Go for the kimchee bokkum bap - it's pretty fun too!  Our version of fried rice! The service varies on how busy it is -or NOT!

0QeJC2inz6P-OVzROU_LNw.review_text: The lunch box specials were cheap.. teriyaki chicken, rice, soup, salad, noodles, and wonton for under $7!  This place does not offer any appetizers!!  We ordered a plate of tempura and it was freaking $12!  I ordered the spicy chicken sizzling plate.. it wasn't that spicy, just very oily.  The soup that was brought out wasn't hot.. so that was a tad disappointing.  Parking is semi-easy since it's right by the Safeway parking lot.  Service was quick but towards the end they tend to cater to the diners that just walked in rather than checking in on us.  If you want the lunch special, it is worth it but if you go for any other meals then it's expensive.. freaken $13 for my sizzling chicken plate.. not worth it.

jntRt0kG_jk_hS78baaTnA.review_text: A very decent 3 star place.  I really liked the spam & hot dog ramen spicy soup and the spicy chicken.  The prices are really cheap for Korean food and it's open really late.  The service does leave something to be desired, but it's not a place you'd expect super attentive service anyways.  The shrimp fried rice omelet is not as good as the picture would suggest.  It's ketchup fried rice basically and not very tasty at that.  The spicy pork was okay, but a few too many fatty pieces of pork and tons of sauce.  Overall though for price & quality I'll be back.

rsW5CeBtf7pSkZFfrlFUgg.review_text: Kalbi Bulgogi Sondopu Peach, Yogurt or Lemon Soju Cocktails Bi bim bap Bindaeddeok Dukbokki   And..the list goes on!   Came here for a late dinner with a friend after lion dance practice. We were looking to go to Jtown for food, but the parking sucked so we parked in the plaza with a Safeway in it and walked on over.   The service was quick and we were seated in less than a minute. For a Friday night, this place was packed with people and you could hear the latest kpop music in the background. I'd recommend this place for couples and for small groups of friends. Having a large group here, you may just take up the whole restaurant.   Alright, the food. My friend ordered the Chicken galbi bento box and I had the Bulgogi box. It came with a decent amount of lettuce with thousand island dressing, two pieces of gyoza, a small mound of japchae (silver noodles marinated in sesame sauce) and fermented potatoes. It was enough to fill us up while we were there.   From the time we sat down to the time we left, the staff refilled our tea when it went down to half full. Unfortunately, we didn't order any alcohol that night. Observing some of the other tables, it looks like the lemon or yogurt soju were the most popular. As we were leaving, these two guys ordered a few pitchers of it. That will be something I will try next time!   The only thing that I am giving one less star on is for the tea. Barley tea with toasted rice krispies tastes alright, but it tasted like there was some dish soap in it. My friend noticed it too, but its not that important. As long as I don't get sick from eating Korean food, I'm a happy camper.   Kamsahamnida Arang!

LvjYgC5ZJFyMQWOWX9B9EQ.review_text: This place is located right nearby the Fillmore center and opens late! This -place is perfect for a casual date or just hanging out with friends! I ordered Kim Chi Stew with Tofu, Bulgogi, and DonPuki. Their dish are so vibrant and flavorful. I would definitely go back to this place. Try their donpuki!

eRIiz3Z8QeccCKSyDJUaqg.review_text: Parking, good food, clean restaurant, friendly service...what more could you ask for. This is a small place with big taste. its not a 5 star restaurant as far as dining goes, it doesn't have the ambiance for that. but it gets five stars anyway. I say F*** the ambiance, i want to walk out full, happy, and with good taste in my mouth. This place has that. with a reasonable price to boot..

uV8kG4yg7RPlrH56qzDoVw.review_text: Only came here for the lunch specials . Everything was really decently priced, and the Om-rice I got was quite delicious.   Will be back to try other things... man it was packed during lunch .

SrSr-KYsO2_QxxQlTYQVig.review_text: This place is really cool.  It stays open pretty late, parking isn't too crazy and the food is awesome!  The only minor thing I don't like about it is the limited seating.  The only place i feel comfortable sitting is in the booth area.  My favorite things to eat here are: the beef bento box, spicy pork dish, and of course the staple of chicken terriyaki.  I also love what comes with the bento box: shredded potatoes and gyoza.  I love this place!!!

YVb4ACwqBBFXTjLkNVQalg.review_text: I am not the biggest fan of fish, so walking into a place that reeked like fried fish, I was already unimpressed but i'll battle thru it if its got good food to district me with. It's a old, tiny establishment and it doesn't seem like they'd change anything to it soon.   I was truly not happy with my meal. The banchan was mediocre if even mentionable at all. The oshinko was not pickled enough and tasted odd.  The "kimchee fried rice" was truly sad. Maybe they should change the name to kimchee tossed rice.  It had corn, spam, kimchee and huge chunks of semi-raw onions. It was obvious they rushed thru "frying" this dish because it wasn't evenly coated with the kimchee dressing. I had big chunks of white rice that weren't even broken up and the onion wasn't  thoroughly cooked thru! I would think this is palatable ONLY if in a drunken stupor when anything would taste good, if at that. I mean, how hard is it to make fried rice?!  We also got the spicy beef vermicelli soup...which came ages later, after inquiring about it halfway thru our meal. The soup base was standard, but where are my noodles?! Is this a soup or a noodle soup? We got a few strands of vermicelli, and to make up for it, heaps of vegetable-like sticks that tasted like licorice.   Great meal, huh? I don't understand all the great reviews. Sorry, methinks not!

RCsoxM0Zkzu5jZPfSJ8EjQ.review_text: Yes, maybe I have to eat here. Just maybe. Could it be the dead souls...oh they keep calling me. Maybe the kimchi keeps calling me. Maybe my korean girlfriend keeps calling me on my phone and we keep going to this restaurant because it is so fucking good. And eating korean with koreans is good. When you can order food in the language that everyone taking the orders is speaking is a plus. Have you ever ordered your fucking burritos in Spanish? Have you ever tried? Maybe your plate will be larger than normal, even if you spanglish the thing to the ground. So my girlfriend orders in Hangul and I get everything with fire. Eating hot things to get the chilli taste out of your burning mouth is  lesson to be learned at this joint. They have some chewy rice rolls that come in satan sauce and man, just wash it down with pickled hot shit.  "Lady, get me a mek joo! And turn the fucking K Pop down! I can't hear myself eat!"

mnv-Z2vCfGffzvIV61q20A.review_text: maybe a place i would go on my 13th date with a girl.  it is nothing fancy and the food is medium well.  it is like when you dont really want to look for something so you get something you know..  yah.. this place could be the korean version of cheers.  nothing too flashy.  same people come a lot.  the music is terrible..  no one really does know my name.. but still..  it means a lot to take someone to this place because i would be to that comfortable place.  ich

mz_6pNB5a8QBU83x9M6RHw.review_text: Arang has become a popular late night hang out place of choice these past couple of months, especially with the half off liquor.  Meaning, large pitchers of soju are only $12.  First time I went here the waitresses checked ID by looking deep into your eyes.  They are that good and extremely friendly, reminding me of friendly parent's moms.  Food is above average, and its a top late night hangout spot.

XJKlpkcN3W51cpLf1Cm50g.review_text: I usually come here after work when I have a long day. My favorite thing to order here is the Soft Tofu Soup. I almost always get it, and it really never disappoints me. It's the perfect filler and great dinner to have with a beer, water, or tea. I also really enjoyed their chicken gizzard skewers. It sounds odd- I know. They are seriously one of the best side-dishes to have with beer. I really love the texture and saltiness with just a bit of onions and bell pepper.   Will come back, like always!

kFp_1vtAwqpcDoDb18qZBg.review_text: Went here on a random monday night, somewhat busy, BUT had enough seating for those coming in.  Good food for a good price. Although the food isn't anything significantly different from other korean places, it's still good!

yIZHEdIjR0goGI2AgpbFjQ.review_text: Their Bulgogi Dinner Box is delicious! It was $10.95, which is a pretty good price for a Korean BBQ dinner. The service was good and the free tea was really good as well.  Now I know where to go when I need me some Korean food!

WPBrjBbk76ZtZQ8QpG09cQ.review_text: Nice cozy korea food place with a family-store feel. Usually opens very very late, so it's a great place to get late night K-food especially when you are in J-town!  The "korean starter snacks" they give you is served on a plastic "lunchables" case, which just goes to show how mom-and-pops this place is! The inside is actually not very big, but has a very warm feel to it.  In terms of customers, there are definitely lots of customers even late into the night. About half the tables have the "reserved" sign on it, and when I was eating I saw a couple of customers come in who were put into those tables, so I know there are definitely tables being reserved.  Most customers ordered big giant "hotpot" style dishes to share between a group. I got the korean tofu soup, which was ok. There was tons of tofu, but not really much meat, which was disappointing. The starter snacks was really tasty though.  Would definitely stop by again when I am in the area.

0E3zMPX6TWMUJ1NKkJNNBA.review_text: Ate here for lunch today!  Although I've been coming here for almost 14 years on a weekly/biweekly basis and I must say the food is consistently good.   I work out in the SOMA, so it's nice I can dine in and still make it back to work within an hour. The food comes promptly even though it's usually a packed restaurant during lunch hours.   My picks are the kal-bi or spicy pork lunch boxes.  The cold noodles are  a treat on sunny warm days (but it's not always available).

G2_e2pgE2kJd5KyizmgQEQ.review_text: I'm not a Korean thingy ma-jig tasting food specialist, but I know how to listen to my taste buds, so if I had to interpret tonguelish, they would say:   "I wasn't disappointed; but I wasn't WOWed: I just simply enjoyed my meal coupled with my refreshing beer."

G_tm-a-dmje4Cou0v3Eohg.review_text: Arang is just another Korean restaurant in SF, but it's pretty conveniently located and the price isn't too expensive. I tend to think of this place as Korean fast food. I've never had bad service at Arang, and never had much f a bad experience. This place ALWAYS has customers when I go. I go there for lunch a lot because it's so close to work, and lunch hours seem to be verrrrrrry busy. The taste of food is just mediocre, but nothing really to complain about (considering I don't really think any places in SF are outstanding). The choices for food are numerous and cover a variety of different categories (soups/broths, noodles, rice plates, meat, lunch boxes, etc.). The reason for 4 stars? the fact that I've been here countless times since I was a kid and have yet to have a bad experience.

AI08Y4XhXYV7xdABtQXhdg.review_text: My experience at Arang was okay. Especially after my recent trip to LA & had some of the best Korean food in K-Town, Arang really can't compare. The place was pretty tiny but they seated the nine of us accordingly in a timely fashion. The service wasn't bad at all, they took our orders & we got our food pretty quickly. The waitress checked up on us every now & then & refilled our waters.   One of the best parts of Korean cuisine that I love are the complimentary appetizers. I was snacking on them so much that I barely ate my actual food. I got a bento box which consisted of pot-stickers, a salad, pickled veggies, rice, & Korean spare ribs. It was good but nothing to rave about. It filled me up but I can't see myself craving this.   The thing that made this experience less favorable was the fact that two of the three cars that we parked in the parking lot near the restaurant got towed. Its apparently Safeway's parking lot but this plaza consisted of other restaurants & stores that you'd think would share the lot. So be careful where you park!

DEne4NSGx1yunoiekck2Qg.review_text: at one point in july, i was was going to arang for dinner once a week! the food here is great for its price! i always get the bbq pork dinner box, its not too spicy and it's a perfect portion for me.   This is a small restaurant with 2 workers there, so service might be a bit slow during the weekends because it tends to get pretty packed. I see a lot of people do go there for birthday celebrations.    If you're in the area and looking for a cheap quick bit, this is the place to go! It's easy to find parking because there is a huge parking lot right outside where safeway is.

kIFja02Dxs7KdUHj_rY0nQ.review_text: Go-to place for late-night Korean food (they close at 2am). It's reasonable, fast, & there are many options of the menu. The bibimbop, tofu soup, and kalbi soup all good. And I love the traditional sides that come with it too!

VBB5DgwC3nbmnJ46XG6B2Q.review_text: This place is a great little secret in the Webster plaza. Its easy to miss on the outside and inside the restaurant is kind of a hole in the wall.   I work on Laguna and anytime I'm craving Kim Chee Fried Rice, this is my go-to place. I first heard about it from a coworker and I love the fact that they put spam and corn in the kim chee friend rice. It's also cheap! for the lunch special, i believe its only $6.50, maybe a little more. they have other lunch specials that are also cheap. The bento lunch boxes come with rice, soup, salad, yam noodles, choice of entree, and pot sticker. Its a lot of food for $6.50-$7. It's not my top choice Korean restaurant, but I would definitely come back whenever I work and would like a cheap lunch.

meeQY6SyqAEsgffe_jq9eQ.review_text: I love this place! I come here every other Monday when I'm not working. My fave dish is Seafood Bi Bim Bop. It is so delicious. I usually get it without octopus. The dish comes with shrimp, calamari and muscles. The price is reasonable. The side dish is tasty also. Love the fish cake! Another dish I tried was the fried chicken wings. The skin was crispy and crunchy--very good! If you're fan of Korean food or want to try it for the first time, I recommend Arang!

2EHRvAkAkJ1WR1TCzqB4tg.review_text: Food: 2.5-3 stars. Serving "army jige" and Dol Sot at 1AM with K-Pop playing, oh...and easy parking in the Safeway parking lot gives it extra points with me. And generally pretty good service as well. Good as in friendly, not necessarily fast. But friendly makes up for a lot!

L8PRZYJ-Xpux56ChOAqgZA.review_text: This place seems pretty legit for korean food. However I was sad that there was only one type of tofu soup (but since it wasn't a tofu house, i'm not complaining) Also note that on weekends they only serve dinner during lunch time- aka its more expensive for the same thing. You can park in the safeway lot- major plus, since parking is terrible in the city. And it's not too far from Union Square- so it was a nice pit stop before some shopping.

lg-6HiY8QL0f3_ttCYdt9A.review_text: Just returned from Arang where a friend's mother from Korea hosted a dinner for our group of 6. Our dinner was excellent.  I first ate at  Arang  a few months ago and the food was very good, but tonight's dinner was even better.  I had the salmon teriyaki, a Japanese dish, but prepared beautifully at this Korean restaurant. The salmon portion was huge and cooked perfectly. The teriyaki flavoring was subtle so the flavor of the salmon was prominent. I don't think I've ever had salmont teriyaki this good. Not one bone in the beautiful fillet.  If you're a salmon-eater (as I am) you MUST  enjoy the salmon at Arang.  Other foods were excellent, too, as was the friendly and efficient service.  In my opinion, Arang is a gem if you like Korean, other Asian, or just superior food in general.

pGDTwuyzc3ORTDJ69hzEWg.review_text: ok so if any of your dinner attenpts at the Japan Town Center werent very pleasing then maybe you should try this place across the street in "Korea town?" my friends love coming here and its always a blast for us...maybe even a few tear drops of laughter...but thats only after we get our table  the food here is great even though my girlfriend and i usually get the same dish(it wouldnt be great if its usually packin with hungry ass mo-fo's like me no would it?) with a few exceptions of bbq pork or bbq beef and bi bim bap(?). two of my friends usually get the OB beer along with their dish so they really enjoy this place. the atmosphere is ok...according to my girlfriend she can tell that the music is pretty cheesy with the exception of a few illegible yet catchy songs lol but there always seems to be a familiar tone once in a while...just eat and dont mind the music it just helps for the background. as for parties, you should be ok with 4 but there IS a section of the restaurant thats usually used for parties for 6 or more...the only issue with that is yanno how big groups get...they could be done with their food yet theyre still laggin and killing time...not very courteous to the anxious group of people waiting in line...which is also another issue cuz this place isnt really all the BIG? and people do tend to just eat and talk to their hearts content but that goes for everyone...available staff is usually 2 or 3 which doesnt exactly help either  regardless...if you do manage to stay and wait for your table youre gonna enjoy this place...great food and good atmosphere though the wait time CAN throw you off but the good thing about it is that theyre open late so definitely id suggest a drop-by

dbh_9Xy5-jSJ5aXNOzHonQ.review_text: I think a lot of the hype that surrounds this place is b/c people usually associate this place as AWESOME EATS after clubbing/late night eats, b/c when I went there for dinner on a Wednesday (very sober), it was pretty lackluster.   I couldn't decide want I wanted to eat. I haven't had kalbi tang in a while but I'm a total fire junky so I gotta have my spicy food. I ended up deciding that I needed more variety in my life, so I went for the kalbi tang, which wasn't bad at all. No complaints really. The broth had a nice flavor, this soup makes me all nice and tingly inside. I usually love having this stuff after snowboarding or on a rainy day, and slurp up the vermicelli noodles and be a cave man and chew on my huge honkin piece of rib.  But what I couldn't believe is that my friend ordered soon du bu and the waiter asked how spicy. He said, as spicy as you can get it. In all seriousness, please try to kill me kind of spicy. b/c we all know my Japanese friend todd, LOVES his spicy, maybe even more than me.   My other friend ordered ra-pok-ki (ramyun and dukkpoki) no specific level of spiciness, but when the food came out, the tofu soup and the duk po ki, tasted exactly the same. I WAS SOOOO DISAPPOINTED, maybe a little embarrassed for my people. You have no idea how excited I was for them to just deliever this crazy spicy concoction, and it wasn't spicy AT ALL.   There was no tingle in my mouth. I'm not exaggerating at all. I didn't know where all the red was coming from, b/c the thing was SO RED, but SOOO NOT SPICY.   Sigh.... I can't go on, I'm so sad. My people are supposed to be the masters of spicy. -_-  If you don't plan on making it spicy, why even bother asking how spicy?  will i come back? heck no, there are way better korean places in the city.

mMqGnoQgsivB8ZvSsvnIIw.review_text: my friends parked at the Safeway lot and got their cars tolled.  true, they overstayed their welcome by a few hours, but i still recommend finding street parking.  friends don't let friends get their cars tolled, especially since the fee is apparently mad expensive.  the side dishes are few and somewhat shady looking, and they put beans in their kimchi ramen stew, but the rest of their menu is tasty and consistent, no matter what crazy hour you decide to drop by.  there's usually always a wait though and the two seats they have by the door are never free.

dWe_c1dQFmgyFjejMe7RDw.review_text: I'll have to reevaluate this restaurant as I ordered something and received the wrong order. Food was OK portions were small and service wasnt good as it was a waitor error and no compensation.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Waitress: "Can I see your IDs please?"  My friends and I *eyebrows raised*: "We're old..."  Waitress: "You guys look YOUNG!"  Me (thinking to myself): "YAY! Maybe I DO have a couple of years before I officially become 'Cougar Status'!"  Last night's dinner at Arang was like a trip down memory lane for me. In the early 2000s, this was the "spot" to come for underage drinking before/after karaoke. Past forward 10 years, it's good to know that they NOW check IDs b/c I absolutely do NOT condone underage drinking *eyes staring at the ceiling*.   My friends and I came to here at about 9:30 PM for a post-movie dinner/drinking. A table of four had just left, so we were promptly seated.  FOOD/DRINKS: *Peach Soju (Pitcher - $24): It was ok. We used this to chase down the Chamisul.  The peach taste came from peach syrup from a can and not juice as it was a bit syrupy, sweet, and an odd yellow/orange color. If you like fruit sojus made w/ real fruit juice, check out the "The Spot" or "Toyose" in the Sunset.   *Yogurt Soju (Small - $6): Better than the peach soju. It was creamy, sweet, and tart with a slight hint of alki flavor.   *Chamisul (375 ml - $9.95): It was GOOD! The filtered sake was clean and refreshing.   *Soondubuchigae (Tofu Soup - $8.95): I didn't have any, so I can't account for the taste.  *Tteokbokki (Korean Rice Sticks -$9.95): Meh! The cylinder rice sticks were boiled and then stir-fried in gochujang (chili and fermented soybean) sauce. Because the rice sticks are very glutinous and wasn't cooked thoroughly, it was like chewing on stale gum.   *Kalbi (BBQ Beef Shortribs - $16.95): YUMMY! The short ribs were perfectly cooked and were fatty, tender, and very flavorful from the soy, ginger, garlic, brown sugar, and sesame marinade.   *Stir-fried Soon-dae (Korean Sausage - $12.95): Eck! This looked nothing as pictured on the menu nor on Yelp which displayed slices of fried sausages. What we received was sausages mixed with jap chae (vermicilli) and gochujang. Soon-dae is made of pig's intestines and stuffed with a mixture of pig's blood, rice, green onions, garlic, minced pork, and vermicelli. It's definitely an acquired taste. Because it's steamed first, it's has a mushy texture and an irony after taste. The jap chae was overcooked and soaking in the gochujang sauce.   *Spam and Sausage Jeongol (Casserole - $22.95): YUMMY! Essentially, you get a big pot of kimchee soup filled with sliced rice cakes, kimchee, SPAM, hotdogs (not the soon-dae), green onions, topped with a block of raw ramen. After letting everything simmer on your table for 5 minutes, mix everything and you have a stew-like concoction. If you like kimchee tofu soup, ramen, and most importantly SPAM, you will LOVE this dish! The soup was rich, savory, and super spicy. And, the other ingredients depend on the cooking time, cook it shorter if you want al-dene ramen and rice cakes and longer if not.   *Kimchee Fried Rice ($7.95): YUMMY! Spicy al-dente rice w/ cubes of spam and an egg over easy with a runny yolk....may I need to say more? I don't think so...  *Bingsu (Korean Shaved Ice - $4.95): YUMMY! The shaved ice is topped with vanilla ice cream, red beans, bananas AND cinnamon toast crunch! It's basically a Korean version of Halo-halo. It's had a good combo of texture combos: cold, creamy, rich, sweet, and crunchy. This is a definite MUST order to cool down your tongue after devouring all the spicy dishes!  SERVICE:  For an Asian restaurant, I thought it was pretty damn good. The waitress was very nice and friendly. She took our orders promptly, we got ALL of our food within 15 minutes, and she came to check on us every so often.  AMBIANCE/DÉCOR: Hasn't changed a bit from the last time I went in 2001. They still have the same neon sign inside and out, bamboo plants, and hanging bubble lights. The dining area to the left has 4 tables that sits 4 people each and there's 3-4 booths on the right side that sits 4 people each.   PARKING: Arang is conveniently located in The Fillmore Shopping Plaza (Safeway, Popeyes) across from Panda Express and next to Subway, so you can park in the lot.   Although some of their items were a Hit OR Miss, Arang's pricing and service has an edge over other Korean restaurant; e.g. Won Mi charges $25.95 for Kalbi while Arang charges just $16.95. So, if you're having a late night craving for Korean Food (closes at 2 AM everyday) and don't feel like dropping $$$, Arang is definitely a place to check out esp for their bento boxes under $10 which comes with a meat of your choice, jap chae, gyoza, rice, and salad!

88qLfMt45wIB1in74KrDMA.review_text: I really like the Dohl Soht BiBim Bap here (ya know, the mix of rice, meat and veggies in the stone pot.)  I like how it already has the red pepper paste mixed into it.  Spiced to perfection!

WNbVCtfq2lGMEwLDXyyd6A.review_text: Nothing special Everything Korean in the bay that's "spicy" somehow tastes like korean instant ramen soup base. That's how my yukgaejang tasted like. The galbi tang was nothing special. Maybe too much sesame oil.

MIfBh6Br2lJDozVNDDg1ZA.review_text: I am between 3 and four stars here, it depends on the visit and what you get.  The Chicken Udon was average, the Bi Bim Bap was very good.  The Salmon Teriyaki was average, the Kim Chee Fried Rice was excellent.  Sensing a pattern?  I say stick to the Korean fare.  The restaurant was small but is easy to order to go.  The staff was friendly and has always had people in their eating when I have gone.  Prices are reasonable, the menu is large and they have karaoke at night if that adds anything for you (or takes something away)

_Hum_JURLFwrAtAnzO2n-A.review_text: If you're looking for a decent Korean meal, especially late in the evening, Arang is the place to hit.  The food will satisfy your Kalbi and Be Bim Bap craving, but unlike other Korean places, they don't serve much as far as appetizers are concerned.  The kimchee is pretty tasty.  They also serve a great iced tea.  You don't come here for the ambiance or the service.  They play loud, out-dated music, which can get annoying when all you want is a good meal and good conversation.  The staff often forgets about you.  You're advised to ask for 3 glasses of water from the get go, if you tend to drink a lot, like me.  If you're hungry for Korean and don't know where to go, it's not a bad place to try.  After reading the other reviews, I'll have to try Won Mi just because I know there's gotta be a great Korean restaurant somewhere around here...

J_ZY3YDkAVzEEYxvthozCw.review_text: I love arang for lunch and for late night eats.  There are not alot of options in SF for Korean food unless you marry a fob/date a fob or your room mate is.   Right now I'm SOL so I find myself here for lunch, late night anju and for some holiday tunes.   Also I tell myself its healthier than Popeyes and more filling than Jubilee.   PS I don't come here without a friend b/c the Safeway parking lot can be a little shady.

lz2AQZtuFDIlW7KOZ5QZYA.review_text: I'm a big fan of Arang. Love their kimchi fried rice and the dessert. This place is really small so just order to go!

a1eJZ8kJZIcY4FY-w8N_HQ.review_text: I thought this place was great and especially great for the price.  The first time I went here the dinner bill was $28 and half that bill was just the beer.  I will DEFINITELY come back as this is a great deal.

K0SG0i5nrjo2fVp77G0A_w.review_text: Great food, good prices.  The lunch box/dinner box specials are an excellent meal, and for only $8.50 at dinner time.    Drinks are well priced, consisting mainly of Korean beer and sake as well as soju.  Service: service is a little sub par, but when I visit Arang, I'm in the minority, they may get a couple of annoying tourists that drop in, and I used to get mistaken for one.  Open til 2:00AM, one of the best places to eat in filmore/japantown area

k_seSrhHW-vjB-W3Vh-XEw.review_text: This isn't the best Korean I've had but it's decent and a good value. The place seems to have a bit of a Japanese influence on the menu. I had the grilled mackerel ($8.95). For my $8.95 I got:  - 1 standard miso-sized bowl of miso soup. it was your standard Japanese-resto miso-y miso soup. good enough  - unstrained barley tea  - an odd all-in-1 panchan plate containing -- potato salad (not western chunky style, more like minced) -- steamed egg white -- fish cake strips -- kimchee (of course) -- tofu strip  - mackerel with a coupla slices of lemon sharing a plate with iceberg lettuce with whatever that pinkish dressing is called (see what I mean about the Japanese influence--not that there's anything wrong with that)  the mackerel was just slightly overcooked but flakey and tasted good with the lemon  I also tried their red bean shaved ice dessert. contains red beans and shaved ice (duh), vanilla ice cream, and fruit cocktail. a bit pricey for the size at $4.95 but fun and tasty to eat   this would probably not be my first, second or even third choice visiting this neighborhood for a repeat visit, but if I worked in the neighborhood I would definitely eat here regularly

JvNMi2Oh6o6SfcIsq73KNA.review_text: It's quite possible that nostalgia influences my rating for Arang but I consider this place my comfort food.  Around 8 years ago I used to come here during my grad school days and I either ended up drunk or came here drunk.    Fast forward to the present and the circumstances are the same and I still really like this place, mainly because of value and speed of service.   The food won't knock your socks off but it will keep your belly warm and your wallet full.

4x7LmgcKW3ASIvxr2drHSQ.review_text: Korean restaurant is the only place for me to cheat.  I usually don't eat beef, but here I purposelessly did.  The hotpot with casserole.. with spams, sausage, noodle and rice cakee... Oh so good! I don't even know what kind of meat it is made of anymoree................ and now I feel so full of sin.  The Seafood pancake is okay, 3*** Bibimbap and bul gok si is okay~  Their side dish of Kimchee and friends is a 5*****, especially when such thins is free.  The rice tea is 5***** The service is another 5*****  If you eat spicy food, go with the spicy ones.

486c4Pznd00sbs2wh7eNyg.review_text: All around, pretty good. Been here a few times now and tried a bunch of stuff. All quite tasty, with the seafood bibimbap standing out, and the fried chicken wings not quite so. But it's open late, the parking is convenient with the big Safeway lot behind, and it's certainly popular. Despite my only 3* have already been there a number of times, and each time quite satisfied.

ftqKNw6BbcEqT6eQCDzupg.review_text: If you're around this area (Fillmore) and just finished karaoke-ing and feel like Korean food, this is always a satisfying place to go, and on the cheaper side compared to the other Korean restaurants up the street. They don't give a lot of side dishes, don't bother refilling your tea, but their food is always consistently good and they have combo dinners, which I like. This place is on the small side though so if you're trying to come here on a busy night, well, don't. But if you're there and they actually have seats, pop in to try it. I'm sure you at least think it's ok.   By the way, DO NOT PARK AT THE SAFEWAY LOT. Back in the day that's what we all used to do when we were in the area (and not shopping at Safeway) and it was perfectly fine, but a few years ago they really started cracking down on people who are using their lot, and they TOW YOUR CAR after an hour or something. So if you're new to the area just keep that in mind, don't park there. Trust me. Your ass will get towed.

mdNgxuT9Geph2ZL5lDam0g.review_text: One of my favorite spots to go to for late nite eats and drinking.  Been meaning to write a review for this place for the longest time and again I dnt like sharing places I really like cuz its hard enough tryin to get a seat at this place at certain times.  I was introduced to this place years back in my clubbing days from one my good guy friends.  We used to roll up in this place 15 deep if not more after the club or goin out and we would take up that whole corner section by the mirrors..lol...those days!  Its always a good time goin to this place.  Except maybe one time on a first date and the alcohol couldnt help me that night to get thru it...lol.  But every time i bring in a new person they love it and they go there w/o tellin me..u A$$es!!  This place can be fun especial the people who eat there Ive meet some of the coolest folks around. Some are even cool enough to let u try some of their dishes they are eating if u ask nice enough what they are eating.  But the food is good no matter what u order. Especially the pot stickers...hahaha we always have to order our own cuz no one wants to share...lol! The fried glass noodles are also very good.  The place is open pretty late. I think they close like 2 but they never seem to kick anyone out even thou its passed that. The music inside is pretty interesting.  Techno asian ...lol...not sure what u call it but for sure I feel like speed racing after being there. The parking is in the safeway shopping area complex. Its gotten strict they only allow 2 hour parking in the lot and they start towing and for reals there are tow trucks in the lot waiting.  I guess people be partying a lil too much there and leaving theirs cars...lol...i dnt...  Two solid key items to order the Pot stickers and the Peach Soju = a good nite. Plus I love their potato salad and the brown rice tea that comes with toasted popcorn on top..lol its the lil things!!!

ccNPeR1FsdhGeBhaH4rZgg.review_text: Been here a couple times and everything has been good.  I love the tea that they give you. The spicy pork and bibimbap are very tasty and well portioned.  I can't wait to try their other dishes!

coGZPoErPVgHTreR6BbVCg.review_text: $$ might be overstating it. We paid $24 for two people for Bimbimbap. I had the one with kimchee, my friend had the regular with beef. Easy to park nearby. Would definitely go back.

EL7s606hrQlzu13jD6cxUA.review_text: I came here on a chilly late evening and there was no wait. I got the spicy tofu soup and it was really good! my favorite is always the unlimited  complimentary bon chon dishes! My boyfriend got the bim bam bop which I thought was really good! I would recommend this place to anyone who's passing by the city for some good korean food. The service was just ok to me; nobody really came to check up on us, I had to flag them down when i needed anything. Besides that, other people sitting around us had food coming out that looked really delicious as well! I am looking forward to trying more things on their menu!

jspjDeI6Ti75XE_Sj0wCTg.review_text: Haven't written a review in so long and suddenly I'm in the mood, yay!  Arang is my hotspot for korean food when I don't feel like going far. It has plenty of parking in the lot at Safeway (I usually come at night so I'm assuming it's safe...) and the food really hits the spot for me. I've been here like 3-5 times already and it has definitely been good practically every time.  My first time here I got the udon for lunch with some friends because I was not feeling korean food at the time haha, stupid me. It wasn't terribly yummy and I didn't want to come back especially in such a cramped space and it's not so ideal location haha. (That door is so heavy!)  Then I came back with another group of friends and had the real experience, bibimbap!!!! And I went a bit further and got the kimchi bibimbap! Oh man, that was satisfying for a cold day in sf, but when is it ever hot? And the appetizers/starting plate thing were yummers too. Too bad I had to keep asking for it to be refilled.  Then I had a strange craving for soondubu and I got it. Very satisfying once again, different appetizer/plate thingy that has random foods.  And it repeats like so with me leaving happy and filled. It's a bit pricey for the food probably considering the ingredients that go in there, but it's so damn good :)   Try try try, kimchi bibimbap :))))

cnZc5XGOTfv-JEd9nFouhw.review_text: Got taken here for my first time a few months back. Couple weeks later, I took my gf. And most recently, maybe 3-4weeks ago. And usually it's late at night (after 10 or 11p.m.) because really, when we can't think of places to go, it's Arang to the rescue.  The first time was great. We had kimchi fried race, a plate of the chewy rice noodles, and a plate of bulgogi. I had never had the chewy stuff before so it took a while getting used to the extra chews I had to take before swallowing, but it was pretty good after that. Some of you might find it very different from "regular" textured food, so be careful.  The second time, I had the tofu soup and my gf had the bento box. The soup was okay, I've had better. The tofu had a good consistency (I think...). Bento box, eh..I never really bother with buying these anywhere. It's just the default item you choose when you can't make up your mind.  The most recent time I go the mackerel. I had eaten some a week or two before it and was just craving some more, so I ordered it. It came out EXTREMELY OILY! be forewarned..each bite of it and I could feel the oil oozing from the fish. I had to grab 2 napkins to pad that sucker down before it was safe to eat, haha. But once I did that, it was pretty good.  Overall, 4 stars. Food is pretty decent, parking is widely available with the huge lot right there for Safeway. Then again, I've always been there late at night with no one around, so I can't say during the day. Service is shoddy..the ladies don't come by often enough, so I feel you guys about the water refills. Maybe the ladies are so tired by the time I get there? haha But really, I don't expect great service when I go to Asian restaurants. Growing up in Vietnamese in San Jose and going to all the Viet restaurants has set my standards a little lower than the norm :P

nkbMyNLzA4NJws7YRt_c9A.review_text: I am a big fan here, and have been coming to this place since for about 10 years. The service here is getting worst and worst.

xxxO3WDVSVJEE1fdNv8bmg.review_text: hooray for arang! I love the ramen, I know I can go out and buy the package and cook it at home and it will be exactly the same, but the whole point is, I go to arang when I don't want to cook.  Plus, they put all sorts of tasty extras in like eggs, onion, etc. and you can ask them to make it extra spicy!  bf always gets the dinner boxes, those are pretty tasty as well, there's a bbq pork one - every time he gets it, I steal some :D  love the fact that it's open late, and i love the tea there - anyone know what kind of tea it is?  it's little grains at the bottom but it doesn't taste like the barley tea you normally get at korean restaurants . . .

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: I really only came here to try to the Korean version of shaved ice (patbingsu) so it might not be fair to rate the entire restaurant.
