I've never had Korean shaved ice before so didn't know what to expect. The shaved ice comes with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, red beans, slices of banana, cinnamon toast crunch, and other goodies. It's also gigantic. Definitely recommend sharing. I liked the crunchiness of the cinnamon toast cereal but am undecided on the combination of ice cream and shaved ice. It's a little weird to me to have ice on ice cream. It just dilutes the ice cream creaminess to watery.

wfdktRlL6Kdka9N6Qe1NDQ.review_text: Having never tried Korean food, I was somewhat excited at a last minute invitation.  Unfortunately, I did not bother to do my research and when I skimmed through Arang's menu choices, I defaulted to my usual Japanese favorite, Salmon Teriyaki.  When deciding between a box or plate, I chose the plate, thinking there would be less extra side items (which I usually waste), and went for the plate.  Turned out the plate was all Salmon in Teriyaki sauce with a few onion slivers along the sides.  The small bowl of rice was on the side along with a plate of some other side items.    The salmon itself was okay, but a tad on the dry side.  The warm sake was presented in a little jug with two tiny tea cups.    The service seemed to favor the right side of the dining room as we found it difficult to get the attention of our waitress as she spent a lot of time over there.

RsmzkgQ6S9ghtKb2DGX0Mw.review_text: I felt like it was a go to place for many people of the neighborhood. It's a small place and it looks like it gets packed quickly. The food was standard except the soft tofu soup packed quite the punch. It was really good. If you get the chicken plate, get the spicy one. The plain one lacked flavor but at least it was tender. It's affordable and you will be full.

w3i38u9W-wUxPqCYo3oJJQ.review_text: Delicious Korean eats at cheap prices with late-night hours! I love their soon dooboo, bulgogi, and bibimbap. Unfortunately, their wait staff can be pretty inattentive. One time after they sat my group, they entirely forgot to bring us place settings (none whatsoever) or any beverages. Other times, they've fail to check up on my table after bringing our food. The waitresses can be quite very rude. The restaurant itself is pretty small, so the wait for a table can be quite long. Give it a try. 3 stars.

XWPArM1Q0u9QxsGUjbotMg.review_text: 4 stars because this is one of those restaurants that is ideal for those evenings when you just want to sit down and chat with friends over food and drinks without being hurried to get out. The restaurant is small but depending on which seats you get it may be cozy. The music is not too loud so you can still have good conversations.   They never rush us to leave as long as we keep ordering a drink every now and then. (the peach soju and plum wine is worth trying) At times they also surprise us with an extra dish on the house!

Ud6j2HN40qEhycq2PuwcBA.review_text: This little Korean place in the Fillmore is decent for its prices and portions. We shared the Meat variety soup base which was excellent with lots of veggie, spam, sausage, noodles and Shanghainese style flat noodles. We also tried the short ribs and kal-bi tang. They were both tasty and decently priced and we were stuffed.  Service was sketchy but guess she was the only server around the entire time. Interestingly, there was also loud Korean music blaring in the background but overall, a great experience and casual place to enjoy the soup in the cold evenings.

tVwvcuC-mIY53uT_utM_BA.review_text: I would like to give this place five stars for the simple fact that they stay open so late, but the fact that they only put one waitress on the floor knocks it down a few stars.  The poor girl was swamped and I think forgot about us at least three time.  The food is good and at a good price.  Unfortunately, not too many places are open that late in this area and this place is no secret to the young and hungry crowd!

hdInklWHWoGSEkoRKFODxQ.review_text: This place is awesome..love how they have a lot of parking for a SF location.  Came here a few times but I haven't been in years! Finally I came again today.  Place is great for groups.  Service is A+! Banchan was pretty good...i like their moo kimchee (the radish kimchee) They have pretty cool dinner boxes with plentiful food but just a few bux more you get the plate..the bulgogi plate was really good and I really enjoyed their bi bim bap.  They are pretty known for their sojus...i've had their regular ones and the peach one, i think, but that was many many years ago..now they have yogurt flavor, def want to try that next time but I was kinda hammed from earlier in the day.  Next door there is a karaoke..cool beans! Def want to come eat, get buzzed and go next door and sing ...sounds like a fun night one day!

xHR18NhCXmtNGjQv2FDHVg.review_text: I've been here twice. Both times I ordered the bi bim bap without meat, mainly because that's what I can only eat on the menu. My friends ordered beef and chicken bento boxes. They seemed to enjoy it.  I like my bi bam bap, it was a good meal, although it made me really thirsty afterward. Their place is kinda small though.

qb4OYM1eAkbTvPtRRm58ag.review_text: this place is awesome. great food. excellent service. if you tell them (as I must) that you don't know Korean food they'll tell you flat out what's good and what's better.   every time I've been here it's been great.   one final word for you. with much hot sauce:  bibimbap

6rVoU6TfbwPI0bhutDKeNg.review_text: Nothing particularly special about this small Korean joint except that it stays open late at night serving alcohol and is the cheapest Korean place in this neighborhood.  I had the dolsot seafood bibimpbop.  Alas, most of the seafood was octopus, nary a sight of shrimp (except for one tiny shrimp tail) nor almost any other lovely crustaceans.  However, what can one expect when paying only $8.95 for seafood bibimbop.    Banchan comes on a tv-dinner sort of tray (plastic dish sectioned out into 4 parts) with 2 types of kimchi (the usual baechu and small cucumber slices), vinegared julienned radish slices, thin sliced fishcake...I think a couple of other items I have since forgotten.  Basic.  Again, you are not paying a lot here.  Service was fine.  But please indulge me by speaking Korean to me when I speak Korean, even though my Korean is so atrocious.   So, okay for the bucks, but definitely not a destination spot.  And there were two most annoying young men near us using large words, overwrought grammar and effected speech patterns in talking about Korean food and Korean culture without knowing much about either.  Sad--go read some history books before you speak pompously.

jJS__qxg4yQXQ9z3trGx0w.review_text: YUMMY, DIVY Korean spot in the Fillmore. Their bibim naengmyun is to die for. Get a bit of the naengmyun broth and some vinegar in the bowl and it reaches a God-like status. The fact that they have PATBINGSOO (a good one at that) made the inner child in me sing and frolic in the land of happiness and joy. You shan't be disappointed.

_Qq6o8eKoSGt6i8CIj98rw.review_text: I went to Arang twice for dinner and once for late lunch. No self-BBQ so no smoke will get stuck to your clothes! Although I do like that. This place is a little cheaper than some other Korean restaurants in Japantown.  This place is small so it's not ideal for parties more than 4 or 6. Every time I went, it was pretty busy so be prepared for a little wait. I like how at night, they play Korean music (largely K-Pop) and during the day they play American music, just so you know~. lol  They give you relatievly the same type of banchan every time. Tofu, eggs, kimchi, bean sprouts, seaweed, etc. The pig feet is great! Get it if you want to try something different. Don't worry, they slice it for you! I didn't like the lamb in the hot pot (for 2 or more) because I hate the way it smells (personal preference). The beef hot pot was like an army stew thing if you know what I mean. If not, please Google it. Didn't give a lot of japchae and my god, that stuff's soooo goooodddd!!!! Bibimnaengmyeon was great as well. ! Even my cousin who sucks at eat spicy foods couldn't get enough of it!  I think pretty much everything is freaking awesome. Haven't tried their sundubu yet though. Their (dol sot) kimchi bibimbap (forgot the shorter version) was great but it was the first time I had it so nothing to compare it to. They do give a lot for bibimbaps.   Basically can't go wrong with any menu items but I do wish they had a larger menu for soups and the like. They even have soju cocktails but I can't drink those since I'm not yet of age. =(

xdOF_l0iaB8tCSfT6rwg0A.review_text: i first came upon this place after watching a show at the fillmore, and i must say that it was a fitting end to an already awesome evening.  the prices are very reasonable, and the food is great.   To add to everyone elses recommendations, i agree, try the Bi Bim BAP (it sounds like an onomatopoeia, or sound effect for all you laymen out there lol j/k...), it's really good.  and you can also look throught their korean magazine, from what i can tell they are fashion magazines.  Fun to look at.

zDfGiR43eBZjh3jtu9faVA.review_text: First came here a few years ago with my friend Sydney. and have been back a few times whenever in this neck of the woods and feelin for some korean, specifically Bibimbap.   Rice beef mushroom carrot zucchini beansprouts and an egg delicately placed into a hot stoneware bowl, then i go ahead and mix it all up and add gobs of that delicious chili paste. so simple but its soooo good!  other good stuff, the kimchi fried rice, sauteed pork and veggies, and the banchan (as always!)  and its cheap! gotta try the lemon, yogurt, and peach soju next time

y-xnIeYdLh0HlPws6_wYgg.review_text: I've been here many times and I must say it's a pretty good place for the amount you pay. If you go there during lunch time, you can get a really good deal, too!  I've tried: *Bi-Bim-Bap ($8.95): Comes with assorted small Korean dishes *Marinated Rice Sticks ($6.95): Spicy but I can't stop eating them! *Bi-Bim-Neng-Myon ($7.95): I used to only know Bi-Bim-Bap but then I discovered this chewy cold noodle dish. It has been my favorite ever since!  I would also recommend their lunch boxes. They are filling but also cheap!   I think every waiter or waitress who works here are nice. I've never had any bad service experience.  In my opinion, this is a perfect lunch spot! Yes, of course I will go back for more!

n6GBeJVd1C2dszlSOBAfJw.review_text: The first time I came here, I couldn't remember a thing because I was SO drunk, the only thing I remember was  running to the bathroom every 2 minutes.. But my friend told me it was really good, especially on a cold night. I like how they open really late. I came here with my co-worker around 1230 in the morning after a long night working in the kitchen and standing/running around the whole night. I was surprised that there were lots of people in here at that time. The only thing I didn't like is that they didn't give any small complementary dishes that Korean places usually give out. I got the Bi Bim Bop. It was a hefty portion. Lots of beef, they way I like it. For about $9? It was really affordable. I like the gum they give with your check.. you give some and receive some..

GGSfLyM88SbFGhnm46ykXQ.review_text: Small little place, but quite busy for lunch  - BBQ beef lunch combo    - Beef is below average - Salmon Terriyaki lunch combo     - Salmon is alright but nothing special  Service is very slow...

Egxm2aSl_e9PoO-I-0XaLA.review_text: Came here last night with a few of my friends and had a great time.The food was great, especially for the price, most korean restaurants charge a lot more than they do.. WOOT FOR CHEAP KOREAN FOOD! My friends and I ordered my the Kimchee fried rice.. which was so BOMB, meat casserole which had A LOT OF SPAM! I LOVE FREAKIN SPAM! anything with spam = delightful! The Kalbi was just right, great flavor and tender, Rice Cake with spicy sauce.... AHHH great flavor! Perfect amount of spiciness! and the seafood pancake.. my only complaint... where's the seafood... the only seafood inside was the squid! why not just call it SQUID PANCAKE! UGH!   Parking was super easy, but i just wish it was in a better neighborhood.. but whatever! not as bad as the TL. Service was great... i don't know what everyone was talking about.. it's like any other asian restaurant... you just got to flag em down!   Oh i forgot.... they have discounted alcohol! the beer and soju was crazy cheap compared to any other korean restaurant! WOOT crazy! I'll be back tomorrow!

DOZ9inLpd04Ic0Mm1d9fbw.review_text: Arang has a great bento box that you can get for lunch.  I had the BBQ Beef box and my friend had the Short Ribs box and both were around 7 dollars for lunch (which ran until 4pm).  It came with salad, this potato side, noodle side, 2 potstickers, rice, and a good amount of meat.  Pretty good deal.  I dont think I will ever find LA grade Korean food up here, but this is not bad at all.

rvhiQERykCAmgWNy3yuHwg.review_text: I've never had any problems with my Dolsot Bi Bim Bap (: It is still very delicious every time I go there . The staff is very friendly, however they need to learn how to pay more attention to their customers . Most of the time, I need to walk up to them & say, "Check, choo seh yo. (Check, please)." -__-" Their Arang Combo is probably the best deal if you want to get the bento boxes-- HELLA food . & if you want BETTER bento boxes (lunch boxes), go to a Japanese Restaurant .

ppQpZMPEiPaaEasMy8Wf4w.review_text: For some reason, the food here doesn't taste as good as it used to.  But the bento boxes are still pretty worth it.  I always get Kalbi bento box here and it never disappoints!

pnG4Gdr_A08l3DL6NREqrQ.review_text: I really love this place in Japan town!! Their every meals are so amazingly delicious and it's a definite must-try if you haven't already done so. I especially love their lunch&diner box special menu which is cheap and enough for one or even two persons. For dinner, I usually get a plate of seafood pancake, beef short lib, and assorted soup(it's called Budae-Jigae) to share with friends. So delicious that I had to come back a week later!!  The side dishes they serve are awesome. My favorites are a Kimchi, potato salad, and pink radish which is called Chayote(?). They are even refilled as much as you want forever!!! :)  It opens late till 2 AM!! Good thing for me and friends to enjoy late night with foods and drinks after midnight.   One more good thing is that you don't have to waste time to park your car. It is nearby Safeway so that you can park your car at Safeway parking lots which are available at anytime.   The food quality is excellent and the staff is super attentive and friendly. For sure coming back!!! :)

E-qY6f9K10heNwFg9Du3jg.review_text: Anything with BBQ beef.  When I'm in San Francisco, I always make a point of hitting this place.  My favorite Korean place in the city.

RkhSgjr0aAkBdJa42eaH5g.review_text: i've been coming to arang for almost 8 years now and it's one of the best places i like to eat.    no matter how hard crappy sucky stupid day at work, a meal here afterwards ALWAYS makes the whole day worth the struggle.  i like the short rib box (which comes with shredded potatoes, chapche glass noodles, 2 potstickers, rice, romaine/thousand island salad.  the meat for the most part is pretty well marbled (sometimes too much) but tender and juicy and sooooo flavorful.  the potstickers here are the best in town.  stuffed with delicately seasoned pork and veggies, the skins are just the right thinness, not too gummy/doughy, served with a nice soy/chili/green onion dipping sauce.  bi bim bap here is the bomb (rice, egg, veggies, beef or seafood or veggies served in a hot stone bowl), as is their accompanying bi bim bap sauce, sweet and spicy.  i also like the mussel soup and the stirfried squid over noodles (it's all sauteed in this red chili sauce and accented with zucchini and onions), great over rice.  and the dessert...  goodness only justifiable by actually having it live and in person.  (secret ingredient: ctc)  service can be slow since there's often only 1, sometimes 2 servers working the whole restaurant.  appetizer plate (kimchee, tofu, etc) is served only with the entrees, not the dinner boxes.  they play koit radio in the daytime and korean trance at night time!  portions are the same lunch and dinner, just different prices.  plus they're open til about 3am.

TLiv7pKzS1ruZ4rD1ZzhJw.review_text: Free parking in a lot! That's definitely a plus for this small Korean restaurant. We arrived on a Friday night and the place was full with a mostly Asian/korean crowd. Their menu is pretty extensive and prices are reasonable. They also have dinner bento boxes which is something I only see in Japanese restaurants.   We ordered the spicy fried chicken, kalbi bento box, and one of the spicy soups (sorry, I can't remember the name but it's in a red broth). Out of those 3 things, the only thing I would get again is the bento box because it was a really good deal for the price. This is definitely a fast, quick, and easy place to get some Korean food. It wasn't as good as Han II Kwon but it wasn't as expensive either.

KavFgapR_cJZaA_Kvfqsvw.review_text: I came here on the random one night and was quite impressed. My bf and I were hungry tigers so we each ordered one bento box and an appetizer of calamari.  As I recall, the price was decent, the food was yumm and the service was just okay.  They weren't that busy but everything took a long time....from ordering to getting the check, it was pretty slow.    I would come back here again if I'm in the mood for korean food but don't want to shell out an arm and a leg.  I noticed that people were drinking here so I figured...ohh it's probably one of those korean bars/restaurants like places and I thought it was pretty good for what it was.  It's open late which is good and if you're in the mood for decently price and a decent sized portion of korean food, I'd recommend it.  4 stars for what it is. If you're expecting fancy shmancy or something gourmet then don't come here.

Qjq5sCgR8dfQpTLO3oiVYw.review_text: We live really close to this restaurant and really enjoy having their lunch specials M-F. It's so cheap for awesome korean food. I usually get their bi bim ba and kim chee fried rice. So yummy :P  Lunch does get a lil crowded so get their early or expect a lil wait.  Their services are quick and very friendly. Their small dishes are pretty good and comes with rice in the tea that taste very good. I try to come here whenever we have a day off work. Cheers.!

J7ka23aCUNK-v_yLB4AL1Q.review_text: I loved this place when I ate there a few years ago. Lunch was large and cheap. Just how I like it. The bar-be-que beef was great and came with all sorts of side dishes.   The place is tiny so there was a few minute wait but the food was well worth it. I'll return.

k_PSkYpsex3vP-f08xfGxg.review_text: Great place to eat, at least you can get a really nice portion of Korean food for about half the price (approx $10) rather that the usual full-portion ( $20) which is on offer at many Korean joints in the area.  Cool dinner box combinations on offer, bento-box style.  I used to live right by this place back in 2002, and used to come here every other day. The menu has changed since then - now there is more to choose from !

xFsX2ySUNCOIGfNTNYiPMw.review_text: I love this place! Been coming here since I was in high school so 10+ years ago. Their spicy pork is actually quite spicy and flavorful!! Decent prices and I am usually here for lunch. I do wish customer service is a bit better because my cup of tea is ALWAYS empty and I always have to ask. They should put a teapot for each table because I drink a lot of tea. Sometimes, I feel bad asking for more tea when I don't think I should to begin with. Their Bi Bim Bap is pretty good as well.

duymKKwUruH8GwbvcaFd0w.review_text: People often think I'm Korean so I feel weird going into a real Korean place.  Luckily no one started talking to me in Korean, and I took my white friend's recommendation which was really good (Bim-Bim-Bap?)  Service was a bit random, but I don't think that's the primary reason to go here.  I would give it an extra half star for the melon gum too.

FFQzJQz30-2u-56V-iuzXQ.review_text: I am an avid fan of Korean food, Kalbi in particular. For where it's located, I didn't have any high hopes for this establishment to give Korean food justice, but oh boy I was impressed.  They have a variety of selections, both of meat, appetizers, soups and other combinations. I find this place rather cheap in terms of price, comparing it to the other Korean restaurants in San Francisco.  I recommend getting their lunch or dinner boxes that offers, kalbi, bulgogi, chicken teryaki which comes with salad, rice, the side dishes and a couple of gyozas.   I also suggest trying their yogurt soju that I find to be tasty without being bothered by any bad spirit after taste.

gk5BjGoT--YRci9ZJ_WElQ.review_text: Came here just today with my Korean friend .The ton-katsu was pretty good . It came with a side of rice , gyoza , salad , and noodles . The gyoza was alright . The salad was pretty good . It was lettuce with some kind of white dressing . I really liked the dressing . It was really watery but I like how it wasn't too salty & overpowering . The dressing had a light flavorful taste . The noodles w/ strips of potatoes were fantastic ! The strips potatoes were cut perfectly the right size and it went really well with the noodles .. very yummy . I tried some of my friend's chicken katsu it was pretty good too . My friend thinks I'm crazy but I could actually taste the difference between the chicken katsu & the ton katsu . The chicken in the chicken katsu tastes more thick while the pork in the ton katsu is not as thick and tastes more smooth . I ordered a dish of spicy rice cake which was alright but kind of too sweet . My friend agreed . It wasn't really that spicy either . Their dessert (they only have one) was good , but kind of dumb & a rip off . It was basically just a lot of shaved ice , some sweet milk , some Cinnamon Toast Crunch , red bean and pieces of fruits . I LOVE their homemade tea .. it's great . Idk what kind of tea it is but it has brown rice in it which I think is kind of cool . The service was very good too . The waitress kept refilling our teacups every time it was empty without us telling her to =) I will probably be back . I really recommend getting one of their box combo thingys .

ad0pY_CJs8rrTBZHD19M6w.review_text: I love this place! I always come here just for the Bi Bim Bop! It's the only thing I really eat here. I also brought my 5yr old nephew here once and he ate a whole plate of gyoza (9 of them!)!! I was super surprised that he could eat that many.

WDBxEL6ivJe6MSxSo1l6sw.review_text: I love this restaurant!! Most of their plates are GOOD and delicious.. plus it's CHEAP!  The only thing I hate is that it's a small restaurant and always crowded.

8frCo1AwIu46N_1jInwAWw.review_text: Came on a Monday evening to this very small place. Came in a group of 6, waitress tried to seat us at a booth for 4 and when I asked to be moved she reluctantly obliged.  Our waters weren't refilled and she took half our orders and took another 10 mins to get the rest.  The banchan was measly & mediocre..nothing special in taste or sight.   We had the bulgolgi, spicy pork, spicy chicken, beef bimbibap, and spicy pork bone soup.  The soup had a nice porky flavor and the spicy chicken actually tasted spicy.  Everything else was a failure.  Overall its a joint to stop in for a quick bite if you're in a rush to put something in your belly.  Don't stop by if you're looking for a good meal.  I certainly won't be back...ok food and poor service.

5rW1SpfOX22aSeKSyrLZxA.review_text: Food good!  Price okay!  Music cheesy!  Open late..Yay!!  The place to be after the after party..  Three dishes to try:  Bi bim bap Egg omelet Beef bento box w/tempura  **you always get a plate of appetizers like cucumber in hot sauce, fried tofu..yummy fun stuff  DO NOT TRY:   Beef short ribs in clear yam noodle soup--it's bland  I love the Hite beer and it's half price after hours, I think.. SOJU is good too, very fruity and light, but after a few glasses, you won't know what hit you!  That's the best part.  Don't forget the 20second watermelon gum they give you with your check!  (that's how long the flavor lasts)  Just a tip--Try to sit in the front, otherwise they treat you like a redheaded stepchild if you sit towards the back..

KxT8tTfFzOyYsoLGbMWdOw.review_text: Restaurant is in a corner in the plaza. Just FYI lol.   The spicy dokboki (rice cakes) with jul myun ( chewy noodles ) is sooo good and unbelievably big. The portion can prob fill me and two of my friends. - so much rice cakes. I love that. Usually, I find that Korean restaurants skim on the rice cakes and add tons of veggies. Not this place.   Bibimpap- pretty average in size and is meh.   Just get the dokboki with jul myun! *prices are average to me. Not cheap like others have said lol

JVTcskIsqBgyw7jTQC9GYQ.review_text: I'm looking at my December 2011 receipts and I ate here not long ago. We ordered the Bi Bim Bap, Galbi, Spicy Tofu Soup, and the Kimchee Fried Rice. It was a lot of food, so we took our time cramming it down. It's a smallish place fyi. The food is really satisfying. I like the fact that the "scenery" was giving my eyes a work-out; I couldn't be too obvious though. Big points for being opened until 2am. My goal is to try most things on their menu.

sI1AEPejbOupnZRDNlcvaQ.review_text: AH! I like!~ Good side dishes (bean curds and kimchi!)   I like cheap korean food. Bim bip bap was good.... it could use more toppings.. but at least they got the egg right!

dTdltcr2EC5oMZ1rs795PA.review_text: cheap decent korean food.  for cheap.  enough said.  its not fancy.  it's a good place to come with your friends and eat.  and drink.  or either or both.  i personally like the stone pot bibimbap.  the kalbi is pretty decent.  the spicy pork is also good.  the chicken wings you could pass on, but aren't bad.  just aren't worth getting all the time (like the aforementioned items)  but you're really here for the food and drinks.  the atmosphere leave's something to be desired, but not bad, just run of the mill.

Ym-aCrR1WyQTVzQmf-vI6g.review_text: Ok I always try to boost Korean businesses.. but sorry Arang.. ur service sucks! So my girlfriends and I came here on a friday night.. there were 6 of us and instead of putting two tables of 4 together for us.. they seated 10 groups of 4 people before us! By the way these groups of 4 were all pushy Koreans.. I was the only Korean of my group so I'm sure the host/waiter didn't realize I knew what he was saying! =(  I had to complain and finally they seated us and when we asked for extra noodles, he said he wouldn't charge us for it.. but he didn't even give us extra noodles!! the food here is good.. but the service sucks.. unless ur a pushy Korean!

gD9EpLRQwa-W42G0S11L9A.review_text: Good for late night. They are open late. Trendy music.   Service is a hit or miss. Bibimbap is awesome here. Their seafood casserole is good too. But dont expect sll those little side dishes u get from other korean restsurant. They give u a small plate of side dishes with egg, bean sprouts, rice cake and tofu but very small. So dont expect the big size side dishes...Small restaurant so don't bring big groups there.   DO NOT ORDER THE YOGURT SOJU ... It doesn't taste great and it's $26. Our two plates of food was only $24. Our bill ended up to be $60 with tax and tip. If the SOJU was good I don't mind paying so much for it but it wasn't good. Taste water down and a little like soda also. Weird.  But will always come back for late night food... Not drinks ;)

GPBQQikETatAin3zhUsisA.review_text: I totally expected to be the first to review this place, but of course it has 80 reviews. Go Yelp!  I often get the dinner bento boxes (chicken katsu, tempura) to-go. Does that make me totally boring? I hope not, because they're delicious. I enjoy most of the things they come with: 2 pot stickers, white rice, salad, vermicelli. Plus miso soup in a to-go container.  CONS: They once gave me the wrong dinner to-go, and last time they tried to charge me double.  PROS: Good food, nice staff, open late. Still worth stopping by.

ncqXsJEv1BzbK_D5og7UPA.review_text: I like this place, it's open late which is the best thing. Seems like a lot of Korean places in SF are open late. Anyways they have really good tofu soup and the food comes out fast. The staff is really nice. I enjoy the food. Also you get a lot of food too. Sometimes too much, only sometimes. Try it when you're up late.

Ldsm5LJ6UsThw_tniywKSw.review_text: Arang is my go to Korean restaurant. The place is small yet the food is packed with huge flavors. I always leave this place so full and can't believe how much I ate. The portions are generous to say the least.   The service is prompt and friendly. The only drawback is the mini-mall it's located in. There are a few panhandlers and homeless folks who can be a bit aggressive and loud.

nF-UM092NAxzdGqERXGZLw.review_text: We've been getting takeout from here pretty regularly for a couple years now. We love their short rib combination, seafood bibimbap, and seafood scallion pancake, but haven't really tried much else (we know what we like, kinda boring, I know).  The restaurant itself is a bit small so sometimes you have to wait if you want a table. Also, for some reason there's a lot of wait staff turnover, so you don't really get treated like a regular here even if you are one.

WDoVohp6F94IaSDsO8LSyQ.review_text: This review is ONLY about the quality of the food, not the annoying K-pop music blaring from the speakers (which is forgivable if the food delivers). My judgments are for the kalgooksoo and soondubu and in tandem, the whole restaurant:  So, I ordered kal gooksoo. It wasn't disgusting, but it tasted like NOTHING. Even when I added the gochujang to give it some flavor, the soup was just bland. I felt like the waiter had lied when he said he eats it a lot and finds it tasty.   Look, I am not used to mediocre Korean food. I don't think Korean food can be mediocre. I think it can only be good or bad. And I've only experienced BAD Korean food once in my life, which I've swiftly extricated from my memory to the point that I don't even remember the name of that restaurant.  Something about bad Korean food deeply offends me in a way that other bad food cannot. I can handle cheap macaroni, cheap chips, cheap fries, cheap cookies, etc. Korean food is intricate, so when it's bad, it sinks below AWFUL. Keep in mind that bad Korean food is not like bad pizza, which is still edible. Bad pizza gets away with being bad. Bad Korean food is UNACCEPTABLE and makes me really angry. Maybe it's because I'm Korean and I've been lavished with authentic quality Korean food both at home and in the motherland, but I have zero tolerance for bad Korean food.   Back to the story. I couldn't continue eating the kalgooksoo and asked the nice waiter for a replacement. He told me to opt for the soon dubu, which "everyone likes, including the foreigners." The last critics I want of Korean food would be foreigners or Americans, sorry. I want to know what an actual Korean would think of this dish, I told him. He assured me it's good and sped to make up for the shitty kalgooksoo.  The soondubu was only slightly better than the kalgooksoo because of the spiciness, which distracted my tongue. It was still watered down, and the worst soondubu I've eaten in my life. I'm not exaggerating by saying the worst.  I left this restaurant feeling like I'd been cheated not just out of my money, but out of my hunger, if that makes sense. I was no longer hungry because I'd tried eating as much as I could out of the money I just lost, but I was still deprived of being floored from good food.  I know this is a take out spot, so it's not like I was expecting the best, but based on these two dishes alone, I give this place its deserving sole star. I don't ever want to go through this disrespectful experience again.   Anyone who says this place has "decent" food must not know what good Korean food is. What a shame.

Nq1OAJRt3p7xZv0CNEzKXw.review_text: Oh, Arang...how I love you.  Kalbi, casserole, soon dobu soup, kimchi fried rice...HEAVEN!  The boxes..I could pass on, the bulgoki, pass.  Bi bim bap is pretty good though, the seafood one is awesome!  Spicy chicken (which I call crazy chicken) burns your mouth...but its so good.  I love their never ending alcohol sale, too!  OB and lemon soju :D  The service is sometimes pretty bad though, I don't know what it is.  Maybe they need one more person waiting tables...I swear there are times where I can sit there with my hand up for 5 minutes, MAKE EYE CONTACT, and still nothing.  On several occasions, we've had to go up and pay the bill, then stand there and wait for change so we can leave tip.      This is not the kind of service I expect at a sit down meal.  Bathroom is funky, too.

a5hyrWp6GuGteNxOW7yGsQ.review_text: OH how I've missed you so much Arang Restaurant!  Ok...so sure it's not THE best place for Korean food..but when you're hungry at 1am and you don't want fast food - THIS is the happenin' place.  You've GOT to try this place out!  They have your usual late night korean food from dduk bokki, bi bim bop, paejeon and various soups.  They even have good peach soju if you're looking to have a few drinks.  The place is not very big so you might have to wait for a table, but it's definitely worth waiting.  Very few times have I decided to go to Mel's Diner or one of those other small places around the city, but when I'm closeby Arang, I definitely have to make a stop even if I'm not that hungry.  I just like the cozy feeling of the restaurant and sharing a plate full of dduk bokki with friends~ it reminds me of the good ol' days in college :)

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Very affordable Korean food and a good selection. Ordered the giant spicy casserole full of spam, hot dog, kimchi and ramen. Tons of tasty food for like $23 but the ingredients were probably worth $5. Devoured the whole sodium-loaded meal with another friend as others at surrounding tables ate it among 6 people.  Service is pretty shitty, don't know if they forget or just ignore you. Just wanted my water refilled man.

umwonFnEP0osgYGKrxLJQA.review_text: This is the place to go for good Korean food :) I love to eat here for the Bi bim baps, fish cakes, and of course the appetizers!!! Ironically what I love about Korean food is the appetizers. They give out a tray of regular kim chee, cucumber, fish cakes, etc.  I ate here today and I really loved the service, My friend and I came in waiting for one more person to come in, and the server let us sit there and take our time waiting and ordering. By the time our other friend came in we ordered and didn`t have to wait long. We took our time, ate, and was very satisfied, Today was one of the best days I`ve gone so far.  When I visited here before I remember how inattentive the servers actually were, some took a while to respond (probably depending on who it is, because the one who helped me today came by my table a lot) & sometimes the appetizers came late or not at all.. :|  Also to add on, the restaurant itself is tiny itself.. don`t come in huge groups over 4+ people. They have a bunch of tiny tables that can fit 2 people on one, 3 tables that can fit at least 4-5 people on it, and 3-4 bar seats.. that`s all.

dKkf-1WPYdSEOtYXFBpvUQ.review_text: I'm sorry but Korean food in SF doesn't compare to K-town in LA, but this place is decent.  Mind you I've only been here once so its review isn't as fully informed as possible because I am much more critical with Asian foods.  However, if I lived in SF, I would probably go back to give some other dishes a try.  It is a small hole in the wall again with Korean music playing in the background.  I got the yu-kae-jang (spicy shredded beef soup), and to my happy surprise, it wasn't that bad.  My friend got the kal-bi tang and said it was ok.  They also provided panchan (the little appetizers with dinner) which included a pretty good spicy pickled cucumber and kimchi.

FoZ6QIJGbd-2DZ12f34FtQ.review_text: SF Food Inspection Score: 96  I had a fantastic meal here yesterday when I was on a break from work.   The service was quick even though the server was super busy with big party tables and kids crying in the restaurant.   I love that they serve robatayaki. I love inexpensive food on skewers! But they were out of shrimps....  I definitely want to go there again to have a more tradish Korean meal because I mostly had Japanese influenced dishes (ramen and robatayaki).  I'm ready to try the bi bim bap next time!

bh-6f4fh_TCJXSMcXivWjA.review_text: If you like paying to be rushed through your dining experience, then just come here, right before they close, when the workers are dying to get the heck out of Dodge.  Rudeness takes this place way, way down.  This rudeness was experienced on 9/13/09 at 1:15 AM, just 45 minutes prior to closing.  Both one male & one female server both  rushed us to order and bussed our tables before we were finished eating.  Also, told us to make our own sauce for their seafood pancake.   I'd much rather give business to a place that isn't going to give you attitude..the food is OK and satisfies those late-night cravings for spicy food....Instead, just go to the barbeque place across the street...which is open just as late, has nearly similar menu items and won't rush your late-night dining experience.  I had been a regular customer for the past 8-9 years, but now will stop eating here, just because they're such JERKS!  If you're the owner of ARANG reading this, take note:  people in this economy aren't going to take your crap!

p_Bemp_-8yUA-qG5P_WD5A.review_text: Love this place, open til late, good korean food!

yrE9zxwI81d2cQt3Q2rzQw.review_text: Looking for a lunch place while wandering around SF randomly. Nice selection of lunch options--I got a bulgogi bento box. Didn't taste like what I expected, but marinated beef is hard to mess up (I think?). Some of the side items in the box were lackluster, but the mandu were good and so was the potato side. Pretty solid lunch (very inexpensive).

YmPAm1gD3z_lPmD68cJd3A.review_text: i have a tendency to order bibimbap every time i see it on a menu (even in mall food courts), so i've only ordered bibimbap at Arang, and it is good.  what else is good?  the lemon soju.  knock back a few because it tastes like kool-aid, and then before you know it, you're giggling like an idiot.    the only complaint i have is that the service is a little slow.  the waitresses are super friendly and sweet, but they tend to get a little harried and forgetful.

sPRRyJXUHzlH6uwqAkDsbw.review_text: Great place for take-out orders as they get it done in 10 mins every time, plus decent prices and good lunch specials. I've tried it twice, the food was good. I will definitely come again.

3wsfSfYw3bk1yUP0M66K_Q.review_text: Arang, saranghae!(I love you) lol  My friend had her birthday dinner here on a friday night and I must say it was pretty hard to find. I was told that It is right across from the panda express but there are two faces of panda express. So I went to the wrong side first. Arang is in the corner, if you will, with two korean symbols glowing in neon, but, if you look inside there will be a sign that says Arang on the wall :]  The place was pretty small, but comfortable. Waitresses were very polite and greeted us in Korean(which I love). We got seated and they served us the tea and menus. The tea had some kind of rice in it which I thought was pretty cool. It looked like hamster poo at first tho but..it wasn't, don't worry.   Their menu has a very big variety of choices but, I eventually ordered a BBQ Beef bento box-ish deal which came with BBQ Beef ,two Gyoza(potsticker), Salad, Miso Soup, Shredded Potatoes(very good), a scoop of rice, and Vermicelli noodles. (TIP: You have a choice between getting a box or plate. Box includes all that I listed above but plate gives you more of the meat that you order with rice but excluding all that I listed earlier and plate is more expensive. I thought the box gave me plenty of meat anyway.) The meat was very tender and flavorful, but I really enjoyed the shredded potato salad thing.   Arang is very authentic Korean. It is refreshing to see a Korean restaurant owned by and has Korean. My experience is better that way since I came for Korean food. You should try this place out!!  OH btw when you receive the bill they give you a handful of bangin Melon Gum. It tastes like Hi-Chew but you can't swallow it hahaha

FwxsgU7CSBkvMKM_i3fZKQ.review_text: Been a customer for 10 years.  Parking is usually not a problem. Prices are awesome, especially at lunch time. The service is good, and the business hours are great!

XZAxvvHFOxDVVvtsjHK1BA.review_text: the BESTTTT korean food ive had in SF so far!! their food was delcious and so perfect!  i had their marinated short ribs...i am salvating again as i think about them...they were cooked to perfections and so juicy and not too tender...most places ive been to usually burn this but this was cooked and marinated soo well!  we also had their seafood bi bim bop which was soo delcious! it had plenty of seafood in it and they werent cheap about it either!   and their soju...no other place makes their soju like this at all! we could barely taste the alcohol in it! it was a mixture of yogurt, peach, and soju...tasted like the yummy peach gummy candies that you eat!  i cant wait to go back there again

UYX7ZxP1QjI-eyKQRQ3X9Q.review_text: I come here pretty often and what keeps me coming back is the food to price ratio. It's basic Korean food, nothing too special about it but it still satisfies my Korean food cravings and a decent price. The service is pretty good and the food comes out relatively quick.   For a quick korean food fix, Arang is the place to go!

9WzUerODzyYUkQO0u3Nyjg.review_text: Ordered the kimchi fried rice and spicy pork, shared them with one other person.  The fried rice looked like something I could've made myself, which consisted of spam, kimchi and sweet corn.  Really? Can't even add some seaweed in there?  Spicy pork was thick, which isn't like how I've had them at other places.  It wasn't bad, just wasn't great and what I had expected.  Appetizers were very limited and didn't leave me with any satisfaction and definitely didn't get me my korean cravings fixed.

dIiTs5qYYQNuJd7L-K9ldw.review_text: I think maybe management has changed? Im not sure.  Ive dined here a few times now and it used to be my go-to spot for korean food in SF.  This last time I really didnt care much for the food.  Unfortunately I don't think I will be back.

5-ualvwBydeXqHzUmSDOwg.review_text: Best Kimchi Fried Rice in San Francisco! BBQ plates, Kalbi Tang and Army base stew are good too.  Bibimbap is just soso, Fried chick is too oily for me, but my friend really likes it.

GihiZ2-PS7yi5Q3PmFRR7w.review_text: This place is great for korean bar food.  The person who neg'd the jigae with spam, hot dogs and ramen...that's what that dish is all about.  That is probably my favorite dish there!  For the spam and hot dog lovers out there this dish rocks!  Throw in the ramen and it's an instant comfort classic.  For those who want this to be a cleaner, nicer place like Won Mi, go to won mi or other restaurants up and down Geary.  Stick with the basic korean bar food and you'll be happy.  I had a plate of gizzards with the ramen jigae and it made my weekend.

RUAb4yMazoRbbCNAxlbsFQ.review_text: Dear Arang,  Thank you for always satisfying my craving for Korean bar food.  I especially love the kimchee jigae and the shrimp omelette rice (oh-mu-rice).   Nothing beats good ole ketchup on fried rice.  Your ban-chans are mighty tasty too, though the egg dish looks spoiled, it tastes perfect.  I appreciate the Korean power ballads and occasional Korean pop music that blasts throughout your restaurant.  Somehow I feel the pain of the Korean singer while I slurp my soup.   I promise to visit at least every other month.  I know I don't live in the city anymore, but you are always on my mind anytime I think of "duk buk ki."    Please continue to offer good Korean food for a relatively cheap price.    I miss you dearly.    Best wishes, Your biggest cheerleader

jhPAC7UyPiRFNPlNQYMMXg.review_text: Korean food restaurants are comparable to women in SF. Numbers are limited, and it's hard to find a good one. (No offense SF ladies! And besides.. maybe you're one of the "good" ones!)  The good thing about Arang is that it's open till 2am, and there's parking. The bad thing? Well.. it doesn't compare to Korean restaurants in LA. Not even close.  I've never had soondubu (tofu soup) with cucumbers and onions in it. Wait, it's supposed to have beef and seafood? Well they put maybe one piece of each in there, and the rest were those filler veggies. The complimentary side dishes were not good at all. The other food we got was mediocre, too.   Maybe it's unfair that I'm comparing this place to the restaurants I've had in LA, but I don't understand why the standards of Korean food in the city has to be so low!

MEtJoi8SXhm1sC_C1oP49g.review_text: the teriyaki chicken is HELLA good.

4pzr6KuS85859EICMI7MDw.review_text: I love love love love love love Arang! Good and RELIABLE bento boxes, udon and soups, and cheap little robata grilled skewers, which really hit the spot at when you want a hot, spicy and SUBSTANTIAL midnight snack. I don't know what I would do without this place!  Bento boxes are very well rounded with soup, salad, vermicelli noodles, potato spears, rice and the meat of your choice. Sometimes the waitress will throw in some edamame to snack on beforehand too. One time we got the sweet candy chex mix! Hahaha. I can never entirely finish the box no matter how hungry I am, so I usually end up with leftovers for lunch the next day.  Udon and other entrees besides the bento boxes come will a neat little kimchee/bean curd platter.  MMMM hite beer.  And you all KNOW you LOVE the bumpin' K-POP trance/pop music.

WRQc3h2wFMka9Tgchq_xDQ.review_text: place is not bad, its kinda like a korean fast food restaurant.  i like it, all the times ive been there its been cool, only thing is that when i do takeout orders sometimes, i come when they tell me to and its not ready!

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: Korean comfort food served up in this smallish spot in the Western addition.  I finally discovered a spot in the Bay that makes ddukbokki with chol myun!  Spicy sauteed rice cakes that's usually served alone, but here they add chol myun, a chewy noodle that's perfect for slurping up the tasty sauce. That dish gets 5 stars in my book.    We also tried: chicken gizzards ok, a bit too chewy fried chicken - tasted like chinese fried chicken, not bad spam and sausage casserole wiith ramen noodles and kimchi - guilty pleasure kimchi fried rice - good  seafood pajun - pretty spicy with lots of seafood  yogurt soju - pretty sweet  No panchan here for some reason, and you might be in for a long wait since the space is so small. People tend to linger too, since it's a drinking place.

WB7yrm93ZaTk8RaGro8v6g.review_text: I eat here at least once a week! This is my favorite authentic Korean restaurant in San Francisco.  The prices are very reasonable and the flavor has never disappointed.  I even brought a visitor FROM Korea and they said it matched the flavor and taste quality of Korea.  The location is a bit hidden in the Safeway plaza, but its great for a casual cheap meal.

ksonr4xKjpmznXtf_rB2jg.review_text: Decent Korean food for a decent price w/ a side order of PARKING. You can't beat that for the area.

d67zTET_2IuVoWcUU0aWaQ.review_text: We arrived around 630pm and had to wait 15 minutes for a table.  They had open tables but we were told they were reserved. I never knew this place took reservations?!   When we were finally seated, we were given only 5 minutes to review the menu before she came back to us to ask if we were ready. She seemed to be in a bad mood and we didnt want to piss her off so we hurried and gave our order.  We ordered the spicy pork. Good flavor but lots of fat instead of meat. We also ordered the vermicelli.  Delicious! Our last dish was the seafood bi bim bap. I thought it tasted only ok.  We were dying of thirst because we werent served anything to drink prior to the arrival of our dishes.  We had to ask for tea and water.  For the price we paid, I would have expected a lot better.

WKeL12VDZg-dXv6NiMoVaA.review_text: Recently had a Korean BBQ smorgasbord (um, can you do that?) at Arang.  I love the way Korean BBQ makes meat taste like CANDY, I love the cool variety of sides, and really, I love anything that tastes good like that with white rice.    The soju was just icing on the cake.  I spent most of the lunch chewing and moaning, I think.

R_e4n68MZnpa9APN55lh0A.review_text: Not the best Korean restaurant I've been at, however, in terms of convenience in terms of variety of menu and price, this place is a good place to go just to get a simple meal without having to plan or think ahead.  It stays open pretty late, and is definitely better than Won Mi which is located across the street on Fillmore.  The downside is the fact that since the restaurant is so small, there are times when you have to wait upwards up to 30 minutes.    Good thing that they allow you to do take out.

BwWsnWxkXgXlXPGTAEduEg.review_text: During lunchtime, their bi bim bap is off the chain!11  I have yet to find a better one in the city for the same price.    One my fav watering holes in SF.  The staff are nice, parking can be found in the Safeway lot.  You kind of just keep ordering food, and alcohol, and food, and alcohol, and more alcohol.  Laf.

MwblCqcpAbWr00OsWPfbug.review_text: I've eaten here a couple of times and I think the food is alrite. I haven't eaten much Korean food so I cannot vouch for its authencity, but it's not bad. Service is pretty quick but the restaurant is kinda small, 3 booths on one half and a few tables on the other. This place is always bumping Kpop too, but I don't mind that. Maybe I'll go try Won Mi like the other reviewers suggested... It opens at 12 pm (or 11 am?) and closes at 2 am most days

S5lUSdYWEK7U6c2F5lQTwg.review_text: I haven't eaten here recently, but I always come here with two of my good friends and order the same stuff every time. Usually we come a bit early to beat the crowd, otherwise we end up sitting around and waiting for a good 15-20 minutes and then I end up a starving child -sad face-. When they get busy, they tend to ignore you even when you're trying your hardest to get their attention. So minus one star. But they are a really great place to have late night Korean food. Here's what we typically order: Man Du Gook - korean dumpling soup with vegetables and beef.  Fried Gyoza - fried potstickers (Mark's favorite dish always lol.) Ramen - spicy korean ramen with vegetables and seafood  And sometimes we randomly order things that catch our eyes.. try not to stay with the same stuff every time lol. I have the say that I LOVE Man Du Gook a lot, I have to order this every time I go, its a comfort food for me. Try it out -smile-

2v6MNYvkUi-vdRn0G0xArg.review_text: There's usually cute Korean chicks eating here...  and cute Chinese chicks...  I like asian chicks.   Oh... and tonight we ordered the spicy wings... but we got the spicy sauce on the side.   That's gonna be my new shit. Watch...  You heard it  here first!  Deep fried loveliness, then a bowl of  "dunk it like you want it" red, sweet, spicy, savory, sweaty-forehead sauciness all over your everything. It's better this way.  Why?  Hmmm... more interactive I suppose?  More fun?  Especially when you double-dip bone-showing, bit-into, gastric goodness with a few of your favorite Hite and Soju infused brothers and sisters!   Gun Bae~!

ou_nE1efTxY0LoVW0Au-yQ.review_text: Oh how I miss the old Arang =(  Yea they like changed ownership, dont remember when but I know they did. One day I returned after not eating here for like a couple of months...and UGH I was disgusted.  I always order the usual, a pick of a bento + a pick of either the seafood or beef bibimbap + soju ofcourse!  Ordered me a Spicy Pork Bento + Seafood Bi Bim Bap + Peach Soju.  How can you go wrong?  Ugh yea... it can go wrong when:  Booboo #1. The spicy pork was freaking BACON cooked in a watery spicy sauce! I normally LOVE bacon, but this was not no crispy bacon, so trust me I know my cut of pork!  Each piece of pork I picked up was HALF FAT.  Booboo #2. Yea I know I ordered the Seafood BiBimBap..but wussup with the FISHY stank smell?!?   I put EXTRA of that spicy sauce to try to "fix" this, and yet NOTHING could have saved that.    Booboo #3. Me and Soju has always had a love hate relationship, its always love love love you, until the next morning when I find myself passed out in front of my door, missing one shoe, and with a pounding headache. The problem here is that....my freaking Peach SOJU had practically NO SOJU in it! It tasted good (overly sweet), but now I know its cus they didnt add enough Soju!  Booboo #4. I walked out unsatisfied, and SOBER! Had so much leftovers, but didn't want to take it to go, cus it was just plain BOOBOO. And we knew we was just going to throw it away.    Old Arang, you will always have a place in my heart! But the current Arang needs step it up!

jNsPTMmg9EcqY7q2Q-Rm6A.review_text: 3.5 stars. Although this isn't the best Korean food, this place is reliable, convenient, and consistent. Boyfriend and I come here a lot to get our Korean fix. He (who is Korean) is always trying to have me try different dishes, which I have tried a lot, but I still always turn to my soon dobu.  Soon Dobu is good here, but some of the other items I've tried are just okay. I do like their ban chan here - only a few selections but they're always tasty and I like how they present it on one plate with separate compartments. Easier to move around/refill and less clutter.   Just like another Yelper mentioned, the tea here is yummy! One of my favorite teas at a Korean restaurant.  Service is okay here - usually sort of aloof and they don't talk to you much. But overall, this is one of the spots I do like getting my fix. Open late and easy to park!

e_h4BWb73vJS6j2Ontdi9w.review_text: New owner!  But the food tastes still the same !  Big soup is always been MUST to get if there are big group of people wanting some soup. Kalbi box for lunch time totally worth it! You have to get it ! Only down part is that there is NO side dishes for boxes :( But it is already cheap .. so no complains ..

07p1XwEmcGrV42Fn0k0mGQ.review_text: My friend and I are die hard Arang fanatics.   We have been loyal customers since we were 19 and we used to go EVERY DAMN WEEK after our Bio class.  Once we arrive, it's like HEAVEN =)  This isn't like most Korean BBQ restaurants, in  my opinion, it's more of a fast food version of it.    Things to try: Any of their lunch/dinner boxes - the vermicelli and potatoes rock! Gyoza - great everywhere (eat it with their hot sauce) Spicy Tofu Soup Fried Chicken Seafood Bi Bim Bap Soju! Pickles - which they seem to have discontinued =*(  There's always parking, it's open late, you can eat and drink AND it's fairly cheap for Korean food.  WHY THE F NOT?!

ED5JNdkd_5RK9tGZlykIcw.review_text: Whenever I come to Arang, I get happy! why you ask? Because I know I am going to leave full and drunk, and for half the price I would spend at a typical bar.  Couple bottles of soju and hite and some om rice or tofu or bibimbap or meat or friend chicken...PLUS! the anniversary month, all the alcohol is 50% off! man...this place is awsome...

3K6EJDoVp9hVxUzUePszsA.review_text: So I don't know if I was STARVING when I came in here to eat, or if the food was really good.. EITHER WAY THOUGH... It was yummy. lol  I ordered the Kimchi Bibimbap. It was very yummy and it was definitely spicy. I've had kimchi at other Korean restaurants and sometimes the kimchi ain't spicy.. It's like, "What? o_O" Why are you not spicy? Why are you so sour? Why are you salty?" Anyway. Haha  It came pretty quickly after ordering. It was nicely portioned with the right amount of rice, veggies and all that goodness. The only weird thing about it is that they put the sauce/flavoring on it, for me.. Instead of having me do it myself..?  The rest of my party ordered their.. K-Japanese style bento boxes (which looked pretty tasty) and another ordered the Seafood BiBimBap. That too, already had the sauce on it. o__o" But it was tasty, nonetheless, they didn't skimp on the seafood. It was a bit more watery than my kimchi still pretty spicy and all that good stuff.  Not too many side dishes at this place but it's still good.  Good music to go with the meal. (; *hehehe*

gcFwdhZfdhIacWQYbaLcBg.review_text: Came here for a friends birthday dinner. I think I consumed more meat in an hour and a half then I have in the last six month but it was definitely worth it. The place is tiny and minimally decorated but the food is good and cheap. I loved the kimchee soup and, binimbap, and the BBQ beef.  You don't cook at the table so you can definitely go out after the meal which is a nice plus.  The service is  adequate at best and they have a very small liquor selection which detracts from the meal as a whole. I would definitely come again when I have a craving for Korean BBQ.

Sp-S4y8rx1xIX3d5VOK0bQ.review_text: Arang makes me so hot.  No, really!  Every time I eat here, I feel like someone has opened the sweat faucets.  The food is so delicious, HOT, SPICY, and delivered to your table in MASSIVE QUANTITIES!!   The last time I went, I tried the dessert - OMFG!!  It was sex in a bowl.  Shaved ice with sweet bean and ice cream - topped with fruit and some cinnamon toast crunch cereal.  Jeeeez, why does it have to be so good.  I usually anticipate a wait to sit down and somewhat slow service, but the food is so good it's worth it.  While you're waiting you can enjoy gazing upon the Christmas decorations that are still up (it's September people!!) and enjoy the music selection (you'll know what I mean when you go).  Anyhoo...if you go and see a round eye girl sweating profusely in the corner - that's me!  So, make sure you say hi and have a shot of soju with me!!

KNNJk9AZaQ3QbVhQBTehhQ.review_text: I decided to try this place because we were driving back to SF from Lake Tahoe and got back into the city before 11pm and it was still open. Otherwise the only other option would have been Won Mi which would have been more than fine. Wow... in hindsight that was big mistake to eat here.   First of all, when we stepped into the restaurant we were told to wait 15 minutes, even though there were at least 10 open tables and the whole restaurant holds maybe 20 tables in total. Then I realized it must because they were understaffed, so we sort of shifted our way towards a booth and sat down in one that still hadn't been cleaned yet, and watched some basketball being played on the big screen TV. At this point, while sitting around in a dirty booth we also became aware that everyone who was sitting down around us was drinking and playing drinking games at their table, with food being ordered as well, but not as the focus. We also started feeling very cold, perhaps it was the hunger and the long drive, but then the high ceilings, corner location facing wind, and lack of heat in the restaurant were very apparent. By the time I walked back to my car to get everyone's ski jacket the table had finally been cleaned and we ordered a few dishes with no alcohol.   They did not even have the normal BBQ chicken that I usually order but some Asian fusion orange chicken hybrid, Kalbi, and seafood pancake so we ordered that. The food finally came out some time later, and everything was totally forgettable... the chicken tasted a bit strange, sort of like a grilled version of something I would expect to find at Panda Express. The Kalbi was cut LA style which always reminds me of a lunchtime rice plate rather than a dinner style cut, and the seafood pancake was overfried and dripping with excess oil.   We ate our meal in silence with regret that we had rushed back only to have NOT eaten at Won Mi across the street. Well, let's just say I won't ever be making that mistake again when faced with these 2 choices. In my mind Arang is more like a bar you can come to enjoy some big screen TV action and drinking games with your friends, just don't come for the food.

VYubcoqXFzYI5ai1oHdTtg.review_text: Food was ok, probably authentic Korean.  Place is dirty, there was something in my water, and a few flies. Won't be going back at all.

7sEm_zpKcQb_2GRDXQgecQ.review_text: This place is pretty good. The customer service is really good. My friends were like request so much things. Such as "More Water, Forks, Teriyaki Sauce, separate bills, etc." But the waitress was very polite and nice. I also liked the lunch special. Taste great. It's just that i found it pricey for the lunch menu, $8.95 for a combination lunch thing. I can find  a place with cheaper with bigger portions.

NDtZr70SQY4SgEIC9V5OJw.review_text: Showed up with my wife looking for good Korean food.  We walk in, all Koreans eating there.  Great sign.    This place is great.  Food was wonderful (we had a soup an bi bim bop), staff friendly.  A definite return.

tClCuqYjoPk_Q9U_u2owoA.review_text: The good thing about this place is the price.  It's hard to find cheap Korean food in the city without a price tag, especially for dinner.  However, I was underwhelmed by the quality of food.  I got the BBQ beef box (8.95), and the beef had a bunch of fat on the edges.  My friends were also not huge fans of their dishes (the bi bim bop and the kimchee fried rice).  Also, the service sucked.  We were there for late night (around 9:30), and there was only one waitress for the restaurant (which was small, but surprisingly busy for that time of night).

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Pretty good Korean.  I had the kimchee chigae without the meat.  It was hot, spicy, and delicious (my mouth is watering just thinking about it).  I didn't really dig on the panchan, but it was cute served on a dish that reminded me of a school lunch cafeteria tray.  I tried my friend's seafood pancake which was really really good.  Good beer.  I tried the raspberry Korean wine, which was sticky sweet, but still good.  The servers were nice.

D-rKFBb1s4_4vpDA9Wjiog.review_text: Good place, open really late. Big menu.

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: I used to really hate this place....but then I discovered a ramen with spam, hot dogs and kimchee in a spicy broth.....delish.  On a cold day it really hits the spot.  The short rib soup is also very yummy for the non spicy lovers.  If you can fit in the kimchee fried rice go for it.

HGHW9ZUHaU1heRuC6W6QMQ.review_text: No matter how hard I've tried, I haven't learned to enjoy Korean food.  I think getting food poisoning in Korea was the beginning of the end of our relationship.  Therefore, like the meat I ate, my perspective is probably tainted.  The staff is friendly.  Prices are great, open late!  Food - not so much.  The beef was borderline rancid.  Korean beers give me a headache.

MdlhyRHSgv6ub0zW1vEZeA.review_text: While exploring Fillmore St in San Francisco, nearby the Fillmore Center., I came across this small restaurant. The atmosphere is nothing to rave about. I tried their Bi Bim Bop and it came in a smoldering hot pot.  Just the way I like Korean food. And it hit the spot.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Ummm..what happened?? This was one of my favorite Korean places in SF until this past weekend. I ordered my usual beef bi bom bop, I looked at it and thought, um did they forget to give me rice, it looks so little compared to before. The bowl is usually filled to the top, this was barely half full. Then I ate it and it lacked in flavor, the bottom wasn't even crispy from the stone pot. We got a tofu, clam, kimchee soup which I was really looking for to. PROBLEMS when it's watered down to the point of we needed to add salt to it! That is just unheard of, adding salt to Korean food that's usually super flavorful, BIG Problem!..Sigh..I wonder if they changed owners or cook. No bueno.

NRr35Ok90wp5oRxCL4vE4w.review_text: I'm not a really picky eater and I'm a huge fan of Korean food. Their pricing is reasonable for the quality of the food. Don't know if this happens to everyone else, but I always seem to have a hard time calling the server over. It's a good place to stop by for a quick meal. Love their bibimbap and their tofu soups.  The sides are mehhhh.  Overall, it's a decent place.

UR9de_TvJC47KXZHIgMXLQ.review_text: I haven't been to arang since... forevers.  I still remember vividly, the flavor soju that got me drrunnk off my @ss.  I was drinking with some Berkeley students, and I didn't even know them.  Ahhh those were the days. Well, the boy and I were in J-Town, and I didn't really feel like having Japanese there, so the bf suggested Arang. I was hungry.  So we ordered short ribs, kimchi stew with pork, and bibim naeng myun with a bottle of soju and a small bottle of peach soju. Service was friendly.  Soju came first of course, and they gave us some free edamame to go with.  Peach soju was delicious but deadly.  I guess food taste EXTRA delish when you're a little.. buzz?   Short ribs were unexpectedly delicious.  Tasted like the one you get from Korean bbq.  But dude, this place is clearly not Korean bbq.  It was GREAT and plentiful.  The Kimchi stew was really good.  They put some secret ingredient in it!  It was surprisingly good.  I mean, Kimchi stew SHOULD pretty much taste the same everywhere, but no... not here.  Bibim naeng myun was good, but not Sam Won yelp.com/search?find_des… good.  But it was good. With this amount of food and the intoxication level we were at, it would cost us lots elsewhere.  But Arang made it affordable.  We were happily buzz and full.  I passed out on the ride back.  Happy ending.

LUj0l-kLPO9OUdg1bahiww.review_text: I like this place. The soju is great. It is very tasty and I couldn't detect the alcohol but I still got the after effects, if you know what i mean. ;) Anyway we came on a Monday at around 12 am and stayed till 2am. They came to refill our tea and gave us a little sampler dish that had kimchee, etc. I would come back here again!

1ZTNu00nDlxrGz73ROt7Lw.review_text: Went here during the weekend with my husband and his friend. My husband's friend said that it was his favorite korean spot in the city. It was just okay. Food is a little on the pricey side and you don't get much for what you pay. We won't be going back with him the next time he goes...

vVzTZD2vhLWT4xnkyO7RKw.review_text: I would not come here for authentic Korean food.  HOWEVER, this is the one and ONLY place I go to for the oh so delicious rahbokki dish (spicy ricecakes with ramen) and the boodaejjigae.  We also usually get soondae and dip it in the rahbokki sauce.  Basically this is a good place to come for boonshik (informal Korean foods).

Y_sR6lCr7fYQIFwNIwP9gg.review_text: After living in Korea for 2.5 years, this is, in my opinion, the only good Korean restaurant in SF. The food is pretty good and totally legit Korean. I only gave it four stars because I'm still on a search for a Korean place that makes me go, "Oh my god, this is sooo good!"

3yeBxgUCl6sXtn2GTX1UNw.review_text: Arang is great option for quick and cheap Korean food.  Michael Bauer confirms this on his list of cheap eats on sfgate.  They have bento boxes, kalbi, bulgolgi, and more importantly, alcohol that always claims it is on sale for a limited time only.

jisQEtwfrOKBmssWoiXljg.review_text: I love coming here when I'm feening for Korean food and don't have alot of money to spend. They have individual meat combo plates (kinda like Japanese bento boxes) with vegetables and appetizers. All that for like $12 (instead of the hefty $40 you pay at other Korean restaurants for a plate of like bulgogi). I absolutely LOVE the Kim chi fried rice here.   Small restaurant, so if you come on a fri or sat night, expect to wait.

2H6gAvXrIwMTsXhixfKMrw.review_text: I see few people comparing Arang to Toyose.  They are two completely different places.  Toyose is a place to get completely wasted.  Anyways, the food isn't too bad, plus the half off on alcohol is always good.  The only thing that just bothers me is sometimes the dishwasher doesn't do a very good job of washing the cups and bowls.  My tea still tastes like soap.  One funny story I do have though.  Came here with few friends one night and I saw baekuln saram call this place A-rang, like my phone rang.  heheh

gsGfJwZarPg3usmPiT_clg.review_text: The food is spicy that it'll make your nose drip like a waterfall.   Arang is one of the better Korean places in San Francisco. Coming from the land of Koreans (Southern California), my palette has been spoiled and expectations are high.   Dinner was chol myhon, bulgogi, dukboggi (sp?), and a fish egg chiggae. I was pleasantly surprised by the dukboggi, it was pretty tasty and had some fire in it. The bulgogi was average, quantity was meager for the price we paid. The fish egg stew was spicyyyyy.... The highlight of the night was the chol myhon. Very good and chewy. Just enough kick that didn't overpower the rest of the dish.

FE8IFGvVHoScgy0s5gbUhQ.review_text: late night korean food.. after the party..

WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA.review_text: Arang doesn't need to be crazy good or crazy bad to stay in my mind - it's always there, like these 3 stars are always there. I consider this place an all-arounder, a standby.  I like Arang for the sujebi, bibim naengmyeon, and other dishes I can't necessarily get everywhere. I probably would like them for the haejangguk, but I noticed theirs doesn't have blood. Y'all, I neeeed blooooodd.  They have chicken gizzards(!). Now they just need livers, hearts, and whatever that giblet was that I used to pluck from the KFC thighs back in the day.  There are a couple of menu items with spam, for my spam friends and mahalo friends.  There can be a 20-30 minute wait if it's crowded, but they let you browse the menu while standing in line.  When you read the menu, text me if they've added other chicken organs.

rrYkyfKDnnhmXT6arNDNmw.review_text: ate here for the 2nd time yesterday.  i always forget to ask to tone down the spiciness, so both times now i've had a very difficult time eating their food!  but it is pretty good, and i would imagine it would be awesome if my tastebuds weren't burnt off.  i've had their hot tofu pot and their spicy chewy noodles with rice cake now.  they also have shaved ice which is pretty interesting!  it has cinnamon toast crunch in it.  anyway, they give you tea with these little bits of rice in it which is good.  our waiter was helpful (though a little confused).  the setting just reminds me of a korean place... haha!

3roJp-RoqKVoMgdtuJFM9Q.review_text: my bf is HOOOKED on the bi bim neng myon here. We've been here almost every week and he always gets that.  the dubokki is yummy and spicy and sweet and really soft and chewy. we also tried their stone pot bulgogi which totally reminds me of when i was in korea.   also tried the kimchee fried rice which was good. i think we'll eventually try everything on the menu. great for 4 or less people cuz its such a small place.  we'll be back on monday!

kHSbWGX8kyrD1YXEvgmAKA.review_text: Four of us had dinner here and we ordered 3 dishes.  So much food, we couldn't finish it all.  There was this casserole dish that was just nuts.  The soup was so red and there were mushrooms, meat, and rice cakes in it, PLUS we added ramen.  Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomaches that night.  Food was ok and I wouldn't mind eating here again.    I really like that we didn't have to drive around the streets of SF for 15+ minutes to find parking, you can just park in the same lot Safeway is in!

x6Ovhm9vHlFI_WYXttaBww.review_text: Rude staff.  I expect the service at Korean restaurants to be minimal, but the owners/waiters here are sub-par even on those standards.  I had been here once before, because it's open late and it's somewhat affordable.  This last time, we waited for a table for twenty minutes, even as we saw numerous empty tables.  On top of that, the lady seats people before us.  One guy that was seated didn't even have the rest of his party with him, but she took him and his bad haircut to the open booth we were waiting for.  Done with this place.  I know the economy is bad so you have two people working fifteen tables, but you just lost business.  Like most Korean places in Japantown, this place is edible but not repeatable.

AgvjzJ7iNd3XysmRxe3u3Q.review_text: I haven't been here in years, but I have some great memories of this place.... If I can only remember them...  This was when I was young, the liver was plump, and "evil sam' was at the height of his powers.  The food is good; you can do worse.  Bi Bim Bop rocks.  The Short Ribs are good.  And I love the complimentary chicken katsu and potstickers.  I wonder why we get the free food... must of been the tab we ran up from all the soju and chamisul.

7GRrunAKfMQloZ6DMjPaBQ.review_text: Omelet Rice all the way  Their food is pretty good, but be careful. The karaoke place next door was robbed last time I went.  Watch your wallets and be ready to run!

TT8sKcoUdI0qyYFocu86iQ.review_text: Was craving for Korean food when I was in the area. Came to Arang and got their short rib box. The ribs were pretty good with a lot of flavoring. The box also came with clear noodles, gyoza, salad, and rice. Arang is not a bad place to eat and is easy on the wallet. Service was okay for the day I came. Would return when I am in the area.

df5nsG6OtMC5EvRXcNq8lQ.review_text: Arang is a good Korean restaurant for those people who like to eat Korean food without the pricey tag to go with it. The place offer orders more on a single person dinner then large parties like many other Korean restaurant.   You can get a Bento box "Arang combination sub for BBQ short ribs" and have almost everything you would want for dinner. At a typically, Korean restaurant you would have to order 1 dish which could be up to 20 bucks which comes with bunch of smaller side dishes.  At Arange you get a bento box and have a more personalized dinner for smaller parties with out the hefty prices.  The place is small and open late at night thats always a plus after a long night out dancing.  The only negative thing would be service. I always feel that they give better service to Koreans then all other guest. It like they are a bit for favorable to their own nationality.  For instance when order anything they should bring out the side dishes for you regardless if you asked or not. However, they only bring it for Koreans without asking.  Make sure you ask for the side dishes. That just part of the Korean food experience.

-5N0P0uN5sjigXB8hTtgkg.review_text: The food is pretty good, once it shows up, if they got the order right, and of course if they bothered taking your order in the first place. Woe unto you if you expected any small yummy kim chi plates before the main course.

r810SS5lW3gqpdvvF5S_xw.review_text: This place serves up cheap, delicious korean food!  I came here for lunch w/ a few coworkers and really enjoyed my meal!  I only wish it was within walking distance of the office.  For $8.00, including tax and tip, I had the soft tofu soup with pieces of beef and clam.  The food came out pretty quickly and we were served 5-6 different types of banchan (which they happily refilled for us).  It would have been nice if the tofu soup was just a bit more spicy.  Still, I'm not complaining because it was yummy and hit the spot for me!   I can't wait to come back to try their other lunch items.  All the other food that my coworkers ordered looked delicious!

UB1h-ouJ7EpyluB1A8jrQg.review_text: If I could marry this place...I WOULD...trust me! I love it here. The first I came here was on a first date a couple of years ago. Date gone bad...but meal gonna reaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaally RAD!  Since then, I've compared EVERY Korean place to this place and NOT one has been up to par! And there are A LOT of good Korean places in the this Asian Infused City. I even had my 26th birthday party here and I was sooo happy and satisfied I didn't care if we went out afterwards. Get the Bi Bim Bap, Galbi, Spicy Pork and Spicy Tofu Soup...DONE AND DONE!  This place will change your life!

1UOTsXkq54pGB5jnFreTdQ.review_text: Came for: nearby K-food to grub on in the neighborhood Will come back for: satiating K-food craving, esp. bibimbap and bulgogi casserole (broiled lean cut beef in stone pot); either  take-out or casual sit-n-eat  My first visit was with a ~6 ppl group where we ordered everything from bibimbap to peach soju carafes as well as some bottles of Hite.  Since then I have gone back for more visits and have also tried their soups.  Ever since I've had some bad K-food experiences, I think it's the soups that really speak to the true quality of a Korean restaurant.  So now, here goes: - bibimbap -- they have 2-3 diff kinds all served in the stone pot (dol-sot), including one with calamari; very good - bulgogi casserole -- a personal favorite and more please not many offer it, with broiled marinated thin strips of beef served over vermicelli noodles in stone pot (dol-sot, as mentioned above); seems healthy too; very good  - pah jun -- the "pancake" thing; came out rather thick and hence mushy; meh, just ok - soon doobu -- soft tofu in spicy soup; nothing spectacular, but good - galbi tang -- miso-type based soup with beef pieces; the soup base tasted au natural but not quite hearty/thick; just ok - yuk gae jang -- spicy soup with bean sprouts and beef; the soup didn't seem to be artificial seasoned but lacked any "umph"; a-ok - banchan -- the "little dishes" are served in a sectioned off plate that reminded me of school meals; I've seen better, but they make up for it in service and generous refills  Overall, carries repeat value; more than anything for its consistency.  Glad it's nearby.  With it's late hours, it's also a better option as a late night eat.

9xrmRfAlb7XRQtKO8qQH4Q.review_text: when you're bored and hungry and just want to hang out with some friends to drink, laugh and eat. .. this is a good place.  they have really good soju.  their combo box is a good size and it comes with vermicelli, salad, gyoza, and potato.  it's simple korean food but definitely fills the tummy.  the servers are cool, lot's of parking, , opened late, and good music.

Q5qMfURihZoZJb5pcejcbw.review_text: haha. be warned, on the w/e, into the wee hours of the AM, it's a place where young asian thugs and their hooched out gf's hang out!  haha. that doesn't take away from the fact that the food is decent and a good place for late night eats. had the chicken wings- garlicky, spicy, sticky. oh so good! in the summer they have shaved ice with red bean... mmmm..
