sFZjAfSAJ2hZ1CHLsJscxA.review_text: I thought it was funny how their banchan came out on one plate.  Overall, not a bad place.  It fixed my craving because i was starving on new years day and after going to 3 places this was the only one that was open.  Their Kalbi dinner meal was a good deal and there wasn't really much to complain about, other than one fly that was flying around the restaurant.

6oKH_D7_RLPnrhRvxFd9wQ.review_text: Came here for one reason only. kimchi bokkeumbap. it was delicious! They even have patbingsu here! I've only tried that in korea never in the US. It was pretty good. nothing like the ones in Seoul though. Still worth a try to see what's it like.

zpT7HWE3o77YVfG4S07H9A.review_text: I've first heard about this place from Linda W. She said it was cheap and good. I've walked and drove by the place many times before but have never stepped inside until a friend of mine and I decided to catch a late dinner. We weren't looking for anything fantastic, just a place that is still open on a thursday night at 11:30pm. He suggested Arang.   "ooooh" I told myself. Linda was just telling me about this place.  It was meant to be....for me to try this Korean joint.   It reminded me of Toyose because they open late and they serve the exact same food...almost- oh and they have bento boxes in their menu.  Their side dishes aren't as great as other korean restaurants, service sucks, bento box =), miso soup (yuck), and the bibimbob was ehhhh.   It was cheap and I will most likely go back again...one day.  As one of my friends would say it "Try it twice, just to make sure you don't like it."

HWpSEzoCEyA9Z_gXD-LFtA.review_text: I came here recently for lunch and now I'm wishing I worked closer so I can add this place to my lunch-time rotation! Good and cheap Korean food; I'll be back :D.

H-gcQo3NjAdQuyOWiq7gmQ.review_text: it's certainly not the best korean restaurant in town but for some reason, i love this place. i used to live right across the street and LOVED that it stayed open till late and it's great for take out. good place to drink soju/beer with decent korean food and it's reasonably priced. it's a tiny little place so you may not get seated, especially during weekends and at nights. so... not a place to necessary take your dates on, but a great place to hang out with friends for some casual and basic korean food.

HVyMJUAV9vERp1hmS-ZX8A.review_text: I had the BBQ pork plate and I finished the whole thing by myself! I thought it was really delicious. The kimchee was really refreshing. I will probably go here again if i'm ever in the neighborhood!

EsoGUze9fiRVrEWR31pKMw.review_text: I love their food here.  It's so flavorful and spicy and hot.  I believe they close late on fridays and saturdays.  Maybe like at 1am or 2am.  Becareful parking in the lot bc last time my friend got her vehicle towed.  To retrieve her ride, she had to fork out over $400.  For some reason that night the idiot security guard inside safeway was keeping tab on ppl parking in that lot.  Literally we saw tow trucks coming in and out towing ppl's car.  The messed up thing was Arang had a notice written in Korean telling their customers not to park in the lot.  Ummm... Hello, non Korean readers need translation.  Would be helpful to have made that in all different languages or maybe just in English.

VH4cDkp7wVYkAGnj0qrAGA.review_text: i'm a regular here and all i have to say is BI BIM BAP! they open late and not always crowded. their bentos unfortunateley suck! gyoza is pretty good! also, Do NOT get their TOFU SOUP! (go to tofu house for that). waiter is slow but very nice. (used to hook me up with BI BIM BAP until a bad experience with a friend. now i'm a full paying customer.  in a nutshell:  FOOD: pretty decent, but go for bi bim bap PRICE: average, but lunch is CHEAPP! PEOPLE: who doesn't love young drunk people straight outtof a karaoke bar?

BfwkErYYxxI0WM2ZISl_Qg.review_text: Had the soft tofu soup ($11) and the potstickers ($6.50 for like ten). It's not the greatest korean food I've ever had (e.g., it doesn't compare to Seoul or Los Angeles spots) but the quality is good and the price is decent. It's a tiny place and I came in the late afternoon but most tables were full. With one waiter for the entire room, be prepared to wait for a little bit before he can get to you

mqul5PvFQzuWuXSypgmvdw.review_text: Poor customer service. I went in with a group of 4, the waitress told me that she is cleaning up the table and that it would be a 5 minute wait. We wait about 5 and a group of korean girls walk also with the same number of guests and they seat them before me. How rude! Needless to say, I was gone after that.

OiD_b20yI2aASoXjzrOLwg.review_text: If you don't look carefully for this place, you're sure to miss it.  It shop front is literally the size of 2 doorways.  Arang is found inside the Safeway plaza on Webster/Geary a few doors down from the Subway Sandwich shop.  I've only been there once so far and I got bi bim ba for takeout.  Based only on that I'd give it 4 stars.  The beef was prepared well, not too fatty.  There was a decent mix of vegetables and it's served with a bowl of miso soup.  All in all, I would go back to try other items.

2OUtitBrWlpzMip1EYaIrg.review_text: I never really liked this place b4 because i didnt know what to order except for the tourist stuff. But now to my new found knowledge I would recomend this.  1.The spam sausage in stew good to eat with 2 or more  2. the spicy pork bone soup good to eat with 2 or more peeps  3. Used to get the beef bi bim bap but now i moved on to the kim chee bi bim bap.  4.I recommend the dessert they only have one there.  There kalbi is good and really reasonably priced.  Didnt really like the chicken gizzard skewers, and there seafood stuff.  Oh yea and MOST MOST MOST importantly if you want a good buzz, Do Not drink the regular soju or fruity ones.  You have to get the chum chu rum Hyori edition. (Dang she fine)  It taste like goose and goes down easier and doesnt make u tired....  Service is good and quick.

Wmx35wh-_dt8cjjDmDsGtA.review_text: Awesome dol-sot bi-bim-bap. You kind of have to know what to order, but it's my go-to Korean place.

rW-iz5OKzzp2WOHh-CC9uQ.review_text: it won't be the best korean food you'll ever have...   however.. and you really can't go wrong if you just wanna chill.. with cheap beer.. decent flavored soju.. decent korean food.. good friends..

M271Ac7UKVaQ9U5AOvc_9A.review_text: After a few weekends and weeks of traveling around, I decided that I needed some good ol' Korean food.  My coworker recommended Arang, so I headed over for lunch and was immediately overwhelmed by all the delicious choices.  Ever ask a waitress or waiter for their opinion and they really aren't helpful at all?  Yeah.  "So, between the bibimbap, kimchee fried rice and yookgaejang, which one do you recommend?" "Ummmm... do you like seafood?" "No, I'm allergic to a lot of seafood." "Oh.  Well.  The seafood soon tofu is good." "Thanks, but no, I'd rather have something else." "Well, everything is actually good." "Can you please just pick one that you would get?" *Points to bibimbap*  Boom done.  And it was really good - thank you, waitress.  I don't know if the regular eat-in portion is bigger than my to-go one, but it was definitely enough food for me.  I wish I had time to dine there, because it's one of those hot stone ones, and by the time I finished my food, it was already cold.  Sigh.  My coworker swears by this place, and I just might too.  Definitely a good lunch pick, as it's 20 feet away from my other office.  What a trek.

jy_RGAeAvNeCv5BxZsUWFA.review_text: This should really be 3 1/2 stars but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt. I sat at the counter and asked the cook to give me the best thing they had. I got a delicious rice and beef thing in a big searing hot stone looking pot. If the place was a little cleaner it would have earned the full four stars from me.

tBP0kte4pNI4nwRsiY-Suw.review_text: Arang is bomb...  I can't stop eating there, but should.  Soju, bogogi, taeji bogogi, kalbi, etc. make good things happen.  Yum yum.

qBlXSXRT1ioH4IGTYXfmJg.review_text: Great little place in the Fillmore with good tasting lunch specials.My own  personal favorite is the teriyaki chicken lunch special.Good amount of food too.Try the Gyoza! I always have to order extra for the family!

M_f3HPuQQzgFso9zcW5k0Q.review_text: I ordered a wonton soup. It was very nice. I really like the beef int the soup. It's tender but not tasteless.

dO3AuXy1yIl-2ndWAGuahw.review_text: This used to be our Korean spot when we first moved to the city. Good portions and prices, and always easy enough to get a table. After a brief spell out in the Richmond where we found the Korean choices surprisingly sparse or on the pricey side, we are happy to be back in the neighborhood and are excited to stop back into this hidden little spot.

_0r-2JvUk279ugyz-Dj7Hw.review_text: tasty food, friendly wait staff. it's a total hole-in-the-wall but that makes it fun. wish they brought me more kimchee tho =) the lunch menu is cheaper but i haven't checked it out yet.

mdwVI2c9eAkMJspI6nyeFw.review_text: Came here for a group lunch and was pretty satisfied.  The waitress was nice and the food came pretty fast. This place had music, mirrors, and pretty lantern lights. Its also a very small place. The restaurant is literally just a door next to a karaoke place.  I ordered the soon tofu soup and it was really spicy! So if you want spicy, but not too spicy, ask them to go lite on the spicy ness. My friend got the deokbokki with ramen. When tht dish came, I was shocked by how big her plate was and how yummy it looked!!! They also serve bento boxes and miso with any rice dishes.  Their water tastes BAD. So bring your own water or order a beverage.  The music played there was nice, some oldies and some new . It just lightened up my mood!   I love yellow radish, so I asked for a side order of it and it came right away! Usually korean restaurants charge us for asking for extra so I was very pleased with that.  Unlike other Korean restaurants that Ive been to, this was the first to have omelettes!!! Although I did not get to try it, Id try it if I ever come back.

0TFU1Jgpq0odtQFw6Cam4Q.review_text: Short ribs tasted really good! And plus the Kalbi tang was delicious.

zJoInPA-9Vl0QTArpZa7mA.review_text: I took a friend here last night and was disappointed. There were only two servers, a spacy guy and an apathetic woman. We had to ask for everything, including the wiping of the table, water, those yummy side dishes, napkins, and the check. My friend thought the guy was stoned. The tea was tepid. The rest of the food was yummy (mondoo, grilled pork, bibimbap). Slipping on the service, though. When I kept asking for water, they kept bringing an additional one of those short thin glasses, instead of just refilling (they could have just left a pitcher); by the end of the night there were six small glasses, all for me! Not service-oriented. I was sorta embarrassed because my friend said that maybe it was because he was the only white guy there.

dP2vQRFB0xK5bD-aCGZM1w.review_text: the seafood bi bim bop is the f-ing shit. the best deal is probably the combo plates. holler at your short ribs cause that stuff was sooooo good. i'm a little bias because i know the folks that own the place but the food really is great. =)

AluWHw7YVlkz1PSAiVwNHQ.review_text: This place is a bit small--kind of blends in with the karaoke place next door.  Friendly service and reasonably priced food with a pretty extensive menu.  Oh, and there's plenty of parking!

oA2DE7VUGSn1o6YOpOhjoQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite Korean Restaurants in the city. I never came across any dish, that I did not like or love.  Here are my favorite dishes: Kabli, spicy pork, beef udon, gyoza, the clear noodles (i forgot how to spell it in Korean), rice stick noodles, spicy tofu soup and much more. Also, if you love flavored Soju...this is the place.  Prices seem good, there's plenty of parking and they are open late. What could you possible ask for...after a long night...hot soup! The best, especially after a night of drinking.  Though, i do have to remind you...not to wear anything nice, because you come out smelling like Korean food. ;) It's also a small place, but they have accommodated us before with a party of 10.

-4TvTEfp2m3Km8Orbb34xQ.review_text: We came here on a Thanksgiving day. I liked the tea and beer OB here. All the foods we ordered were excellent and on time. We ordered some soup, bulgogi plates, chicken teriyaki. I can recommend this place!

Vr6UaELspaEgqUE9MrAbIQ.review_text: I usually don't yelp anything, but because I've been here so many times, I figured why not?   I love this place! I honestly can't seem to find the assorted meat combo at any other Korean restaurant. That is my absolute favorite dish and the marinated rice stick with ramen noodles too. It's a small place, but the wait is never too long. The customer service is very friendly and the food comes out fairly quickly. Definitely a place where you can grab delicious Korean food in the middle of the night because it closes so late. Highly recommended!

Elr7_s3ySqU3hfJCsY705w.review_text: Food in the city generally runs pretty high, especially for Korean food. This place is very reasonable priced and the food is consistently good. There's a pretty decent variety on the menu and the portions are large, especially the bento box. Staff is friendly, booths are cute, and although I haven't tried it, people seem to love their sojus.   Been going here for a few years and will keep coming back  :)

jwW2bxNbCpZIcHuYL5JjYA.review_text: Not so much...  It's a Korean restaurant that gives you Miso soup with each lunch entree ?!? I soon found out it dabbles in other Japanese food as well - tempura, ton katsu, teriyaki....random! But what the heck...gotta try it right? The potstickers (also included with the lunch entree) tasted like they were frozen and microwaved right before serving. The vermicelli glass noodles (chap chae?) were dry and didn't have much flavor. The bi bim bap did look good, but the ton katsu was run of the mill. Of course you also get your typical lettuce with Thousand Island as your salad.   So bottom line...the food ain't all that. But for lunch specials, they do give you quite a lot. It's not bad food...just nothing special.

1sfQz6wE_6b_zWM-4mnC5A.review_text: You would go here if  Won Mi Bar B q is closed, and Won mi closes at 4am  so I feel there is really no excuse to even go there.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I love Korean food, so I was excited when my Korean GF suggested this place I haven't been before.  The place is very cafe like..so no issues with seating. The waitresses here are very sweet and attentive. Unfortunately, the food is mediocre and some of the items on the menu are a bit puzzling--The American Camp Soup--spicy korean soup with instant raman, sliced hotdogs and SPAM?!?! Way over the top!! It's like having KFC, Taco Bell Nachos, and a Big Mac all on one plate. The place also feels a bit dirty...Okay..not just feel..but really just is...I prefer to pick up some side dishes from Woo Ri Market and call it a day

cFYC07QgTSFK2NhN7jP6yQ.review_text: I haven't been here in awhile but thought it was ok overall. The menu has changed and added quite a few items that were pretty good. The pork was tasty and the fried chicken was good.

tud5Z99hvQe6mZDKMili_Q.review_text: They get one star because their dishes are half decent.   They don't get rest of the four stars because they have the worst service .  A couple of years ago, I went there for my friend's birthday. After we paid, we were gathering in front of the restaurant to decide where to go afterwards. A few minutes later, one of the waitresses came out and demanded for more tips. We gave 10% because their service wasn't that stellar. We had to wait over an hour to be seated and they never once came by to our table after the food came out. 10% tips were more than generous. My friend ended up giving them extra tips because he didn't want to make a fuss about it and ruined our friend's birthday.  I never intended to go back there, but after circling around Geary for parking last week, my friends and I gave up on eating around Geary. We went to Arang again because they have the convenience of parking. This time, they didn't even ask us whether we wanted anything to drink. We had to specifically ask for tea. They brought a small cup of tea for each of us. However, once we requested for a refill, they completely ignored us. They refilled the tea for the tables in front of us and behind us, but did not come by to our table. On top of that, they brought out the wrong order, of which they refused to take back.   Parking or no parking, we will never go back there ever again.

zGCnAhapfgsD3JmfUGp0xA.review_text: Parking was a b*tch.  Food was okay. I had the BBQ Beef and Tempera combo... which came with salad, miso soup, vermacelli, 2 potstickers, and potato thingies. Lunch special ends at 4... (Parking made us late!) Service was so-so, they didn't really check on us, and they didn't really refill tea until my friends & I were about to leave.

3l67H7uMgatj8oIi_ORW1Q.review_text: This place is hard to find, but a real good treat for late night korean.  It's atmosphere is very laid back and although it's a small place, there was plenty of seating and order options.  The tofu soup and spicy beef were both very good and flavorful, although the side dishes were a little odd.  Service was fine.  4/5 for the good prices, quantity of food, flavor and chill environment.

9diUfbLM6dQWisdIncA1Tg.review_text:
Very Few Appetizers, what gives??
 Good Kimchi Chege, I can't help it, I love that stuff. I guess I really do use that as wether a restaurant is good or not. But hey we all have some type of food yeah?
 I haven't tried much of anything else really, but everytime I go and I see my friends order other stuff, it kinda looks like a "bento box" We're in a korean restaurant right? Last I checked I thought so.
  Anyhow...Service is alright, and I do have to say the decor is better than Won mi. However, there is definately a reason why Won-mi, which is accross the street, does better than this place...

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: Thought I wrote a review for this place already, but guess I didn't. This place is pretty small and does get pretty packed. The place has a few tables and 3 booths. The place normally has 3 people working. The people waiting means this place is good.   No one would be waiting around a place with homeless sleeping a few feet away if the food wasn't good.

-3jtBudQjQpLzlG-apGc5A.review_text: I was not too impressed with the food here. This restaurant is totally hidden in this strip mall,and the restaurant is actually really small. My bf has been coming to this place for years. I ordered the seafood bibimbop and I just didn't enjoy it so much. The rice never really got crispy, the way I like it. The seafood was okay, a little too overcooked for me. My bf likes to order the beef bibimbop, but like I said , for me it was okay. I do have to say though, the price of the food was very reasonable. The service was slow and there was just one other table that was being served. The restaurant was really warm and there was just no circulation going on in there. With the hot bowl and the spiciness of the dish, it was almost unbearable in there. Maybe that's why I couldn't enjoy the food. I would give this place another try, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

jCtNC5E5-6O_GdELCUErmQ.review_text: Favorite Korean restaurant so far!  The service here is great, the lady greeted us in Korean too.  The price is reasonable and the wait isn't very long.  The place is cozy and nice, lights are pretty dim.. Good for small groups.  The food is awesome!  I love the appetizer plate they gave us with kimchi, fried spiced tofu, and all that good stuff.  The bibimbap is so cool, sizzling when served with a gorgeous egg on top.  The bento box food is also yummy, extremely filling!  It had a salad, rice, fried dumplings with noodles, and a variety of meat.  I tried the chicken katsu (kinda dry), beef (awesome), and seafood (okay, spicy).  I'm not a very big fan of the udon or dough thing in soup (tasteless).  The kimchi fried rice was too oily.  Other than that, I would definitely come back with my friends to try the other food on the menu.

a172mNbJ8PLkvD7iEpEh1w.review_text: LA which is known as the largest Korean community, and then moving up to SF...the Korean food is mediocre.  I'd rather eat any other cuisine rather than Korean.  I can probably cook a better meal at my house.  Had there ddukbokki which was decent, but everything else there was just TERRIBLY BAD.  My sister told me she ordered a bento box for dinner and she got no side dishes and they were kind enough to give her some kimchi.  Kinda lame...

DuhDrFhqhUt-U-iLMW8Chw.review_text: "Yo Crazy Dave, remember that soup we had last time you visited me in LA?" -DM  "Yeah, yeah that's kal bi tang." -CD  "All I remember was being so f*ck*d up but that soup was so good.  I want some more of that shit." -DM  "Oh I know a place close to where me and Fos use to live, near the ghetto." -CD  Sorry, I didn't mean to let the horse out of the barn, but that's how I got here.  Kal bi tang, a clean and refreshing short rib soup and it was de-licious.  Second time around I learned "Danger" was not my middle name.  I tried some kim chee, spam, kung fu, sausage casserole and it's been changed to "Monsta" since.  All names, location, and date, may have been changed to protect the identity of those involved.

C_rEBO2yMm6QbqOmFD5Y4w.review_text: My friend and I went to this restaurant by another friend's recommendation. It's basically a hole in the wall restaurant. No, like literally, the front was just a door. We walked in and seated ourselves, without much of a greeting from the staff. The tables were pretty small and very close together. It didn't make a very comfortable seating arrangement. We were quickly served with that barley or rice tea thing. It took a while before we could order, or get a glass of water for that matter. I requested a glass of water three times before actually receiving it. We ordered what was like a Kimchi hotpot and some fried chicken. The hotpot came very quickly. It was filled with Kimchi stew mixed with some random processed meat like spam and hotdogs, and a hint of ground pork, and some packaged ramen noodles topped with some refried beans. It wasn't very appetizing to look at or taste. It was the most bland Kimchi stew base I've ever tasted, and they weren't even generous with the "meat." It took a while for our fried chicken to come, and when it did it looked very.... well, it looked like they fried it while it was still frozen. It tasted like they didn't put ANY seasonings, not even salt. The staff wasn't very friendly towards us either. It was an overall disappointing experience.

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: This is the worst korean food that I've ever had in my life... I'm not even Korean and I can cook better Korean food than Arang... I know this place is very special to EJ, but I don't think I will ever be able to like it... We stopped by here for a snack... In EJ terms, a snack is actually a meal... He had the dolsot bibimbap and I had the chicken katsu lunchbox...   The rice in the dolsot was burnt and really dry... the veggies also very dry... the whole thing was just overcooked...  The chicken katsu had a really weird taste... not edible at all... The prices are definitely cheap for lunch, but since they food is so bad, they should be paying you to eat it...
